title: Great location for the family trip to NYC
text: We did a family trip to NYC with our kids to check out the typical tourist sites for a week. Location of Mint House is great to walk lower Manhattan, or jump on a Subway. At check in, the desk the was incredibly helpful an welcoming. The unit was spacious, modern, and very clean. Daily refreshes provided linens and most consumables (including really good coffee from the third wave shop downstairs). There was a late party in the unit next to us one night, but the management dealt with it and made it right.

title: Forget those overpriced Midtown places, Mint House in the Financial District is the way to go!
text: Forget those overpriced Midtown places, Mint House in the Financial District (FiDi) is the way to go!  We were looking forward to the roomy (for NY rooms) Studio Deluxe and were delighted to be upgraded to an even bigger 2 Bathroom 1 Bedroom with a full kitchen (full size stove, dishwasher and refrigerator) stocked with equipment. Loved the stylish decor, 2 big tables and good lighting. Malik at the front desk helped with restaurant and movie theater recommendations, very thoughtful! The full supermarket in the basement helped us save money by getting snacks and breakfast and the excellent Black Fox coffee shop in the lobby of this amazing Art Deco building helped start each day right. There is a subway stop (2/3 red line) 10 steps from the coffee shop (literally across the street) and it was an easy walk to the 9/11 museum, Battery Park, Wall Street and Trinity Church (site of Hamilton's grave), Little Italy, Chinatown and the Brooklyn Bridge. We also used the Shop Your Stay service which had reasonable prices and no service fee, highly recommend. We felt safe walking around FiDi day and night.  Before we arrived, I had to move the reservation dates around and the front desk employees made sure every change was done correctly.

title: A Vibe
text: The Apt was immaculate, spacious and clean! Every bit of home without being in your actual house. Well equipped with all your basic needs, from robes to full kitchen sets, knives, dishes and 2 tea kettles. Definitely a must stay when Im in the city.

title: Great room, convenient location.
text: Our room went beyond our expectations. Very spacious clean and comfortable. We could have lived there! The location is very convenient for walking to the Freedom Tower, piers, Brooklyn bridge, and many more sites.

title: Amazing place to stay in family
text:
It’s always hard to decide if an Airbnb or an hotel when you’re traveling with kids. Airbnb are goods but you have to do the cleaning so oh never rest. Hotels are good but usually need to rent 2 rooms so it become more expensive.
Mint house is an apartment, with kitchen and two spaces and they clean your room and offer room service as any other hotel. 
Defenderle the best place to stay with kids in New York.
Location and everything was good too, with a metro literally in front of the hotel.

title: Ten + Hotel
text: This hotel was absolutely perfect in every way.  A warning...the bed is so comfortable that it is very difficult to leave it.  I wish I could bring home the pillows. I was very surprised at the large space and absolutely every box was ticked as far as staying in a hotel in NYC.  Perfection.  I will happily return.

title: fire alarms
text: fire alarms set off at 1030 PM no staff to guide/instruct. large party in lobby no one left the party with fire alarms. Party continued to 1 am. very loud music and people heard on second floor. Unable to sleep both nights of my stay

title: The Mint House
text: Overall an excellant place.  Convenient to the Battery  and Wall street.  Convenient to boats to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.  Took the free ferry to Staten island and visited the Smithsonian  American Indian in the old Custom house.  9/11 memorial is nearby

title: Mint house 70 pine st
text: Great location, comfortable bed, full kitchen, lots of room.  More of apartment than hotel room. Got a great deal on travel zoo. Easy location to metro. Elevator is bonus. Would definitely stay again when in nyc.

title: Family City Break
text: Second time staying at Mint House at 70 Pine for Spring Break. The apartments are wonderful - quiet, spacious, clean and comfortable. Love the downtown location and building amenities. It is easy to access any part of the city on foot or via subway, and grocery stores are right around the corner.

title: Best NYC hotel.
text: What a great place. Really big room with updated kitchen area.  loved the record player and the whole place was very clean. Great bed and pillows. The staff was terrific and very helpful and friendly.  There are lots of restaurants nearby and we took the subway  easily to other parts of NYC. Can’t wait to go back!

title: EXCELLENT STAY
text: Room size, cleanliness and location were good. We recommend this address to our loved ones and we will return without hesitation. The only negative point is the use of a code to take the elevator and enter the room.

title: Beautiful space
text: I must say I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The tranquility of the space and its welcoming ambiance truly made my experience memorable. Not to mention, the bed was incredibly comfortable. I would love the opportunity to stay again.

title: Perfect for a longer stay!
text: I was traveling alone and felt  safe. The hotel room/apartment was clean, the rooms are comfortable and large, and there was a very friendly and helpful staff. They always greeted me by name with a big smile. Only setback is there’s not a lot of light or views  bc of proximity of neighboring buildings.

title: Top Hotel in Manhattan
text: Sehr schönes Hotel in Manhattan sehr tolles Personal und immer hilfsbereit. Die Zimmer sind sehr groß und sauber nur bei der Reinigung hätte hier und da mal was gefehlt wie z. B. Toilettenpapier oder die Reinigung der Seifenablage. Die Lage in Lower Manhattan ist top mit der Station Wall Street direkt gegenüber sehr gut alles zu erreichen

title: Great experience!
text: Great value for money! Room was very spacious and comfortable. Fully equipped kitchen is not common thing in New York hotel rooms. Vinyl player and good quality cosmetics were nice touch. Overall I highly recommend this place!

title: A wonderful gem in the middle of Wall Street
text:
We had a wonderful stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. Practical location with the best coffee in New York and a very well-stocked supermarket. Huge and (mostly quiet) rooms!
You even have a smart TV and record player in your room which was nice!

title: Excellent apartments
text: We stayed in 2 apartment types here - for 2 weeks we were in a 1 bed 2 bath, then we stayed in the studio plus for a few days. Both rooms were very spacious and had plenty of storage space. Apartments were also fully furnished and equipped for us to feel at home. For example, we had enough kitchen equipment to cook our dinners and even store leftovers. Furnishing was thoughtfully thought through with enough space to store our suitcases and hangers to hang up our clothes. The laundry room was a big bonus for us given the long stay, and only cost $2.75 each for a wash/dry.

title: Des français à NYC
text: Grande chambre avec double fenêtres. Qualité de la literie très bonne et très confortable comme dans un nuage. Cuisine entièrement aménagée tout équipée. Nombreux rangements et coffre fort. Bémol sur la salle de bain qui dénote un peu avec le reste (très simple, petite baignoire, les éléments sont positionnées très bas:baignoire, toilettes  et derouleur de papier). Systeme d'éclairage modulable un plus pour cette pièce. L'emplacement de la chambre est relativement calme hormis le passage des poubelles.

title: A Hidden Gem in NYC
text: I frequently stay at Mint House in NYC for my business travel. It is my go-to Hotel given the proximity to my office and the quality of the rooms offered. The rooms are huge by NYC standards and are very well appointed. I also appreciate the keyless access to both the elevators and rooms. The staff is always friendly and extremely helpful.

title: Roomy, clean, comfortable apartment with excellent appointments
text: Roomy, clean, comfortable apartment with excellent appointments. My studio suite apartment had a separate living room, hall, full kitchen, large bedroom and roomy bathroom. Everything was perfectly clean, with modern furnishings and excellent details like a turntable, large TV, free wifi with a good connection and plenty of closet and dresser space. I would highly recommend for a longer work trip. Priced right as well.

title: Highly recommend
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Mint House. The space, amenities, cleanliness, location…all superb! Would definitely recommend and would stay here again. Felt like an apartment rather than a hotel! A+++

title: Big Apple Comfort
text: The pillows were unbelievably fluffy. But seriously, the hospitality was outstanding and the convenience of the Black Fox coffee shop, lower level grocer, and top notch restaurants on-site can not be overstated. Easy walk to the 9-11 Memorial and the ferry service. Overall, a comfortable, surprisingly quiet location with an attentive, courteous staff.

title: Wonderful place to stay in FiDi
text: This is a wonderful place to stay in FiDi.  The building is a beautiful 1920s building. There is a Black Fox delicious coffee/breakfast/lunch/pastry place in lobby. And Blue Park for lunches and pick up dinners. There are also 2 upscale restaurants and a bar in the building, and grocery store next door.  Our one bedroom apartment was spacious and very comfortable. Full kitchen (although no freezer in our unit). 2 large tvs and a great bathroom with a soaking tub and separate walk in shower. There is also daily maid service. The staff were to a person lovely and helpful. Special shout out to Will! We look forward to staying again,

title: Excellent séjour dans financial district
text: Structure de type appart-hotel tres bien localisée dans financial district à 10 minutes de marche de battery Park et du mémorial 9/11. Les appartements (le nôtre disposait de 2 chambres) sont spacieux, bien décorés, très propres et calmes. Il y a un supermarché et des restaurants dans l’immeuble ce qui est très pratique. Convient parfaitement aux familles avec enfants. Accueil très agréable.

title: Great FiDi location, clean and roomy accommodations
text: Mint House is a great place to stay while visiting Manhattan.  It's within walking distance to many sites and there is a supermarket located in the same building which makes it easy to stock up on snacks and breakfast items.  The rooms are spacious, clean, and offer a vinyl record player. Bed and pillows were very comfy.   Bathrooms are very spacious and accommodating.  70 Pine is an historic building with art deco interior and a fabulous roof top bar and restaurant that offers amazing views of NYC.

title: Séjour fantastique
text:
Excellent choix, nous étions 4 (1 couple avec nos 2 ados) dans un appartement 1 chambre au 2eme étage, c’était très bien. Nous n’avons pas été gênés par le bruit de la rue, l’immeuble était calme et le service de ménage impeccable. Le café, le thé et les pastilles lave vaisselle recharges tous les jours, les serviettes changées et les lits refaits tous les matins. 
Le Mint House est idéalement situé, nous avons pu faire beaucoup de choses à pieds (mémorial 9/11, embarcadère statue de la liberté, pont de Brooklyn, Wall Street). C’est aussi très accessible par le métro depuis JFK.
Pour les courses il y a un supermarché juste en bas. Attention c’est hors de prix, ils ne sont pas tellement aimables avec les touristes et nous avons eu l’impression de nous faire plumer à chaque visite mais ce sont les prix new-yorkais…

title: Not worth the price
text: For how cheap and un-elevated my experience felt, I would have been better off at a Hampton Inn. You can feel how they are attempting to save money at almost every 'interaction' with the technology and the lack of amenities was a disappointment at this price point.

title: Beautiful, giant room with kitchen
text:
The room was beautiful and huge - essentially a studio apartment with kitchen (including oven, full refrigerator/freezer, dishwasher, microwave, and toaster). We hand washed our dishes each morning (just plates and cups - we didn't cook beyond toasting bagels and reheating leftovers), but cleaning staff put the dishes away each day. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We were given a code for elevator and door, so no room key to keep track of.

If you are driving, be aware that the hotel is on a narrow, one-lane road, with no place to pull out. We arrived on a Saturday, so not much traffic, and we were able to pull over enough for folks to get around us while we checked in and dropped off our luggage, but that might be tough on a weekday. Also, it's not well-marked outside, or inside. It shares a space with apartments and restaurants, and there are no signs at the entry pointing you to the hotel (the hotel office is to the right and then the back).

title: Great stay at Mint House
text: Excellent stay at Mint House. The rooms are huge and very well equipped. The only downside was that there’s not much natural light as you are surrounded by tall buildings. The staff are friendly and helpful. We really liked staying in lower manhattan and there’s a subway station across the road for when you want to go uptown.

title: Super séjour, super studio, super accueil
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel du 29 novembre au 2 décembre 2023. 
L'accueil est irréprochable (on nous a même donné la chambre en avance). J'ai même eu le droit à des fleurs pour mon anniversaire ! 
Mention spéciale à la jeune fille qui nous a parlé en français à notre arrivée. 

L'hotel est bien placé, collé au métro Wall Street. Le check out a été fait rapidement, on nous a gardé nos valises à l’accueil pendant notre dernière journée. 

Super adresse, nous recommandons

title: Amazing Urban place …
text: Everything was fantastic, excellent location, in the same building. supermarket, restaurants, Room top, gym. Impeccable service, they immediately resolved all my requirements. Modern urban concept room that I loved.

title: Parfait pour un voyage en famille !
text:
Nous avions choisi l'appartement pour avoir 3 couchages et 2 salles de bain. L'appartement était très spacieux (environ 130 m2) avec une grande chambre et 2 canapé-lits. La cuisine est bien équipée pour pouvoir préparer de vrais repas. Les salles de bain sont propres mais mériteraient un rafraichissement  pour être au même niveau que le reste de l'appartement.
Le quartier de Wall Street est très agréable et nous permet avec le métro d'être en 15 minutes à Time Square. L'hôtel est situé juste à côté de One World Observatory et Ground Zero.

title: Luxurious and cozy home away from home
text: The amenities, aesthetic, and luxury of the building made our experience go above and beyond our expectations. I would recommend this to anyone visiting NY for business or leisure. I definitely plan on coming back!

title: Wall Street Find
text: We wanted to stay downtown near the 9?11 Memorial and chose the Mint House for location primarily-an easy two block walk. We did not imagine that this would be our favorite hotel in the city, regardless of location. It is on an extremely quiet street and in a glorious Art Deco building with an original Art Deco granite interior. The rooms are quite modern and huge--the largest room we have ever stayed in--and are equipped with a full kitchen with full-sized appliances including a full-sized stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, and microwave. It even has a turntable and records! And getting uptown is easy since it is close to the FDR. The staff were lovely, including the front desk and housekeeping. The hotel and room were spotless, we never waited for an elevator, and it was quiet as a mouse at night. Some good restaurants and a rooftop bar on site. Cannot say enough about this special place.

title: Great location and staff
text: I had such a great experience at this location. I planned a Valentine’s Day stay and I was so anxious about getting a room with a stand alone tub. Everyone I spoke to went above and beyond to make sure I had the room I wanted and even upgraded me! So kind and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay. I will definitely recommend mint house to everyone I know and I’ll definitely be back! Thank you so much! ☺️

title: NYC Home Away from Home
text: From check-in to check-out and everything in between, the focus is on genuine hospitality infused with tech and small touches that make Mint House at 70 Pine our new NYC home away from home. We highly recommend a stay here when visiting NYC, especially if you are looking for a downtown stay.

title: A different type of hotel
text: If you're looking for the comfort of an apartment instead of a hotel room while in New York, Mint House is the place for you!  It is about 2 blocks from the New York Stock Exchange and 6 blocks from the 911 Memorial and One World Trade Center.  There's a subway station just a couple of blocks away.  The building has a grocery store & deli, a coffee shop, and a restaurant.  The rooms are large (really apartments) and very comfortable.  They have full kitchens and very comfortable beds.  I highly recommend Mint House!

title: Mint House Feb 2024
text:
very pleasant stay
very welcoming staff 
super friendly and helpful 
great value for money
studio apt is very spacious
ideal location
with gym in the basement
and grocery store two steps away
financial district is more quiet than the rest of manhattan in the evening is quite pleasant 🙏🏻❤️

title: Paul’s Service
text: Paul's outstanding service truly impressed me. He promptly and effectively repaired my shower, showcasing a remarkable combination of expertise and compassion. Thanks to Paul's professionalism, my overall experience was absolutely fantastic. I highly recommend him for making my trip unforgettable!

title: Not your typical hotel
text:
A property that wants to stand out needs to do a lot of things differently.
These accommodations are not cookie cutter in my opinion.
Room size and furnishings are well conceived and a delight to the occupant.
A basement gym is big enough for you to spread out and enjoy your work out without the need to share benches, machines or free weights.
A bar/restaurant located on the lobby was playing melodic hip hop and is inviting too.
Staff at the registration desk are cheerful and interested in your wellbeing.
I will be back.

title: A great stay at a well designed hotel
text: We found the experience at the Mint House to be impeccable - all the staff were friendly and engaging and the room was spotless with the added benefit of a good quality record player and assortment of discs. We especially loved having the bathroom lighting control include a dimmer  switch to minimize the usual shock of bright lights when used during the night.

title: Business Trip
text: The Mint House is centrally located to the financial district and is a great place to stay for business or pleasure.   The rooms are spacious and always clean.  I love the option to listen to music via a record player in my room.   The amenities are an added plus.  The gym is nice, and there is enough equipment for everyone.

title: Paul Service
text: Paul's exceptional service left me thoroughly impressed. He swiftly and efficiently fixed my shower, demonstrating a remarkable blend of skill and kindness. My overall experience was nothing short of amazing, thanks to Paul's professionalism. Highly recommend made my trip amazing :)

title: My favorite NY stay!!
text:
Wonderful experience - HUGE rooms, very clean and updated, and a delicious coffee shop in the lobby. This was a perfect stay if you’re traveling for business. My favorite New York City stay to-date. I’ll definitely be back. 
My only contention is that it was a bit difficult to find.

title: Quiet weekend locale - away from the maddening crowds.
text: Booked a one night stay to see a show and grab dinner with friends.  This was an exceptionally clean, artsy, quiet boutique hotel.  It is down in the Financial district but literally the Wall St stop on the 2 line is right across the street.  A 15 minute ride gets you to mid-town.  We didn't use many amenities, but we are staying again next month and my wife is considering cancelling her stay at another location and switching her trip with her girlfriend to the Mint house.

title: Great Room and Great Staff
text: Great concierge staff, Thanary was so so helpful and understanding - whenever I need another stay in the city, will absolutely return! These rooms are quite literally a home away from home and there’s nothing better than not having to eat out for every meal. The record players are such a fun touch as well. I do wish the TVs had at least one streaming subscription on them and the beds are lower than I like, but those are my only critiques. Will also recommend to friends coming to stay in the city for a bit.

title: The perfect getaway
text:
Everything was perfect from check in to check out. 
The staff were friendly, efficient, and never missed a beat.
We stayed in a studio plus which was spotless clean and absolutely spectacular.
We will definitely be returning.
Perfect stay!

title: Wonderful Apartment
text: I enjoyed staying at the Mint House - very clean and spacious. Wonderful staff as well! I would definitely recommend my family and friends to this place. Many things are local to the area of where Mint House is located as well.

title: Beautiful Room and Great Downtown Location
text: This hotel is located in the financial district not far from the south street seaport. It has a small welcome desk hidden way in the back of the lobby.  The receptionist was very friendly. we had some trouble with the room key but after getting a new card and code we were able to get into our room.  The room was very large for NYC, decorated nicely and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excelente
text:
Muito bem localizado, amplo, cozinha completa, acessórios bons, banheiro bom, limpeza diária , equipe muito atenciosa e disponível.
Várias linhas do metrô próximas, estação Wall Street servida por varias linhas quase em frente

title: Great value for money!
text: The room was huge, more like an apartment than hotel room. The decor was cool and the room was equipped with everything you needed. The entrance to the hotel is a bit hidden and not the typical hotel entrance. There is a great cafe next to the entrance but the room has a coffee machine as well. I will definitely be back!

title: Great space poor temperature control
text: Amazing space in a convenient well connected part of town. Unfortunately the heating had been set to over 80 degrees and although we instantly changed the setting we all slept poorly that first night. This was not helped by outside street noise. Second night was quieter and cooler. Great coffee shops and lots to walk to nearby.

title: As advertised. You feel at home!
text: Mint used to be Q&A when I first visited. One promise is that you will feel at home right in the middle of NYC. You have a lot of space too in the rooms which is a luxury in NYC. If I am back in NyC Mint House is where I will stay.

title: Stunning Art Deco Building
text: We stayed here for our honeymoon in one of the apartments. Very spacious, well designed & clean. The building itself is stunning Art Deco elegance which is just up our street. The apartment was well equipped & modern. The bed very comfortable. It was well located & you can grab breakfast downstairs or treat yourself to a sundowner in the bar also situated in the foyer. Loved it!

title: Great experience at Mint House New York
text: Excellent experience across the board, I highly recommend Mint House. Great value for the money. Location es fantastic if you want to be in downtown Manhattan. Beautiful art deco building. Room is huge for NYC standards, cool and modern, very comfortable. It has a real kitchen, fully equipped. Staff is very friendly and responsive. Great coffee shop downstairs. I highly recommend Crown Shy restaurant also in the same building. all in all 5/5 experience. We'll be back.

title: A diamond in the rough
text: It’s a hidden gem!  Super friendly staff (shout out to Djeneba and Will). Very spacious rooms w kitchen and dining table; could stay here a week! Comfortable beds. Love the throwback records and turntable in each room. Walking distance to cool bars/restaurants or Uber anywhere. Can’t wait to return!

title: Compliments for Mint House hotel New york
text: Very pleasant stay, room much more spacious than the usual hotel rooms in New York, possibility to do a little cooking, small grocery store at the foot of the hotel very useful! ... very friendly staff! Hotel that we will probably choose on a next visit to the city that never sleeps!

title: Spacious, Comfortable, Convenient - Stay here!!
text: An amazing stay in a new-to-us neighborhood. Incredibly spacious and well-furnished by NYC lodging standards, conveniently located five minutes or less from a number of great dining establishments and the subway to get you anywhere else in the city you want to go. We had such a good time here and will surely be back.

title: Spacious Apartments
text: I love staying here. All floor plans for the apartments are so spacious. There are so many amenities in the building and in the area. They are also pet friendly. By far, my favorite place to stay in NYC.

title: Great trip
text: Everything was excellent  great spot for visiting lower Manhattan and a short subway ride to midtown  or uptown. The view and Cocktails at Overstory on the 64th floor are spectacular even on the cold night we were there.

title: Great hotel
text: We come to New York City pretty often and we’ve stayed at several nice hotels. None of them even compare to The Mint House. The room was very clean and very spacious. All the staff including Gezzel, Thanary, Jessica and Will were unbelievably nice, helpful, and pleasant. They couldn’t have done more for us during our stay. We will definitely be staying here from now on. What a great place!

title: A gem in NYC Financial District
text: Beautiful building and spacious rooms. Extremely helpful & friendly front desk. Linens were clean & good quality (not tattered or worn). Appreciate the boxed water (we love a sustainable business!) and all the amenities of the room. Well stocked kitchen and everything was clean and functioned well. Only drawback was the temperature control was difficult and the bed slept hot (but it was comfortable). 4-night business trip.

title: Nice stay and good location !
text: The service and the the rooms are really nice. The coworking space is big enough with good furniture. The location next to Brooklyn bridge and transportations is good but for someone who’s used to the sun, it’s dark all day long. The receptionists and technical support are kind and cheerful !

title: Engagement Stay
text: I had stayed here previously for an anniversary and had decided to book this hotel for my engagement as well. They had been super accommodating providing flowers and chocolates for myself and my fiance. Really made our trip special, the rooms are huge the buildings has great amenities and restaurants surrounding it. If you get a chance would recommend SAGA/Overstory and Crown Shy Felice 15 that is also nearby is stellar.

title: Lovely stay at MH 70 Pine
text: Great property especially if you want to be downtown. The onsite customer service was terrific. Dining within the building was excellent. (Crown Shy, a Michelin star restaurant, was a real treat.) The unit was very clean.

title: Great New York experience
text: What a great experience, after years of staying in small Manhattan hotel rooms it was unbelievable to walk into our room at Mint House. Really great location and service would highly recommend and will be back again for sure

title: Phenomenal!
text: Unmatched. Phenomenal from start to finish. Staff on the reception desk were just amazing and a huge help during our stay. The rooms are HUGE and spotless. Incredibly modern. Phenomenal area in the middle of FIDI. Will never stay anywhere else when visiting NYC again. Can never be beaten.

title: Best for a family
text: The room condition was clean and convenient. It was so cozy that my family didn't want to go out. I love the building has a supermarket and a cafe. The staffs and services were also super nice. The requests by the app took some time to start chatting but the actions were fast enough. The location was also great. Everywhere in lower Manhattan is in ten minutes walking. The stay was absolutely good!

title: Perfect place to stay
text: Excellent place to stay, just one block from wall street and subway. The premises are great with big spaces. Definitely a place to be if you are going to Manhattan and want to have the best price and quality

title: Fantastic stay!
text: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights. Our stay was fantastic - we checked in easily, the room was so clean and a brilliant size. We were woken 1 night by an alarm on another building outside but this could happen anywhere! My husband used the gym each day and absolutely loved it, said it was unlike any other hotel gym he has used before. The location was close to various subway stations. It was perfect for us as we were out all day every day sightseeing. If you are someone who would like to return to your hotel part way through the day, it would be a bit of a faff having to go downtown part way through the day Each day but for us it was perfect.

title: Customer Service as warm as a beach Holiday !
text:
My job depends on my customer service, making sure every need and detail is anticipated. I never expect anyone to work as hard as I do, but randomly when someone does, I get really excited to share. The Mint house is really the place you want to stay when you’re in NY. The rooms are huge. Beds super comfy. Everyone gets a record player!!!!They will stock the fridge for you if you ask. You can tell the front desk folks actually love working there. Which leads me to believe they have a great hotel manager. People take care of people best when they are taken care of in the first place. 
Thank you Mint House & Thanary for taking care of us on our first family trip to NYC. You made it very special. And I’ll look for more Mint Houses in other states now too!

title: Excellent !
text: Experience excellente, avec une chambre et un service conforme a ce qui est montré et raconté. les chambres sont vraiment top, spacieuses et totalement clean ! je renouvelerai l'experience les yeux fermés sans problème !

title: Moyen
text: Studio de luxe...très grand très bien aménagé. Décoré avec goût. Très sombre car petite rue étroite et vis à vis mais plutôt calme la nuit. Eviter les premiers étages car on entend comme si fenêtre ouverte. Clim chauffage assez bruyant obligé de le faire couper. Selon l heure le matin eau chaude douche bof. Ménage moyen, passage quotidien pour serviettes ,par contre pas très sérieux..2 serviettes pour 3 tous les jours....pénible. un conseil ne rien laisser traîner...personnel réception très pro néanmoins. Dommage...

title: Fantastic spacious apartment
text: A modern, clean very spacious 2 bedroom apartment. It had everything you needed to facilitate a week long family holiday in New York. Lots of kitchen utensils, pots etc, washing machine, dryer, dining table. The location is well serviced by a number of subway lines. Staff very friendly and attentive.

title: All-In-One
text:
A fantastic place to stay if you're visiting for a couple nights. Rooms are very clean, spacious, and come equipped with record players! (Nothing sounds better than a vinyl). The service was fantastic and had slept great in their soft beds.

The building has 2 Michelin Star restaurants (Saga and Crown Shy) in it, and the #17 ranked cocktail bar worldwide (Overstory) atop the tower with 360 breathtaking views of the city. Mint House is comfortably located within walking distance of Tribeca, Soho, Chinatown, Brooklyn Bridge, Flat Iron, Seaport, Tin Building, Wall Street, and much much more!

HIGHLY recommend to anyone looking for a great place to stay.

title: Great place to stay for family Christmas trip
text: A really great place to stay.  The 24x7 staff on the first floor was really friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and comfortable.  The rooms and elevators are secured by your private code so a very safe place to stay.  Subway M-F entrance is across the street and just a block further away on weekends.  Highly recommend.

title: So Good I Extended My Stay! 10/10 Perfect Service! Amazing Rooms! Clean! WILL COME AGAIN
text: Mint House exceeded our expectations!  Fantastic service; problems were quickly fixed. Motivated by the group, I'll go back and suggest. I even asked for a job application. What hospitality! Come here

title: Xmas Break @ Mint House
text: Excellent stay, fast/efficient check in & out, spacey rooms, parking and subway just opposite, very comfy, walkable everywhere to the lower Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridge...overall a wise and exceptional choice...!!

title: From FL to NY
text:
I have visited Mint House 70 Pine over the years and have even recommended it to family and friends, but this time around I must say that I was surprised by the changes in amenities (no access to bowling and no more complimentary water). Needless to say,   I still had a good time. Gizzel at the front desk made alternative suggestions that I was comfortable with and assisted with a problem I had with my reservation. Thank you Mint House for another good visit.

-Mr. Davis

title: Spacious Stay in the Heart of Lower Downtown
text: What a delightful find in the heart of Wall Street.  It's the perfect place for an extended stay or if you need a large space for a family vacation.  Staff, T, David, Djeneba , Gizzel, all go out of the way to make sure you got what you need at the front desk.  In room vinyl record player a bit overtly hip, but you do appreciate the full Fellows Coffee pour over set up with great boutique coffee in room from the Black Fox a plus.  In this amazing art deco building is the Black Fox for coffee, full grocery store, amazing bowls at the Blue Park Kitchen, a Michelin starred restaurant, and cocktails on the top floor.  Overall a great find, super convenient to subways and a short walk to the 2 train at Fulton for JKF.  We will be back that's for sure.

title: Lovely location, spacious rooms!
text: Extremely spacious rooms for NYC standards, great location downtown in the same building as Overstory which is a top 50 bar in the world. Friendly staff and definitely a home away from home feel with the amenities of a kitchen, etc

title: Beautiful apartment, too bad about the cleanliness.
text: "We booked through a third-party website, the apartment is really nice, and the staff is friendly. However, we noticed that the cleanliness is lacking. The floor is never swept, and we found the bathroom dirty.

title: Perfect experience, wonderful apartment.
text:
Mint House simply can't be beat -- it's by far my favorite place to stay in NYC. I always enjoy the cleanliness and style, the turntable and records, and the location.

I really can't recommend them highly enough, if you're looking for a full apartment.

title: Total Win at the Mint House
text:
I stayed at the Mint House for a long weekend getaway as a solo mama with a 9 and 12 year old in tow. We are regular wandering souls and love to adventure. The Mint House worked so well for us, and I would definitely return with my partner for a couples getaway also. The amenities were great--all that you need to make a meal, super delish complementary coffee (slow pour method) in the apartment, a great selection of vinyl records to enjoy in the apartment. Beds were comfy, lighting was good, and the vibe of the staff was great. The building itself is a cool art deco building, with a grocery store (City Acres) in the building, and a few restaurants and a coffee shop (and more, but we didn't explore it all). It was also quiet, and we didn't hear the sound of room doors closing, or folks walking in the hallway at all. 
The location is definitely on the southern tip of Manhattan, but the subway was only a few blocks and the South Street seaport was close, with some great views the the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges. I am not super into huge crowds or heavily touristy vibes, so this was just perfect for what we needed. Great overall.

title: Only place we will stay in the city!
text: The Mint House at 70 Pine is perfect for a family stay in the city. The rooms are spacious, clean, and  modern. Everything you need is right there. The staff is so friendly. We won’t ever stay anywhere else!

title: Wonderful, cosy stay
text:
We had a very comfortable week staying here. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious and the large bed really comfortable. Really lovely toiletry products and good quality Tazo teabags. The coffee was nice but making it was a little complicated and it took a long time and I wasn’t always successful, so I don’t think
I was doing it quite right. The kitchenette was well equipped. The only frustrating issue staying here is having to use an app instead of a room key card and also for use of the elevator. If it doesn’t work then you have to type in a rather long code, not an easy 4 digit one! Maybe it’s more secure that way. Overall, we had a wonderful stay.

title: Felt at home
text: We did not want to stay in Times Square, so the Mint House was the perfect option for us.  Access to the subways was super convenient, and we were able to walk to all of the fun sites in lower Manhattan.  It was much better than staying in a hotel.  We were comfortable in our spacious apartment that made us feel at home.

title: Don’t stay here, management doesn’t care
text: Garbage collection outside my room both nights was outrageous.  3am and 6am loud roar of garbage trucks allowed for zero sleep.  This is for a hotel charging $450 for the first night and $650 the second night.  Management never contacted me after my complain at 3am, they offered $75 off which is nowhere near worth the lost sleep.  I bring a good amount of other rooms to the Mint House and management couldn’t even give me a call to talk through the issue.  The hotel is dark.  Some of the room layouts are really weird.  There are many other hotels in the area with managements who will care about you.  Other nice apartment hotels as well. Mint House, you’ll never see me or my corporate business again.

title: Mint House stay - Late November to early December
text: Excellent property, great staff, love the gym access.  We always enjoy our stay at Mint House and really do appreciate the fact that the team go out of their way to make us feel welcome.  We have been staying at Mint House 3 to 4 times per year for the past 3 years and have grown to really appreciate what it offers.  It was very busy this time so house-keeping was a little inconsistent in terms of service.  The rates were also very high during one part of our visit, particularly the last night

title: Great location!
text: Great location, love the turn down service! Hard to find if you don't know the area. The building is under construction so tricky to get in. Rooms are really spacious, wish I was staying longer to enjoy that part.

title: Amazing stay
text: Mint House has beautifully decorated large rooms in the financial district. It is hard to express how much the rooms feel like you are at home in an apartment versus the often cold feel of a hotel. This is an unbelievable place to stay if you want to be near the financial district. When you walk into your room prepare to be amazed!

title: spacious apartment with a cool vibe
text: the apartment was great , plenty of room, nice amenities, minimalist modern feel, loved that it had a vinyl player in the room  . Had a kitchen I did not use bc of short stay but looked well equipped.   Location was good if you need to be in the financial district. Check in staff was nice and helpful

title: Great place in the Financial District!
text: Perfect and quiet place to stay for a trip to NYC! The apartment had everything we needed for my family of 4! Kitchen was fully stocked and spacious. Will definitely stay here again when we come back next time!

title: Great hotel for a short stay.
text: Great location in lower Manhattan if work takes you to that part of the city. Its a beautiful older building with art deco features and attractive interior housing several other businesses alongside the hotel. The hotel decor can be best described as moody....wall hangings were faces of young people which I did not find attractive at all.... hall corridors and the ambiance of the bedroom was too dark for my taste. However, the kitchenette was efficient and well stocked with cutlery and crockery and cookware. Modern appliances - fridge, dishwasher...Everything was squeaky clean. Bathroom was clean with modern fittings and toiletries were a NY brand. Malin and Goetz. Personal welcome note and snacks were a welcome touch.

title: Hidden gem
text:
Great experience. We were a family of four and found the apartment quite comfortable and large for NYC standards. The bedding is out of this world comfortable. Staff is friendly, accommodating and helpful. The best supermarket in the area is right under the building -
11 Acres, offering great variety of products and pretty good prices. Gym, co-working space, coffee shop, everything great!

title: Only place I stay downtown
text: HUGE rooms (bigger than an nyc apt), Malin & Gotez amenities, gorgeous historic building - made my business trip feel like a vacation. Rob (I think a manager?) was super nice & helpful - he remembered my name each time I ran into him and helped me with multiple reservations.

title: The Mint House Does Not Disappoint
text:
I’ve stayed here in 2021 and have been eagerly looking forward to my return; this trip proved why. Thanary, Gizel, and Jessica have been extremely helpful in assisting me with extending my reservations and helping me with all my needs, no matter how large or small.

The property itself is a gem. Extremely well-maintained with a fantastic location, The Mint House is a my go-to as a transient resident. I will highly recommend and suggest booking at your earliest convenience. This property books very quickly.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text: I had a great stay at Mint House! The rooms are very clean and spacious, not to mention the all the great art and record player in the room. Great food and cafe locations in the lobby along with a fully stacked gym in the basement. The location could not have been better if you are downtown. I strongly recommend.

title: Great place to stay
text: We had a suite that accommodated 5 people.  We weren't expecting all the amenities we had like a full kitchen.  That would be outstanding for an extended stay.  The staff are personable and helpful.  The facility is in excellent condition.  We would definitely stay there again.

title: Amazing Stay at Mint House
text: Amazing Staff and support team.Very responsive and helpful. The property is very well maintained. Very comfortable bed. Spacious room. Kitchen utilities are very well maintained .Had an amazing stay at Mint House

title: The best
text: From the staff to the rooms, it's hard to find a flaw at MintHouse NYC. The staff were so helpful, had a great attitude and were so pleasant to deal with (rare in this industry for some reason). The rooms are so spacious i couldn't believe I was in NYC.  Will definitely be staying here again when I'm in the city.

title: Highly recommend! Everyone is so friendly!
text: My family and I were in town for a wedding in Nov. 2023 and booked Mint House for 2 nights. We got to our rooms and found them to be very clean, spacious and well equipped with kitchen supplies and a washer/dryer. The staff was so friendly and incredibly helpful, especially Jessica. She is so sweet! 12/10 recommend and we hope to be back soon!

title: Awesome
text: Great place to stay - close to the metro, relatively quiet, great gym downstairs and plenty of space in the apartments. Everything very clean and tidy. Friendly staff at the check in. Can only recommend to stay here

title: Jessica at the front desk.
text: Service starts at the front desk.  Jessica welcomed me my business partner like we were old friends.  I thought that I had made reservations for two rooms. WRONG! Just one. She sensed my angst and quickly said that she would take care of it.  That set the tone for my stay. I’ll be back next week to have Thanksgiving with my son who lives in the building. Thanks Jess. 👍🏽

title: Swanky FiDi Hotel
text: The hotel was very clean and cool. I loved the pour over coffee set up in the room, Right in the middle of FiDi it was easy to get around NYC and close to offices for work. I would recommend to a friend

title: Amazing place!
text: This hotel is amazing! From the extremely attentive and friendly staff, to the huge rooms with full size fridge, stove, and dishwasher. I was here on business, but it's a quick train to Mid-town. The Subway is right across the street. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful staying in an apartment space
text: Lovely large room.  Bed was fantastic, and best pillows ever in a hotel.  Couch in the living room very comfortable.  Nice having a kitchen with a refrigerator.  The yoga mat was a nice touch. Bathroom with a nice tub along side a shower a treat.

title: Fabulous service, seamless automation and great location!
text: Fabulous service, seamless automation and great location! Everything was so clean! Loved the phone app which meant I didn’t need to carry a room key around with me. So simple and easy! Will definitely be back!

title: A hidden gem
text: With a Michelin star restaurant downstairs, trendy coffee shop and a short walk to the East River with the Tin Building, this location and spacious, quiet and luxurious accommodation was a real find. Especially the bed, felt like we were sleeping in the clouds!

title: NYC Apartment Experience!
text: Best kept secret in downtown.  Stay where NewYorkers live!  Spacious rooms, and upgrade if possible to have even more space - Its so cool, sometimes you don't want to leave the apartment with the awesome Black Fox and Crown Shy in the same building - Wicked awesome gym too!  and more.

title: Excellent choise
text:
Staying in this magnificant and beautiful building at a very good location in the financial district , with Wallstreet just around the corner , engulfed us with the "right" atmosphere to experience the real NY fealing. 
Our studio deluxe was very modern with a peacefull interior and above all very spacefull whit a nice kitchen . The groseriestore on the groundlevel made it very easy to get everything we needed in the kitchen when we wanted te cook something. The staff was 24/24 "on watch" and very helpfull and friendly. When we visit NY again we will stay at the Mint House , thats for shure !!

title: Absolute perfection at every level
text:
We had the pleasure of staying here for six nights. This facility is the epitome of perfection. Every staff in action exceeded all of my expectations, both in friendliness and professionalism. The room blew me away. You will never find a room this size with this many amenities in New York City for the amount we paid. The area is very safe, and there is easy access to both food and activity. 
There is an entrance to Wall Street station across the street, which makes travel a breeze. Just make sure to take the Pine Street exit when you get off of the train. There’s also a wonderful grocery store in the building as well.  
Malik at the front desk went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect for us. I don’t have one negative thing to say…everything exceeded my expectations. We have stayed here once before, and we will stay here again without question.

title: One of the best stays I've had in New York
text: I recently stayed at Mint House, New York, and was impressed by the spacious, immaculate accommodations, perfect for solo travelers. The expansive bathroom, fully-equipped kitchen, large fridge, and charming record player added to a delightful experience. Highly recommend!

title: Just like home!
text: I went to New York for business, and felt right at home. The Mint had everything I needed and more. It's close to the World Trade Center, shops and restaurants. It's in walking distance from the subway.  The room has a full kitchen that is equipped with all appliances.  There is a fitness center, and a coffee house in the building. You'll feel like you're living in your own New York loft apartment.

title: Relaxation
text: The room was immaculate and exquisitely furnished. The plush bed was exceptionally cozy. I indulged in the luxurious bath amenities that included shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. A soft and fluffy bathrobe was also thoughtfully provided.

title: Great rooms and nice staff!
text:
Rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and well equipped!
Staff is friendly, very helpful and calm … they gave us a smile even when something went wrong out of their control or doing. They supported us with a solution and checked afterwards if we were okay!

title: Good location, good service
text: I selected this hotel based on the location. I wanted to be somewhat near Penn Station and Brooklyn. The Wall Street train is across the street which made my commutes very easy. The ladies at the front desk were hospitable and pleasant. I truly appreciate that. My only negatives were that there were no vending machines inside the hotel and the thermostat was difficult to adjust.

title: Another wonderful Mint House stay.
text: The Mint House is a wonderful apartment/hotel. We stayed there 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. This is the second time we have stayed at a Mint House and it did not disappoint. The unit was spacious and very neat/clean. The bed was comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. (We had an issue with the thermostat and some fixed it right away.). Having not stayed in this part of Manhattan before, I did find it a bit far from our usual stomping grounds, but within an easy subway ride. They did advertise that the rooftop bar (which is not owned by the Mint House) required a reservation, but when we checked on it, we were told they did not take reservations and we would need to wait in line, even if to just take a look around. The kitchen was nicely furnished, although we did not cook there. (Why cook when there are all of the wonderful restaurants there?)overall, I would recommend staying there, especially if you enjoy being on the southern tip of Manhattan.

title: Nice and clean
text: Not a bargain, but a a friendly service at the Check-In-Counter and a top location with a VERY CLEAN apartment. Classic turntable with Velvet Underground Longplays Album - nice!  Annoying emails before arrival and "special offers" like updating the stay with "late-check-out" offers are intrusive!

title: Family trip in NYC !
text: Very good place and area to stay. The apartment was perfect for our family. Lot of Ubers and Taxi close and the subway just in front. If I have to found a bad point it could be the lack of supermarket with acceptable prices close, it's probably due to Manhattan area.

title: Spacious clean beautiful rooms
text: Love staying at the Mint House. The rooms are nicely designed and very spacious for NYC. The reception is simple and the staff friendly. I did not like the room key code approach as it sometimes didn’t work well. Good coffee place as well in the same building - Black Fox

title: Good Hotel, but, playing with customers with nonexistent offres
text:
We booked for 4 rooms (3 & 4 nights each).
The rooms are great, spacious, great lighting, very well equipped.
Location is perfect for the financial district, close to several subway lines.

But, we experienced strange practice, very different from any of many of hotels we had stayed around the world.

4 days before check in, we received an offer for “…a few premium rooms or flexible arrival and departure times are now available for upgrade from as little as X USD…” , the link sent was not working.
Writing to the hotel, I got the message (one day later): “…We still have Studio Deluxe rooms available with an upgrade fee of 2X per night…” which is DOUBLE from a day earlier. We did not accept.

One day before checkout we received an “offer” for a late departure (for $76):”…. Copy this link in your browser to view your offers....”;
Again, the link ( xxxxx://xxxxx.xxxxxxx.xxx/xxx/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx) did not work…
Writing, again, to the hotel asking what the Mint House meant by “late check out”, we got the message “.. that was an exclusive offer specific to your reservation. Please click on the link to secure the late departure for $76.
However, if you want to depart at 6 PM, the fee would much much higher than $76…”
Really strange and VERY unusual attitude.

Talking to the reception lady, she asked me to write to Mr. Robert Naeder,
A day after checkout Robert wrote that these promotions were “For a limited time….”,
Well, no time frame was mentioned, as I probably missed the “limited time” after very few hours, while neither links worked.
Robert guaranteed that the Mint House is not using “… a bait-and-switch tactics…”.
I was not so convinced; you cannot offer, what you cannot deliver.

All the very strange ordeal left some bad taste of overzealous promotions not kept.

title: Stay here
text: I travel weekly for work and this was a surprising gem in nyc. The staff was also better than I am used to in any city. I could not believe how anything needed - it was taken care of without any question.

title: Hospedagem Maravilhosa no Financial District
text: Já é a segunda vez que me hospedo no Mint House. Na primeira vez, estive sozinha, agora, voltei com a família. O hotel é excelente. Quartos amplos e confortáveis, equipe solicita e eficiente e localização excepcional. Adoramos e voltaremos sempre.

title: Great place!
text: We are a family of four and really enjoyed our stay.  We booked a 1 bedroom and our kids were very comfortable on the pull out couch in the living room.  We couldn't believe how quiet it was, you really couldn't hear anything at night.  The location is great, very convenient for trains and close to amenities.  I highly recommend staying here.

title: The mint house is mint 👌🏼
text: The mint house never disappoints. Always clean, super spacious and unique amenities. Love that each room is different. And always stocked with whatever you could possibly need. Will always be my first choice stay in NYC. Look forward to visiting other locations in the future.

title: Must stay during your visit in NYC
text: High ceilings and very spacious.  Fully stocked kitchen and lots of amenities on property.  Grocery store downstairs.  Very close to the subway station and easy to get around NYC.  Highly recommend.  This hotel is unique

title: Don’t stay on trash collection night!
text: Woken up at 3:50am to loud banging and and compacting trash from 3:50am that lasted almost an hour. When I called front desk at 4am was told shouldn’t take long should be done by 4:30am!!!!  After they left, the building maintenance began reshuffling the metal dumpsters for another hour.  A disaster of an evening, with early meetings next day.  Make sure do not face the garbage street.  Front desk knew this was going to happen.

title: Our first Mint experience: A +
text: You can’t heat the location, the amenities, and the staff of Mint. And what you spend in room charge is more than recouped with the kitchen enabling you to not have to eat out every meal. Forget AirBnB, this is where you want to stay.

title: Weekend stay
text: Location is great, hotel is clean and modern. Easy check in process. Rooms are larger than any other you will find with great amenities. Have stayed many times and will be back again. Bed is super comfortable too!

title: Great stay downtown
text: Always a great experience at mint house. Located in the heart of downtown nyc, mint house is always a great time with super friendly staff, large rooms, great amenities, and the property is always clean and taken care of. I would definitely recommend mint house to anyone looking for a place to stay in downtown nyc

title: Clean, spacious and sophisticated
text: Clean and well maintained with a focus on making you feel like you're at home. The building has a great coffee shop and healthy lunch spot downstairs. Definitely gives the vibe of a multi use building with shared working offices. Perfect for digital nomads.

title: El mejor de Nueva York! Excelente relación precio-calidad.
text: Voy frecuentemente a NY y definitivamente éste hotel es al que volveré. Ingreso por lobby estilo art decó super elegante, con 3 ascensores que abastecen sin demoras. El departamento es enorme, super moderno y está muy bien equipado. Muy silencioso, en 6º P a la calle. Excelente internet para trabajar. Limpieza diaria. Cama y almohadas inmejorables. Heladera, lavavajilla y microondas funcionan perfecto con vajilla completa y mucho espacio de guardado. En la planta baja hay local para desayunar y a la vuelta supermercado muy completo. Personal muy atento y predispuesto a colaborar. A 3 cuadras de Eataly. Estación de metro en frente y otras a 5´caminando. Oculus a 5´a pie. Lleno de lugares gastronómicos muy cerca y shoppings de todo tipo. Zona segura para volver de noche, aun fin de semana. Volveré sin duda.

title: Wonderful option to visit NYC
text: This fully stocked, clean and impressive apartment is a wonderful option to enjoy NYC! We love traveling in this manner and this is now on the top of our list. There are a number of restaurants in and near the building, as well as a marvelous food market. It is a quiet, comfortable relaxing place.

title: Great Room
text: I enjoyed my visit to the Mint House. It was a great experience and they had nice addition to the room with a record player and records. The bed was comfortable and the room was unexpectedly large. I also like the tasty pour over coffee.

title: Great, spacious room!
text: Love The Mint House! The rooms are so big. They offer a great modern, city living feel. It is minimal, yet has everything I need. The record player and albums are a great touch! The building is in a great location with a ton of amenities close by. I also used the gym, which was nice and functional.

title: Great location out of the hassle of midtown
text: Great place right off Wall St. Good size appartments/rooms. Good storage space and convenient kitchen with microwave but no cooker. Bed was a little narrow and soft for our personal taste, but not a problem. Conveniently located across the street from a subway station (2 & 3 line). Plenty of food options nearby, including small supermarket in the same building around the corner and a coffee bar on the ground floor. Access to the rooms via a code rather than a key is a nice touch, but sometimes entering the code in the elevator takes more time than the actual elevator ride. Very friendly and professional staff. Overal, I would recommend this to experienced NY travellers, because of the location, but if you are happy to ride the subway everywhere, this is 100% the place to be

title: Perfect Wall Street/NYC experience
text: Incredible location, service, and Downtown NYC experience.  Top notch area for restaurants and cultural bars. For all you John Wick fans, was able to experience the CONTINENTAL building and the internal vibe inside the building, 2 blocks from the Mint House.

title: Très bel appartement spacieux et au calme
text: L'appartement 1 chambre est très agréable, spacieux et bien décoré. Nous étions 4 avec chaque couple notre espace bien séparé avec notre propre salle de bain. Le ménage est fait tous les jours et les serviettes changées. L'appartement est bien placé. On peut se rendre à pied au pont de Brooklyn, Battery Park embarcadère pour la statue de la liberté, le Mémorial du 11 sept ... il y a une station de métro à proximité 2mn à pied.

title: Ideal for business
text:
Situated close to Wall Street, this accommodation is ideal for both business and leisure (you are also 15 min walk from Fulton Station which gets you anywhere).

The rooms themselves are very spacious - and especially comfortable if you are staying as corporate housing. My room came with a mini kitchenette, sofa seating and a small dining area. The bed itself was very comfortable and the bathroom large. I liked the little touches like dark makeup removal face towels which shows they have though through the experience for guests. Only thing I would recommend is to try to get a room away from the socialising / co-working space as it can get loud (although I was so jet lagged it didn’t matter and it was one night).

The check in was easy, and staff very helpful.

title: Far, far better than a cramped hotel room
text: These apartments provide a terrific "base of operations" - not a cramped hotel room.  Especially worth it for extended stays, as there is a washer/dryer, kitchen, and a full market/grocery store in the building.  Location in the Financial District provides for quiet after-hours and thus excellent sleeping quality, and with Wall Street subway just across the street, very easy to rapidly get to other areas in the city.

title: Large rooms but stay on high floors
text: We had a a lovely large room but noisy (from street adn hallway) and dark due to low floor.  I'd recommend requesting a high floor for both light and quiet.  High floors also probbaly have nice views - our view was another building and scaffolding.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: Large rooms, very affordable! Quick walk to the Wall Street train. Would absolutely recommend. Huge gym in the basement, delicious coffee shop on the first floor. Front desk representatives were so friendly.

title: Mint House 70 Pine Sept 2023
text:
Our first stay in the financial district, much quieter and more laid back than uptown. Our Mint House suite was the largest room we’ve ever had in NYC including a full kitchen and fully equipped. More than we needed but allowed us to have relaxing breakfasts while planning our day. 

The staff were all terrific, especially Maalik and also Will, super friendly helpful and knowledgeable. 

It’s in a great location, Wall Street subway station is just across the street; we easily traveled throughout Manhattan over four days.

title: Un séjour à NYC
text: Appartement spacieux bien situé seuls à proximité du métro bémols un problème  de propreté durant le séjour et lit trop mou. Les fenêtres ne s’ouvrent pas ventilation très bruyante et de fait permanente

title: Exceptional for the price
text:
I don't want to detract from the review of the property, but want to highlight, I spent 3 weeks searching and scouring New York for an apartment/condo etc that had a good size and floor space for 3, and was let down on several occasions by both Airbnb and Booking.com, who are basically intermediaries and offer little security around any bookings made.

I was therefore a little dubious to find this on Expedia, which for the apartment we had, was over three times the floor space available elsewhere, at a bargain price. But it was real and it is a remarkable property. I would highlight, that this is in a building that has limited branding on the front, so you do have to be aware of the street. It isn't hard to find, but better branding would help!

Aside from that, the experience from the beginning is just amazing, reception are extremely welcoming and informative, the access is security controlled by lift PIN access, as are the apartments. The unit we had has 2 bathrooms, both large size with bath/shower, a great kitchen area with huge fridge/freezer and large cooker, microwave and a fancy kettle, toaster was also available. It also has a coffee making kit, for real coffee, which I tried and found a little convoluted, but thats because I am lazy and just want my brew! Others will love it!

The living area is huge, has large TV, telephone (cordless) and a really fancy record player, which we dare not touch in case we broke it! There is also a decanter and crystal glass set if staying and hosting which I thought was really impressive!

The bedroom is really roomy has a huge amount of space and also has the usual safe, along with iron and board, then a hairdryer in the bathroom. The lighting throughout is mi8nimal but good! There are mirrors everywhere!

I just found this whole suite remarkable, the attention to detail, with being near to wall street was typical financial disttrrict style and I imagine a fair few finance brokers have occupied and influenced the property, but for someone like me, this was such an opulent experience which is quite apt for New York

Some will not be happy about the location, because you are away from Times Square and if you are not prepared to use the subway or hop on/off buses then you will pay a fortune in uber charges, but for us, we were happy to use subway/buses and just as exception use Uber.

I am already thinking of a second stay in NY, because one stay does not cover everything! When I do, it is likely going to be here!

title: Roomy space and excellent location
text: Roomy space for a family of three. Comfortable, inviting, and a fantastic location. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge to DUMBO, walked around southern tip of Manhattan, and took subways all over NYC. There are subway stations nearby that serve the entire city. We had take-out dinner one night from the Blue Park Kitchen. Perfect food for our family: healthy and delicious.

title: Shhh - Keep this place quiet
text: What a nice quiet place in the city. Such a great stay, we were in the hustle and bustle of the city on moment then wished away to a quiet little corner where we could rest and rejuvenate. One thing I'm reluctant to give such a glowing review is because it will become overrun and we won't be able to book another weekend.

title: Another wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel!
text: My wife and I stayed here 4 years ago and couldn't wait to come back. It's such a beautiful hotel with so many extras. The staff is very friendly and professional. The Mint House is close to many things that New York has to offer. Thank you, we are looking forward to staying here again.

title: Memorial Weekend
text: Great location, close to the East River and surrounded by many bars and restaurants. Wall Street and the walk to Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry or the 9/11 Memorial and Museum within easy reach. The building is clean and well maintained. The check-in office is staffed and ready to assist. You do have to look around to find the Mint House Office. The rooms are great but make sure to research each piece of technology if you are old school. I was frustrated by the code punching to use the elevator and room access. Great gym in the basement but you have to look for it. I rate the Mint House excellent and will continue to stay when in NYC.

title: Brilliant and spacious apartments
text: We stayed at Mint House in NY, at a One Bedroom Plus Two Bath apartment, it is a large apartment, kitchen is well equipped, living room is very comfortable, lots of storage space and the whole apartment was immaculate.

title: A "Cool" Stay in a Mint House Apartment
text: The apartment was spacious, modern, comfortable and mostly quiet. The bathrooms were clean and towels and amenities were pleasant. The kitchen was more than I needed for a two day stay. The apartment, however, was dark. Although there were multiple lights, the walls were dark and  it could only be described as "atmospheric." It was steamy hot outside, so it was delightful to walk into an air conditioned space, but soon it felt way too cold and the A/C was difficult to control. I studied the controls closely in each room and they defied me even though I set and saved higher settings. I ended up turning off the A/C in the bedroom.

title: Always Consistent
text: Frequent guest of The Mint House.  Great location for FiDi and close to transit for other parts of Manhattan.  Always appreciate the extra space ( esp.the kitchen) as the longer stay feels more like an apt than a hotel room. I stay at the Mint Hosue for both work trosp ( Studio) as well as family trips ( up to 2 BDRMS) - both have worked very well. Restaurants ( esp Crown Shy), Grocery and Coffee ( Black Fox) both convenient and wonderful.

title: New Favorite Hotel
text: Really great room. Spacious and comfortable bed. I LOVE that they provide dispensers in the shower with shampoo/conditioner/body wash, and really great products too! The customer service was exquisite. So accommodating and friendly.

title: Amazing, incredible, highly recommend and would tell anyone coming into NYC to stay there
text: We had the BEST time at the Mint House for our hotel, we reserved a block and were just thrilled. ?Our main contact Erin was incredibly responsive throughout - Candice was great too, our guests loved the hotel - every time someone checked in I got a text saying, "wow this hotel is insane!" or something along those lines. And our suite was the perfect spot for getting ready (1 bedroom 2 bath), plenty of room and such great memories there! And then we walked into our hotel suite after our wedding, happy but totally exhausted - and see rose petals and towel swans on the bed and champagne and flowers - it was really just the absolute best. David at the front desk was so nice and incredibly helpful as well. THANK YOU so so very much. Would absolutely recommend and think that my sister and her family (2 small kids) will never stay anywhere else!

title: Top premise
text: We stayed 6 nights in a studio plus apartment. The location is close to the Piers which allowed us to enjoy waterfront dinners in the evening at a 5 minute walk. The subway station is in the same street as Mint House. The studio was spacious, comfortable and clean. Another plus is the coffee shop in the same building. We had a great stay !

title: Mint House Amazing!
text: The staff, cleanliness, spacious rooms, and great amenities is a 5+ star! I love staying here for a couple nights or a couple months. I'm always greeted with a smile and feel safe here. Amenities, quiet rooms, and very nice furniture and kitchen accessories make it feel like home.  I've been coming here for 2 years on business extended stays and will ALWAYS choose Mint House!!

title: Fantastic
text: Incredible appartments, great decoration, best service! Clean, quite, comfortable!!! Best stay in New York for families! Golf simulator, fitness, coffee shop roof top restaurant etc, next to metro station.

title: Mint House Is Amazing!
text: The room was gorgeous, the hotel staff were so nice and helpful, the amenities and services in the hotel are top notch, nothing like it anywhere else. Definitely booking here again in the very near future.

title: The best apartment I ever stay in Manhattan
text: The apartment was the best and quiet location parking is the only issue no parking and the parking should be free for all guest or have an employee park, not have the guess be looking for parking some of he guest drove long distance to come to New York.

title: Excelente estancia.
text:
Estuve varias veces en NYC y estas, por lejos, son las habitaciones más grandes. Gigantes para los estandares de NYC. Ubicadas en un edificio icónico de la ciudad. 
El hotel ocupa los primeros 6 pisos. Sus departamentos reformados, completamente equipados, un gimnasio espectacular, salas para trabajar, y en la terraza del edificio, un bar de tragos con una de las mejores vistas de NYC.
La atención fue siempre excelente. Felicito al dueño porque consiguió juntar un grupo de personas que trata muy bien al huésped. Pero debo destacar especialmente a Salomon, un genio lleno de paciencia y empatía que nos atendió espectacularmente la noche que llegamos, cansados y muy tarde. Muchas gracias Salomon!!! También a Candice que nos atendió a la salida.
Volvería al Mint House, sin dudarlo, y lo recomiendo plenamente.

title: Comfort & Glamour at affordable price
text: Don't overlook this hotel. It is in one of the most beautiful buildings and is within walking distance of the Seaport, The tin building and the 9/11 memorial. Staff is always accommodating and friendly. The rooms have it all.

title: Continue to exceed expectations
text:
It's been a pleasure staying here. Service and team keep improving year on year. This is highly unusual and commendable.

Rooms/apartment clean and spacious. Kitchen fully fitted. Requests for additional one-off items fulfilled promptly. Extra linen provided. Fast internet, premium cable, high end gym, grocery store, coffee shop and restaurants onsite. 

Definitely recommend.

title: Perfect family stay in NYC
text: Great apartment for a family or group! The apartment was really nice and had everything we needed. Staff was super-helpful. I don’t love the area but would definitely book again if traveling with family!

title: Superlative Service!
text: Such a wonderful stay! The staff, the building, the various amenities, thoughtfully curated rooms and common spaces. It's all so lovely. Especially the staff! Would absolutely stay again and recommend.

title: Business Trip
text: Great location in the financial district.   Spacious and clean.   Very convenient walk to the office.   I would highly recommend staying her for either business or pleasure.   Extra amenities included bowling alley, rooftop bar, restaurant and gym.

title: Wonderful!
text:
Staff at Mint House went out of their way to make sure we well taken care of.
Responded to all requests in a timely fashion.
We were there for medical care for 3 1/2 weeks and had everything we needed.

title: Il posto giusto dove soggiornare
text: Perfetto!!!!appartamento spazioso per noi 4(genitori+2 figli grandi), pulito, dotato di ogni comfort volendo fare tutti i pasti in casa. Ben posizionato rispetto alla Metro Wall Street. Personale gentilissimo e disponibile. Esperienza consigliatissima, ci siamo sentiti a casa.

title: When High-End Comfort Misses the Mark: My Visit to a Prestigious New York Hotel
text:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at a prestigious New York hotel that came with high expectations, given its reputation for luxury. However, my experience turned out to be a mixed bag.

Let's start with the downsides: The absence of room service was a major disappointment.

The hotel's advertised bowling alley, unfortunately, wasn't operational. This was disheartening, as I was looking forward to enjoying this unique amenity.

Another aspect that didn't meet expectations was the responsiveness of the receptionist. I found myself needing towels and had to call multiple times before they were delivered. This lack of promptness did detract from the overall convenience of the stay.

Despite these setbacks, there were some positive aspects. The room itself was impressively clean and surprisingly spacious. The attention to cleanliness added a layer of comfort and made the space enjoyable to be in.

On reflection, I can't help but feel that the hotel's marketing might have been a tad deceiving. While the room's cleanliness and spaciousness were definite pluses, the absence of room service, the non-functioning bowling alley, and the delays in towel delivery left me somewhat underwhelmed.

In the end, it's important to weigh the pros and cons. While the room's cleanliness and size were highlights, the issues I encountered were enough to temper my overall experience. For the price I paid and the expectations I had, I can't help but feel that the reality fell a bit short of the luxury I was hoping for.

title: Exceptional accommodations
text: This is the second time we stayed at the Mint House in the last four months.  We had a suite both times so a family member could join us.  It was like visiting at a lovely apartment.  The suites are beautiful, clean and has quality amenities. At the lower level is a store with beautifully displayed fruits and vegetables and groceries.  We enjoyed walking to different neighborhoods in the city and had easy access to the subway.

title: Our new NYC location
text: Clean, modern, fun, safe and easy! Amazing location, staff was helpful and kind and the room was so fun. A turntable with records! Thoughtful details like throw blankets, pour over coffee, beverae cart for cocktails, etc.

title: Génial ! Comme à la maison !
text: Franchement parfait !! Super location , au calme mais proche de plein de métro , bien car au final vous allez passer sans doute plus de temps à Brooklyn et dans le sud de Manhattan donc bien mieux que de loger a midtown. Le bâtiment est top , bâtiment historique et sympa on se sent pas comme a l hôtel plus authentique . Et service de grande qualité (la réception , salle de sport , ménage de grande qualité ) ..l’es appartements sont grands , tout est super moderne , de grande qualité . Belle décoration moderne dans la chambre . Super bien de pouvoir se faire à manger surtout avec des enfants car après une journée de visite aller au restaurant , devoir réserver pas agréable . Et ce qui est top vous êtes à New York donc quand je dis faire à manger , c est pas une corvée , vous allez au supermarché du building ou un peu plus loin de grands whole food et vous avez super plats tout faits (et pas de la junk food!!) . Bref on a adoré , on se sentait chez nous ! Et quand on revient , je retourne à Mint house sans réfléchir !!!

title: Our new go-to for NYC!
text: Modern huge rooms, very clean, easy to access with iPhone, turn table and albums in the room. Pour-over coffee, cocktail cart with everything you need, nice throw blankets, quiet and amazing locations. This is where you need to stay in NYC!

title: You have to stay here!
text: Went to NewYork for the first time this past week. Husband and I stayed at MintHouse and boy were we spoiled! I don't think i will ever make a trip to NYC without booking at MintHouse. the staff was so friendly, everything was clean and so spacious. 10/10 would recommend. Thanks to MintHouse and their amazing staff for making my first trip to NewYork amazing, and making me not want to leave the luxury of my room even to see the sites!

title: Excellent location and spacious space - would happily return.
text:
Mint House was a lovely find downtown that was recommended by a friend, and we’ve already passed it on, again, to different friends as an perfect alternative to the conventional NYC hotel room.

Immediate and obvious perks:

-Spacious spaces. Our studio was effectively a small condo with kitchenette, a functional table and desk / office, a couch and adjacent sleeping area. Bathroom was sizable with thoughtful amenities (black make up towel, Malin + Goetz toiletries, fluffy bath towels). Plenty of drawer and closet space, ample hangers, etc. Much larger than a similarly priced hotel room in the city. Much more comfortable.

-It hit the high points in terms of strong and reliable wifi (yes), excellent water pressure (yes) and quiet and reliable air conditioning (mostly yes for quiet but blessedly cool during a hot spell). 

-Minimal ambient noise. Our room faced a courtyard away from the street and was effectively silent; hall noise was minimal and doors don’t slam.
