-Easy check in / out. The front desk was pleasant and responsive; entry is keyless and the same code is used for the elevator and room. No keys to misplace = a welcome touch.

-Location. While not centrally located
to the entirety of Manhattan, Mint House is directly across the street from the 2,3 trains, an easy walk to other lines and to most of downtown. Trains had us in Brooklyn in 10-15 minutes.

Tiny things that could be done better:

-No outlets or USB access anywhere near the bed. This was a real bummer as we use our phones as clocks and alarms. Was told by the front desk that the second floor is “new” and the rooms had been completed without outlets adjacent to the beds; I believe the higher floors may have that available. Definitely a creature comfort that was greatly missed

-Housekeeping was knocking on doors around 3/4 in the afternoon, a time when many - including us - are returning to their rooms after a day out / to refresh before dinner. As such, we passed on fresh towels and etc during our stay. This would have been a welcome service earlier in the day.

For the most part though, it’s a real bargain in terms of space and amenities both in and out of room (bowling alley and theater in the basement are both available to reserve with advance notice) and a lovely alternative to airbnbs or traditional hotels. Would absolutely return (but would stay in a room with connectivity near the bed!)

title: Quiet, Comfortable Stay
text: Stayed in a studio deluxe, 3 adults, 1 child; bigger than we anticipated.  Good location to the Wall St subway station, as well as the seaport shops & restaurants.  Surprised at how quiet it was.  The staff was very quick to requests. Highly recommend.

title: Mississippian goes to New York
text: Selected this hotel based on location and reviews. Spent 5 days there. Did not disappoint. Friendly staff. Clean and spacious rooms, great location. Easy walk to anything in the financial district and easy walk to subway stations. Grocery store on street level that connects with the hotel.

title: Amazing, unexpected find
text: Really loved my stay here. Moved from another nearby apartment hotel that just wasn't working for me, after doing initial reconnaissance. All the rooms we saw were great but we were lucky to get upgraded to a larger room after booking, which was beyond expectations. Beautifully decorated room with lots of space - less hotel room & more a nice NYC apartment one could actually live in. Very comfortable beds, spacious, well equipped kitchen area, nice bathrooms with quality linens, lots of storage. Online pics don't do the place justice. Robert & his team are incredible - super responsive, helpful & always offering to go the extra mile. The facilities are great. With a constantly ravenous teen, the City Acres Market downstairs was a godsend. The location was also perfect. Close to the amazing Tin Building, the piers, easy access by subway right across the road to the rest of the city. The only minor con: daily housekeeping was a little sloppy & cleaners sometimes needed a bit of prompting & direction, but on the flip side it was an unexpected perk. Will definitely be back there. My new NYC go to.

title: Loved The Mint House!
text: The front desk personnel were all super helpful and friendly.  The accommodations were very comfortable and the location was great — literally across the street from the Metro and just a couple blocks to the water.  We loved the special amenities like the basement gym and grocery store.  So many great eating places within blocks.  We definitely recommend!

title: Great place!
text:
I enjoyed my stay at the Mint House. Marriott canceled my reservation, unbeknownst to me until 12 am on a Saturday when I tried to checkin. Everywhere around was fully booked, but I got a room at Mint House. Bedrooms are super modern and very clean overall (except a few spots in the bathroom). It was quiet, bed was like a cloud, super cute little details like a tea kettle and drip coffee. No other amenities really, like a gym or pool, but if you care more about a nice and chic room, this place could be for you. 

I would ditch the Marriott and come here next time!

title: My new NYC hotel
text:
From the effortlessly chic aesthetic, to the outstanding staff, the Mint House impressed on all levels.
I have visited Manhattan countless times in the last 25 years, and have stayed in many bland, trying-way-too-hard boutique hotels. Mint House is fresh, spotless, and spacious with many thoughtful touches. The closet space was incredible, extremely comfy beds, and touches like albums and great mags that made hanging our in our room actually fun! Every interaction with the kids at the front desk was helpful and so very pleasant - the happiest staff in the city, no doubt. In future, I will use this hotel as a base for business and pleasure. A terrific location for our stays in FiDi - we will recommend often.

title: Almost great, but…
text: A spot in the recommended garages is not guaranteed. Rooms are spacious, but bathrooms could use a bit updating. Nice to have the grocery store right next door - only wish it closed a later. The gym and bowling alley were great.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: I would highly recommend staying at the Mint House. The rooms are amazing and the service is impeccable. Robert made sure everything was perfect every step of the way. We will definitely be returning to the Mint House very soon!!

title: Perfect location for families with rooms that have ample space
text: I stayed in a deluxe studio, which is basically an apartment because its such a big space with a separate bedroom area. The space was about 800 sq feet with a kitchenette area including a dishwasher and a big bathroom with a large bath and separate shower. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful and they alone should get the 5 bubbles (this doesn't include the free popsicles they had on hand for the hot weather in NYC). The property doesn't have cards to gain access but a code which seems annoying, especially when you are rushing to add your code before the elevator starts, but after a couple of run thrus its nice to not have to worry about grabbing it before you leave. This location has a grocery in the basement of the main building, which is great as most places close early in the area. This property is also about 3 blocks away from the seaport and maybe a half a mile from battery park. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect location and large and well equipped appartement
text:
Perfect location and large and well equipped appartement
5 or 6 subway stations to go to Times Square
Subway station just in front of the hotel
Quiet location and close to the city center of New York
Very close to the World Trade Center and Oculus where you can find a food court to eat

title: Great Hotel Option for Financial District
text: This hotel property was extremely clean, in a good location downtown and has the biggest hotel rooms in NYC I've ever stayed in. Highly recommend the property especially if you are staying in NYC for more then a few nights.

title: MINT HOUSE will always exceed all the expectations
text: Mint House at 70 Pine is by far the best hotel in NYC. Due to business, I travel to NYC 3 - 4 times a month in a red eye flight but the team at Mint House always took care of me. They went above and beyonnd with checking in to all the extra accommodations just to make sure my stay was comfortable. I will not choose any other hotel than Mint House if I come to NYC.

title: Largest space to stay in NY
text: Amazing space, largest I've stayed in in NY.  Great location, subway right across the street and another 5 mins walk.  Clean, modern, huge open space.  Was a studio and there were 3 of us and we felt it could have taken 4 adults.  Staff were amazingly efficient and friendly.  Will definitely book again.

title: Huge studio, but few things can be better
text:
First of all, the good stuff: 
1. The room is huge for New York standard. We got the studio and it was massive. Lots of space to pace around in the room and put our 4 luggages. 
2. Great layout, it comes with a simple pantry and coffee and tea are provided. 
3. Nice shower, bathtub and amenities. 
4. Close to the subway (only 2 mins walk). 

Now the not so good part: 
1. I don’t know about the other rooms but our bed was creaky. Basically if anyone moves even a little on the bed, it’ll make a loud creaking sound, which can be quite annoying. 
2. The garbage truck collection noise is also very loud at around 2 am. I am quite a heavy sleeper and don’t normally wake up easily but I got startled by it every night. Then again this is New York so I doubt that it’s possible to find someplace really quiet. 
3. The girl at the front desk / reception is not friendly or helpful at all. Not even a single smile, and when we asked questions, she didn’t seem interested in helping and has a permanent annoyed face. Is that just how New York hospitality works? The guy is a lot better though, much friendlier. 

Will we come back again? Maybe yes, but only if we need to be in the FiDi area.

title: Great stay with some improvements to be made
text:
We liked the size of the apartment, the comfort, the furnishings, the cleanliness, the daily change of linen, the comfort of the mattresses and pillows, the availability of the staff and the location.
We didn't like the floor of the apartment (3rd floor) too close to street level and therefore subject to noise from the street and nearby construction sites, the exposure of the room with little light and no possibility of seeing anything other than a building in renovation, the noise of the refrigerator, dishwasher and air conditioners.

title: Great stay, excellent staff, very convenient and comfortable
text: We had a wonderful stay at Mint House in FiDi. We had a very spacious studio with a full kitchen. The bed was very comfortable as was the pull out sofa bed (which is very surprising) - so the kids slept well too. Nice touches throughout like nice coffee with a pour over system in the room, full kitchen, turntable with a good selection of vinyl (more records available downstairs) and nice (Bluetooth capable) speakers. Nice dining room/area where we could both work on our laptops. The building itself is great with a super nice and convenient grocery store on the bottom floor, great restaurants in the building (Michelin starred options) and one of the best rooftop bars in the city. Laundry on the top floor was convenient as was gym on the bottom floor. Staff was super nice and attentive, even doing things like giving out complimentary ice pops on the first day of summer! Location is convenient and close to the subway and Seaport district with lots of activities. It was our first time staying at a Mint House property but will definitely do it again in New York and elsewhere!

title: The Perfect Girls Weekend Stay
text: If you are looking for a place to stay with a group of girlfriends, and you want to all be in the same room, this is truly the perfect place. The quality of room, prime downtown location, and attentive service makes the Mint House my top recommendation, especially over AirBNB, because nothing beats hotel service with the space of an apartment. The high biggest room sleeps 6, which was plenty of space for all my friends and I to stay for a weekend. And the full kitchen with stocked appliances was so helpful. The price at first may seem high with all the fees, but it’s really comparable to other hotel prices, but you get WAY more space. Which to me is worth the extra spend.

title: Mint House un nome una garanzia
text:
Ho scoperto il Mint House nel 2022 e quest'anno , appena si è presentata l'occasione , ho riprenotato perché trovo questa struttura un ottimo mix tra prezzo , gentilezza , professionalità , comodità e soprattutto spaziosità delle camere. La struttura si trova ad un passo dalla metropolitana . Le stanze sono spaziose rispetto alla media di Manhattan , ottima la pulizia , la cucina offre tutto quello che serve per mangiare a casa e completa di tutti gli elettrodomestici . Le stanze sono arredate in stile moderno ma molto raffinato ed inoltre al 6 piano si trova una wash & Dry che volendo permette di portarsi dietro lo stretto necessario come vestiario senza appesantire troppo le valige. Ottimo lo staff sempre disponibile e professionale.
Lo consiglio vivamente

title: Appartamento bellissimo
text: Appartamento con due camere e un bagno molto spaziosa, arredata con cura e stile. Cucina attrrezata e soggiorno molto confortevole. Posizione comoda rispetto alla metropolitana. Personale disponobole dal momento della prenotazione fino al check out.

title: Great hotel for a perfect stay
text:
A perfect location of the hotel, only 100 meters to the subway station of Lines 2 and 3 (Express Lines, diagonally opposite in the building on the other side).
With fully equipped kitchen, supermarket just around the corner, ideal for a longer stay.
Very friendly staff, absolutely recommended.
Is difficult to find though (70 Pine Street has several entrances to different facilities, it's the entrance more on the right with a bit of steps).

title: Incredible amount of space
text: Was the most space I've ever had in a NYC hotel room. Comfy bed, amazing staff, and every room had a Fellow Pour over set to make coffee. We booked it for a team on site and it seemed like everyone was raving about their room. Having a grocery store downstairs in the same building helped on multiple occasions as well.

title: Home away from Home
text: My stay at Mint House was fabulous. The room was so spacious and tastefully decorated. The bathroom products were gorgeous and the amenities in the room (e.g. vinyl player and sound system) were so cool. I will absolutely stay here again when I come back to NYC.

title: This is a rare find…
text: There is a very limited selection of good hotels in the FiDi area. The Mint House is a hidden gem. Clean, airy, tasteful, business friendly, convenient, and more space than an average NYC hotel. Definitely going to stay here if I need a place downtown NYC.

title: Great apartment size and sleep quality
text: Great service, grocery store within the building and subway right in front of the building. Apartment size great. We stayed in Studio Deluxe and couldn’t have asked for more for our family of four. Only thing we missed was they do not provide a baby crib and high chair.

title: Family trip in NYC
text: We had a very nice stay at the Mint House. It was perfect for the family with a separate space for the sofa bed. The building and the apartment was very clean, well equipped and had a nice design, very spacious.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Upon arrival check in was a breeze everyone at front desk was phenomenal. Will and Nelson were both great at making sure our stay was a pleasant one.  The overall space was perfect, it was clean, modern and everything you needed was provided to make you feel at home.  I loved the record player too with the variety of albums to play.  The location was perfect, like a hidden gem.  There was everything onsite gym, laundry room, cafe, restaurant, rooftop lounge, supermarket etc...  I was so happy to book with Mint House I will be staying again for my next weekend getaway.  A huge thank you to the team.

title: Our stay was MINT!!!!!
text: We loved, loved, loved everything about our stay at Mint House.  It truly was Mint!!  The apartment was clean, spacious and we loved the little touches! There was even a hand written note welcoming us!!!  The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly!!  We have left, but will ABSOLUTELY be back!!

title: Wonderful gem in lower manhattan
text: Very spacious rooms with full kitchen in classic art deco building less than a 10 minute walk to multiple subway lines - everything you could want for a great NYC visit. Guests have access to gym which features a bowling lane, pool and ping pong tables. Full supermarket at street level.

title: New Favorite
text: Once you learn how to get in and out of the building and rooms with your pin code, staying here is a breeze. It's quiet, large, clean and modern. I honestly can't remember the last time I enjoyed a hotel this much, outside of 5 star hotels that are at least 5 times the cost. New favorite hotel. Love this company.

title: Perfect for our family
text: We have stayed here a few times and will come back again.  It is a perfect location for us.  I like that it isn't just a hotel  room.  We like to have a living room space to convene each day and a kitchen for beverages and snacks. Also a bonus is the City Market  on the bottom floor.

title: Old meets new
text: New renovated room with modern look, excellent bed and kitchenette. I would go there again! If you like Art Deco you are on the right place. Excellent Café in the ground floor and restaurant. A Cocktail bar on top and a very nice Lobby !

title: Most comfortable stay in NYC
text: We reached early to the hotel and were offered early check-in without requesting! Excellent customer service. Clean and most spacious hotel we have ever stayed at in NYC. Will highly recommend and we'll always prefer to stay here when visiting NYC!

title: Amazingly spacious accommodation that enhanced our stay in NY
text: We were literally amazed when we oppened the door of our room and saw how big it was - much more like an apartment than just a studio. Lovely on-site staff. Quiet location in a stylish landmark building. If you are thinking 'is it worth the extra?' a resousounding 'yes'.

title: Downtown very big rooms
text: Nice and big rooms everything you could need in the kitchen and a bath too very good it’s just by Wall Street so plenty of trains a moment away 2 min walk to the 9/11 memorial coffee shop right next door for breakfast

title: Lots of room
text: This is a great place to stay and a good value, especially if space is important to you.  Our family of four had more room than we needed in a deluxe one bedroom.  Having two baths and a full kitchen was really helpful.  The location is good if you want to explore Lower Manhattan.  Close to Battery Park, Wall Street, and the memorial, etc.  Lots of places to eat and shop nearby.  Now, they just need one in Midtown!

title: Nice stay in Wall street
text: We haved a nice stay in Mint House, clean, comfortable, we haved all we needed.  We stayed in studio. We loved the bathroom products, especially the shampoo. The location in Wall Street is perfect and well connected.

title: Amazing girls trip
text: Mishka and the team are incredibly helpful, super responsive. Great location with amazing restaurants in the same building. Would definitely come back here! Highly  recommend Mint House beautiful rooms as well!

title: Fantastic place on New York!
text:
My experience was great from the booking to the departure. The place is fantastic, well place, beautiful, confortable, clean, quiet (for NYC!). The level of service is great. 
We really enjoyed our stay and we will definitively come back.
Bravo !

title: Spacious hotel rooms in Financial District
text: Very large hotel rooms (inc full kitchen) in Financial District. Hotel itself was very quiet, although there's a fair amount of street noise (like midnight garbage pick-up) because the hotel is only on floors 2-6 of the bldg. Nice touches like pour-over coffee maker and Tazo tea, plus a record player with an eclectic mix of albums to play. Could use better (or any!) signage for the hotel at entrance and inside bldg lobby, as it's shared with 70 Pine residences, restaurants, gym, etc. and Mint House name doesn't appear prominently anywhere.

title: Thank you Mint House
text: We stayed at Mint House in May 2023 and had a lovely time. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment, which was very spacious and nicely furnished and equipped. When we contacted the team, we found them to be very helpful and professional. It's situated in a beautiful building and in a good location. Thanks to everyone at Mint House for helping make our time in NY so special.

title: Fantastic, Clean, Large Apartment Style Hotel
text:
Wow, huge spit-shine clean room, amazing location, comfortable bed, excellent customer service, even the street noise was minimal. Would stay again in a heartbeat.
 
Easy check in. The room is set up like a typical NYC apartment, only WAY bigger. Full kitchen, large clean bathroom, fun record player in the room. Was absolutely perfect for a few days in the City. 

There is a market and several restaurants in the same building. The subways is very nearby and also within walking distance is the South Street Seaport, the Oculous, Battery Park, Tribeca, and Chinatown. 

The only negative was the AC/Heater. It was spring time when the outside temperature dramatically flutuates, but inside the room, after three days we still could not fnd a comfortable setting where we were not either too hot or too cold.

Tip, enter through the revolving door and make a hard right then left to get to the front desk.

title: Quiet and Serene
text: I have stayed here a few times and I always enjoy the peace and quiet of the room. The beds are very comfortable and I don’t hear any typical NYC street noise. My room had a lovely kitchenette with a well appointed cooking area and good size refrigerator and freezer- excellent for a 3-day stay. My only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that the location is a bit far from cultural attractions, but they are a quick car ride away, or a 20 minute walk on a nice day.

title: Mint Condition
text: My time and stay at the Mint House was excellent! Comfortable rooms with lovely amenities. Friendly staff and excellent customer service.  The room was located directly across the street from the building where our training was being held.  I will definitely stay again and recommend the Mint House to others!

title: Spacious, clean, quick walk to subways
text: Located in the Financial District it is easy to get to east and west side subway lines or head out to Brooklyn. Short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge as well. Good coffee shop option downstairs, spacious clean rooms and easy check-in & check-out.

title: Good but with room for improvement
text: The rooms are an absolute highlight. Very nicely furnished and spacious - an absolute exception for New York. However, there is still room for improvement in the service. There were a few moments that did not make our stay 100% pleasant. The young people at the reception are always "engrossed" in their screens and you have to ask for every piece of information. The location and connections are perfect. There are well-stocked grocery shops nearby for essentials.

title: Highly recommended place in FiDi
text: After decades of staying in NY hotels in the Upper West Side, we decided to give the Mint House a try following recommendations from different sources. And we were definitely not disappointed. The rooms are spacious. They have great design, including the best classical records and the amenities of Malin & Goetz are a treat. We enjoyed the top-notch gym in the basement, including golf simulator and table tennis. The hotel has fabulous restaurants in the same building, get your breakfast at Black Fox, eat a healthy lunch bowl at Blue Chicken and having a drink and dinner at CrownShy or make it up to Open Air and Scala. You do not have to leave the building, but if you do, you are right in the center of FiDi with all the required shops, transport, tourist places and space to exercise. I would definitely stay again. An excellent concept!

title: Loved the Mint House!
text:
Best NYC spot we've ever stayed! The apartment was huge and nicely appointed with a big bathroom (with two sinks) and excellent toiletries. We had a kitchen and work area, and the bed was comfy. Also, we appreciated the fact it was quiet and dark enough to not have to use sleep masks. 

We walked down to the water and took the East River ferry across to Brooklyn, and we also walked to the 9/11 museum, Seaport area, and the National Museum of the American Indian.

We will definitely be back!

title: Nous adorons
text:
Comme à chaque visite, une super expérience ! 
Un mélange de nostalgie et de modernité, le souci du détail, un luxe raisonné, le confort et un emplacement qui permet à la fois d’être au calme avec la proximité  des commerces, et au cœur de la ville en moins d’un quart d’heure..
Merci

title: An ideal place!
text: Excellent place to stay in NYC! We picked this place quite ramdomly two years ago, and since that time it has become our home away from home! Amazing place offering outstandig service, comfort, gorgeous location and facilities... Most friendly and helpful staff--all is above expectation and deserves the highest reviews! Strongly recommend and will stay there again!

title: Great find - looking forward to returning.
text: Enjoyed everything about the Mint House at 70 Pine.  Lovely staff, convenient location with coffee shop and grocery store within building.  Easy walk to the metro.  The rooms were huge, clean, and beautifully decorated.  The convenience of a full kitchen was a wonderful extra.

title: Lovely room in fantastic Art Deco building
text: Lovely big room with kitchen area, very comfortable bed and everything you’d need including a vinyl record player with NYC themed records which was a nice touch. Housed in a fantastic old art deco building. Reasonably priced given the premium feel. Highly recommended!

title: Amazing first stay in New York and Impressed by the Mint House
text: The room was absolutely gorgeous and comfortable. The bed was a dream and we slept well. I was very impressed with the quality of everything in the rooms was great and cleanliness was great! There were a lot of extra special touches like quality tea, sparkling non-alcoholic juice, etc. We loved everything and will come back 100% on our next trip to New York!

title: Nice and spacious spot for a larger group
text:
I booked the 1 bedroom deluxe for a group of 6 girls for my bachelorette party. It was SUPER spacious and the full kitchen and TWO full bathrooms really made our room enjoyable. The staff members were all super nice. We were able to leave our suitcases with them with no issues pre-check in and after our check out. 

The only con about this spot is the only way to access the elevator and your room is through a 6 pin that you have to put in.

title: Incredible!!
text:
Incredible place to stay. We stayed for our wedding June 2022 and brought out family over from uk. 

The team at Mint House were incredibly helpful  throughout and the rooms were fantastic, from arranging rooms on the same floor or nearby for all of us, helping with transportation on our wedding day, arranging for a steamer for my dress, helping our photographer, videographer, wedding planners and MUA on the day, booking Team Bride vs. Team Groom bowling the night before the wedding and so much more! 

The rooms are incredibly spacious, fully equipped kitchen, bed is sooo comfortable. The building is gorgeous and full of amenities. The coffee shop downstairs will set you up for the day. 

We love staying downtown and will 100% be back in the future. 

Stay here, you will not regret it. Thank you to the Mint House team for everything 

Mr & Mrs Hughes-Martin

title: Stoned Desk Clerk
text:
The clerk was unable to decipher what our reservation was. Hence we paid an extra $4000.00. The hotel is nice, but I will never do business with this entity again. 
The only reason I'm still typing is because I have to type 200 characters.

title: Huge room,  great location
text: The room was huge and fully equipped with a fridge, stove, coffee maker, toaster, dishes, etc. I was able to buy a few groceries before my visit and they were waiting for me in the fridge! Staff was super friendly. Room was huge, big bathroom. Comfy bed.

title: Great place, great price, great time
text: Went to business trip and it was perfect. Big and clean renovated apartments, lovely building and excellent gym. Quick and friendly check in. Would absolutely stay again. The subway is across the street and location is very convenient.

title: The Mint House
text: A perfectly appointed large hotel room with every amenity you could possibly think of, located in the spectacular architectural setting of the financial district. A very professional/chill staff members at the front desk that take care of your every need.   Staying away the Mint was an experience we will not forget.

title: UNIQUE EXPERIENCE
text:
I've been to NYC for 6 years and this was the best experience. 
The location is excellent you have everything really close and both service and location were excellent
the space of the room is considerably better than other stays in nyc

title: Love it.  Will be back.
text: Really interesting place.  Not easy to find. Quiet around the hotel downtown, but walking distance to Battery Park, the Seaport, Soho, etc. Great restaurants nearby and Fulton St. subway station nearby.  Rooms are huge by most standards, but especially nyc standards.  Ours was a 600+ sq ft. room easily fitting 2 adults and 2 teens.  Bars and restaurants in the building makes the location a plus. All at a price that blows away most rivals.  Loved it.

title: Stay here!!!
text: We have stayed at Mint House three times and have never been disappointed….staff couldn’t have been more helpful and personable, rooms are spacious with all the amenities, subway is right around the corner…you’re in the City but the location has a neighborhood appeal, somehow.

title: Best hotel in lower Manhattan
text: Didn't know what to expect when I was booked in to this hotel. Clean, modern and unlike any hotel I have been in. Rates were great and had a wonderful trip. Highly recommended. I felt very safe in the hotel and all of the staff were helpful and very accommodating!!

title: Great alternative to a cramped hotel room!
text:
We loved our stay at The Mint House and will definitely stay anytime we are coming to NYC. We felt like we had our own secret studio apartment in the city! So much more comfortable than a hotel room. Loved the little extras and really appreciated that everything was very clean, updated and modern, hidden inside an art deco historic skyscraper. Loved having the extra room and listening to music on the record player. Very convenient to everything we wanted to see in the Wall Street area. Great Staff -everyone was super friendly and helpful.  
I would highly recommend for anyone looking for a different NYC experience. (Do not expect it to be like staying in a hotel) It was great to have a kitchen and easy shopping with the grocery store is same building. 
A tip for anyone checking in and trying to find how to get in: from the corner of Pearl and Pine walk down Pine along the building (past PT office and grocery store and enter where there is a revolving door.)

title: I would stay there again
text: I would go back, we found all the necessary services, courtesy cleaning. Inside the very spacious apartment we found all the comforts. Located in a strategic position, close to the supermarket and places to eat, very close to the subway.

title: excellent stay for our family with 2 teens
text: Our citytrip to New York was a succes thanks in part to our stay at the Mint House! We loved the spacious apartment with a fully equipped kitchen and the super supermarket in the building, which made it possible to have several meals 'at home'. But also the atmosphere of the Art Deco-building and the location nearby several subwaylines were pluses for us!

title: Great base for family trip to NYC
text:
Mint House proved to be the perfect choice for our one week trip to New York City. Others than typical hotel rooms with 200 sqft the apartment was really spacious with almost 1,000 sqft, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, fully equipped kitchen, living room and large wardrobes.
Walking distance to several subway stations and hot spots: 9/11 memorial, battery park/Liberty Statue ferry, Brookly Bridge, NYSE.

title: Fantastic stay in New York
text:
If you are looking for excellent service and clean apartment in Wall Street are, this is to recommend .
Well located to underground, supermarket, restaurants, gym downstairs, super friendly staff, highly recommended

title: I love the Mint House
text: The Mint House is in a very quiet location yet near transportation and restaurants. The building is beautiful. The rooms are so spacious which is a luxury in NYC! It is very clean and comfortable. Communication is great and the front desk people are friendly and attentive. I highly recommend the Mint House!

title: Suggerito sicuramente
text: La posizione è sicuramente strategica, supermercato nello stesso complesso, camere molto curate e di nuova ristrutturazione lo consiglio assolutamente. Sia per una vacanza in famiglia che di lavoro.consigliato.

title: Felt like VIPs
text: Very nice place to stay in NYC! The place is quiet and the staff is lovely and helpful. Appartement was nicely decorated, nothing was missing and we enjoyed every moment of our stay! Highly recommend.

title: Great place to stay
text: Fatima and Will at the front desk were extremely helpful, patient, knowledgeable, cheerful, and more.  The apartment was fantastic - spacious, nicely decorated, and in perfect working order.  The coffee provided in the room was delicious.

title: I will not stay anywhere else!
text: The Mint House is a hidden gem in the Wall Street area. I travel there often for business - at 28 Liberty, a half block away - and I will not stay anywhere else, the Mint House has spoiled me. I recommend this place to my colleagues, and I am reluctant to say too much - I want to be able to get accommodations too!

title: Amazing Manhattan stay
text: The size of the room & the bathroom was amazing. So close to the subway station. Very close to Brooklyn Bridge and 9/11 memorial. Great rate over the weekend for what I got in return. Very clean, highly recommended.

title: Family trip to NYC
text:
We were a family of four and the studio was perfect.  A large comfortable sofa bed in an alcove (although it would be better suited to house a double bed tbh as you would not choose this area to sit as the tv is in the kitchen bedroom area) and a king bed at the other end of the space.  The sleeping areas are separated by a bathroom and a large open plan fully fitted kitchen with large table.  Plenty of amenities near by to buy breakfast supplies, order take out etc etc.  coffee machine provided etc 
I would have preferred a key card rather than a code to access lift/room etc as i did find this method fiddly.  
We found the location excellent for accessing the subways to both Manhattan and Brooklyn.  It was nice to stay somewhere relatively calm.

title: Clean modern and a real wifi
text:
This place is one of the best in NY for a business trip ! The room are clean, not small like a shoes box, and the internet wifi is really fast ! I definitely recommend this place
I had a good sleep , the bed quality is also very good

title: Great Stay but don't tell everyone
text: Nice place to stay and loved that it was close to the water. We took a ferry to get around which we never have done on many many trips to New York city. The people in the hotel are very nice and professional. Clean rooms and space. We will stay there again.

title: Excellent Service and location
text: Location is amazing!!! Staff is great! Easy access to trains and all sites that one could possibly visit. Studio apartment is roomy, laundry room, great security system and facility staff are extremely efficient.

title: Terrific 3 night stay in New York City
text: The apartment was very large and comfortable for a 3 night stay for 3 people. The staff was courteous, helpful and knowledgeable.  Kitchen well-stocked with dishes and utensils and the grocery store right in the building was very helpful (make sure you go downstairs at the store).  Good transportation right nearby and some fun eating places within easy walking distance.  Nothing bad to say about our stay.

title: Wonderful Space
text: Beautiful art deco building a block from Wall Street station and convenient to multiple ferries, restaurants, bars, Statue of Liberty, lively Seaport District and historical sights. We got a really great deal through TA Plus so we were expecting "the worst room in the place". I don't think there is such a thing. What we received was amazing! Newly finished with a wall of windows, HUGE room and spacious bathroom with two sinks, a soaking tub and separate rain shower. Fully stocked kitchenette, quality linens, dedicated desk/work station, comfortable couch and seating area and dining table that sat six. Decor was tasteful and I appreciated the high ceilings and open spaces. The practical side of me wished there was a second bed rather than seating for six (8 if you really all liked each other!) so teen son and I would have each had our own beds but this problem was ours, not the hotel's. We have found our new favorite NYC hotel.

title: Mint House
text: Hotel was within walking distance to my office which is a huge plus for the NY area..  Having a separate space for working  and relaxing in addition to a large  bedroom area is a huge plus.  The coffee / tea bar is always a plus but the addition of a kitchen area is nice.

title: Great Stay, will come back again.
text: What everyone says about this place is true.  Huge rooms with kitchens.  Beautiful building a few hundred feet from the Wall Street subway station.  Great market in the same building.  Two basement levels of gym.  The location might not be perfect for some NYC attractions, but we were in Harlem thirty minutes after we walked out of the building.

title: Large quiet room in great location
text: Very comfortable and quiet room in a great location in the Financial District. Beautiful building, helpful staff. Great having a kitchen and so much space. Really liked the gym, bowling alley, etc. in the basement. No complaints: would highly recommend!

title: Fabulous Apartment
text: This place is fantastic. The room had so much space, was beautifully styled and had everything we needed. The location was great for us - easy to get around, lots of good eating spots nearby. The team were super accommodating and always happy to help. Will definitely come back.

title: Would Stay Again
text: The only bad thing I have to say about my experience was the entrance was a bit difficult to find off the street due to renovations on the outside of the building.  The rooms were MASSIVE, well laid out, and comfortable.  Full size bathrooms with tub AND shower!  I've traveled to NYC several times and have never gotten so much "bang" for my bucks as this stay.  Once we knew how to get in and out of the building, it was a piece of cake.  Quick walk to subway, market and gym in basement of building, coffee shops everywhere.  Highly recommend!

title: If the location works for, this is the place to stay
text: Overall a great experience. The staff was great. The room was great. If you’re staying downtown, you need to check out this place. Our only issue was the keypad code system for the elevators and the room, but otherwise a great experience.

title: Very Good Service and Clean Rooms
text: This is a gem in NYC. We had no issues at this location. The service is great and the rooms are large and clean. We will be back. There are a lot of travel and food options nearby. I would also recommend the rooftop bar.

title: Luxurious apartment style suites
text: Loved the space and design of the suites. Very luxurious for the price and amazing that you can get a room this size and ceiling this high in New York downtown core. It was very convenient to have a kitchen as well. Location was also amazing, with a great cafe, restaurants (Michelin star), lounge/bar, grocery store within the same building. And a 7/11, liquor store, WeWork, all within 3 min walking distance. Would definitely recommend!

title: My stay at the Mint House was fantastic
text: I enjoyed my stay at the Mint House. I appreciated the congenial and pleasant demeanor of the staff. The layout of my apartment was warm and inviting! The location was perfect, close to a variety of restaurants, Wall Street, Broadway and the World Trade Center.

title: An Apartment Style Stay in Lower Manhattan
text:
This was my first stay in Mint House at 70 Pine and I will definitely stay there again. My room at Mint House had a full kitchen and plenty of space. It was a relaxing place to stay and it felt like I had my own apartment in NY. 
All staff were wonderful and happy to help me with anything I asked of them. 
If you are looking for an apartment style stay instead of a traditional hotel, this is a very good option to consider.

title: Sleepless Nights and No Service
text: Rude staff, blaring loud garbage trucks at night, no phones, keycards, or water in room. Zero service when issues were mentioned to staff. Stay anywhere else. It feels like staying at a midrange AirBnB, not a 4-star hotel.

title: Great place and convenient to downtown locations
text: Great place to stay, convenient to all places downtown and the price point was so much better than a drab, tiny room from the large hotel chains.  I almost want to keep this secret to myself.  I will definitely use your chain throughout the States.

title: The best of the best by far for Apartment Hotels
text: If I could give Mint House 1000 Stars I would.  There is nothing that I would change except maybe clearer instructions how to find the property. The staff is amazing.  There is nothing that Will, Vincent and everyone from housekeeping to management could have done to make our stay more pleasant.  I’ve stayed at many properties from the top tier Marriott Bonvoy to basic BW Hospitality House ( who treats their top tiered Diamond Select members like Garbage) Basic and INK48 ( who are awesome but don’t have a kitchen or kitchenette). The Mint House Bar None best stay in Manhattan.

title: A MUST STAY IN NYC
text: This hotel has the largest rooms I have ever stayed in in NYC.  Kitchenette, dining table, desk, seating area, co working space on the floor if you need it.  HUGE bathroom, Malin and Goetz amenities, fluffy towels.  Service impeccable.  Keyless so easy and very safe.  A half block from the subway.  Walking to all 9-11 memorials.AND SO QUIET for NYC- you don't hear the room next to you and there is very little traffic. And another thing- the only hotel room I have stayed in with a turntable and albums.

title: Loving The Mint House at 70 Pine
text:
Working between NYC and L.A., the Mint House has become my go-to location for what is more of an Apartment living vs your small room hotel. The rooms are extraordinarily spacious by NYC standards and well appointed with full kitchens, comfortable beds and full amenities. Someone commented that the decor was awful(?), guess that's a personal choice as I, as well as multiple friends visiting think the decor is modern and awesome!  Located in downtown (FiDi) and close to all major subway lines. Safe area thats within walking distances to shopping, restaurants, WTC and others places of interest.

Front desk staff are super friendly and helpful. And a special shout out and thanks to the maintenance crew, Paul, Pedro and Michael for their professionalism and promptly addressing a few issues that presented themselves during this current stay. 

High tech with most services via an app, which for the most part always works well though as in most things tech, there have been glitches. Its by far a business traveler's haven with great rooms to work remote as well as being located in historic Art Deco building that houses a full gym in the basement, two popular restaurants along  with the Black Fox Coffee Cafe and Blue Park Kitchen. It truly is a great value for the $.  Finally, a big thanks to Kenneth the Ops Mgr and Robert the Experience Mgr for always willing to listen to feedback and implement changes to improve the overall guest experience.

title: Great stay in a spacious, well kept apartment
text:
Our stay was great as the apartment was very large, with a full kitchen including all the utensils we would need. Yes the building is a bit hard to navigate. Plus I didn't love (as a smoker) trying to go outside in my sweats while people were waiting for the bar upstairs, dressed to the nines, but this was not a deal breaker. 

The apartments were quiet, clean, well appointed and convenient. Super crazy close to the 2 and 3 trains but not far from any trains. The area was quiet and safe. I'd recommend, and suggest that the exit only doors on Cedar could be changed to allow hotel access from that side.

title: 11/10 Stay
text: Highly recommend Mint house!! Comfy beds and very clean room. We loved the coffee shop downstairs and cocktail lounge on the top floor. I can't wait to go back and stay again, we were very pleased with how spacious the room was!

title: Loved the Mint House
text: Having been to New York for a holiday 8 years previously from Australia we were familiar with the area so it mostly suited what we wanted to do this time around.  For people who have never been to New York I probably wouldn't recommend this area unless you are happy to do a lot of walking which we like and also prepared to get the subway a bit.

title: Nice, large room in great location
text: The Mint House is part of a larger building but is in the heart of the downtown area. The room was very large and very clean, with a super comfortable bed and a Roku TV. I did not interact with staff other than for checking in and out but they were very nice and helpful.

title: Lots of room, great staff, bleak decor
text: Loved the rooms as it was perfect for a family. Really nice staff who were super friendly and helpful. Location wasn't too bad as we could get to plenty of places - though it would have been nice if it wasn't quite so smack dab in the middle of the financial district. The decor was awful - really dark walls and weird blown up face photographs. Made for a bleak and depressing atmosphere. Pillows were super soft and we needed extra as they became uncomfortable pretty quickly. Staff isn't the greatest at restocking supplies though the people downstairs were always helpful in providing more if asked. Beds are made and towels are restocked everyday but rooms are only cleaned once a week from what we experienced. Building has some fun amenities like bowling etc that needs to be reserved - if one has the time and interest.

title: Lovely studio in great location!
text: Amazing studio apartment in the heart of the financial district. Close to nice coffee shops and restaurants. Equipped with everything you need to cook at least breakfast and have a nice coffee before go out and walk around the city.

title: Excellent séjour de 10 jours
text:
Excellent emplacement. Magnifique immeuble et chambre agréable. 
Proximité de plusieurs lignes de métro. Excellente literie. Prévoyez des boules quies pour le bruit des éboueurs. Presence de produits lave vaisselle, sel poivre, thé, café, sucre.
Pas toujours attentif au changement de serviette et regarnissage des facilities mais réception efficace. On reviendra.

title: I'll be back
text:
This was a great location. Clean and first class. The staff was helpful and informative. The location had plenty of resources including a mini mart in the basement, a fitness facility, and one of the best coffee shops in NY (try the expresso seltzer). 

Not sure they stock every room with a turn table, but I enjoyed the vinyl selection to create some ambiance in the room while I worked and enjoyed its comfort. 

I'll be back,

title: Fantastic
text: I arrived after a long flight, the front of house staff were welcoming and helpful. The accommodation was top notch and there are plenty of amenities close by. The grocery at the basement, in particular is fantastic. I'd heard, from reading reviews, that the surrounding areas were a bit noisy, however it was quiet for me. If you want to be located in this area then I would strongly recommend staying at the Mint House, I genuinely can't find fault in my experience.

title: Best Stay in NYC by far
text: Not a hotel, but much better. Lots of space and just about enough service that you actually need. Location was little off as its pretty quiet after 6 PM, but that actually worked for us. There is a subway station (line 2,3) just opposite of the building which helps to connect to rest of the Manhattan.

title: Would definitely recommend!
text:
Lovely place, very pleasant staff, very little noise from outside at night which was a bonus 

If you are visiting NYC and want to be away from the husk end bustle then this is the place to stay, we looked at several option and we re so pleased that we chose Mint House!

Honestly the best part bout our trip was this accommodation

title: It’s spacious, clean, comfy and QUIET
text: Not a typical hotel which I like. It is more like having your very own very spacious apt minus noise in NYC. The room was very appropriately appointed with super comfy beds and amazing pillows. Clean huge bathroom with great products. And there is a fantastic large gym in the building for your use. Will stay again.

title: Fabulous place to stay!
text:
We highly recommend this hotel for couples or families! great location, with a grocery store and subway station close by.  The rooms are beautifully furnished and very comfortable. 
One downside was the noise coming from the room next door (there was a loud invasive argument;(
Otherwise, thumbs up!

title: Great location - great room.
text: I stayed in the Wall Street area a few years ago and it was spooky quiet on weekends.  Now it is lively with lots of good restaurants.  70 Pine is fantastic.  The room was big and quite reasonably priced.

title: Gorgeous building in a great location.
text: We've stayed at Mint House at 70 Pine several times.  Service is great, apartments are spacious and amenities are wonderful. We always recommend this hotel to friends.  The building itself is gorgeous.  The gym and bowling are an added bonus.

title: Great size for a family
text: Great size for a family, few issues with the mattresses and the actual beds as it is 1 bedroom, and 2 sofabeds, so if you were 6 adults, it wouldnt work. Great location, could walk to a lot of the highlights of New York, and the subway to Times Square was literally opposite. Supermarket underneath the building which was fantastic and covered all our needs, including the fresh cooked pizza.

title: Spacious, comfortable and quiet
text: We stayed in a huge studio apartment (with a full kitchen) for 5 nights and it was fabulous. It's in a quiet location, a few steps to the subway, and easy walking distance to the Battery for the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island boat, as well as the 9/11 memorial and museum. There's a supermarket on the corner and plenty of local bars and restaurants.

title: Mint House
text: We had a wonderful time at Mint House. The location was amazing in FIDI.  The rooms were huge and the best I’ve stayed at in NYC. The man who checked us was one of the best parts of the stay as well. He was so sweet and just went above and beyond to make sure we had the best time. We really appreciated him and this hotel.  We will definitely be staying here again.

title: Location, location, location
text: Half a block from 28L, my newfound favorite place to stay while working in NY. Great neighborhood with lots of dining and attractions. I have now stayed there 2x and I am booking my week there again. I'm trying to get to the rooftop bar this week!

title: A place you never want to leave
text: Great apartments (Studio plus) with comfortable bed and pillows, lovely interior design, superb kitchen and bathroom. Great location with inhouse coffee bar, convenience store, restaurant and roof top bar that should not be missed. I will come back! It's like a home away from home.

title: Enormous space with kitchen convenient and good service
text: Good location for business & leisure given access to subway to most everywhere.  You don't find rooms this large which was nice for family.  Having the kitchen was nice too when we got tired of going out or for breakfast.  I would not recommend their grocery service as there was a mixup in the order.  There is a grocery attached to the building so you don't need it.  The sleeper sofa however was very uncomfortable so while you can sleep someone there beware as the room we were in was a bit dated and the sofa was in need of some update and repair.  Heat/cooling was also off so again some maintenance needed.  Room looked nice though and very clean.  Quietest biggest room I've ever had in Manhattan.

title: Home Away from Home
text: I could live here! Our room was spacious with an artful simplicity that is clean and appealing. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom had beautiful tile work, an amazing shower, and toiletries that energized and rejuvenated. It was so nice to have a refrigerator, coffee maker, electric tea kettle, and microwave, especially since we had leftover food from a fabulous dinner. It is located in an impressive Art Deco building with a fun downtown location (in the financial district close to South Street Seaport, Chinatown, the Brooklyn Bridge). We would return for sure!

title: Spacious, comfortable, super location!
text: We were 2 adults and 2 young children in our group. The Studio Apartment with a king bed and a sofa bed was just right. There was plenty of walk in closet space. We could store our belongings without bumping into one another. The fully equipped kitchen was handy but we had little time to turn out meals. Also you would need to do a bit of grocery shopping from salt and pepper to everything else if you plan to cook. A hot breakfast was easily done and was very welcome. We would certainly stay at Mint House on our next visit too.

title: Had my very own NYC apartment for a night!
text: The studio was so large and comfortable.  The arrival experience felt more apartment than hotel but that made it all the more fun.  I traveled for a work meeting in Mint House Boardroom on fourth floor and with my room nearby it was ideal.  I also booked a two bedroom suite and it was amazing. We didn’t have time to checkout bowling or the rooftop, but loved the onsite coffee shop Black Fox.  Thanks to Peina in sales our business trip was also fun!

title: Perfect
text: Great location , 2 min away from subway. Apartment is super clean and massive. Brooklyn Bridge; 9/11 Memorial . Museum& Ferry to Statue of Liberty all in walkin distance. Kitchen is awesome. Shop on corner of building, restaurants in walkin distance.

title: great stay
text: everything was expected, the apartment was  clean and furnitures in perfect shape, very cosy accomodation. The building is in a gorgeus liberty style optimally preserved, The position is in the hearth of the financial district.

title: Don’t book early
text: We booked a room in Dec and a second one in Jan. No one mentioned at checkin that they room we booked early was at a rate $150. A night more than the exact same room we booked in Jan. We were there 2 nights. Checked in and out together with the same credit card. Later to discover the first room was 300. More. I called. No help. I felt like a sucker in NYC! Never going back there again.

title: Not what was promised
text: Before booking my bday stay with Mint House, I called to ask if any of the floors and/or rooms offered were pet restricted due to the fact that I have a severe allergy to pet dander.  I was told that there were no restrictions, however, ensured that they would provide a DEEP CLEAN of my room and there should not be an issue.  When I arrived, the room smelled of animal, there were two pet hair balls on the floor, the rug was dirty, the floors had not been mopped, I notice pet hair on the headboard and there were long strands of human hair throughout the shower and bathroom. Just gross.  I made the front desk aware and they did send someone to vacuum and mop floors, however, my allergies were in full swing.  I had to sleep with my travel mask on and eventually vacated the stay earlier than I had booked for because I could not physically stand it.  It was an insufferable stay and I was so disappointed to have to experience this during my 50th bday after calling and being promised that the room would be up to par.

title: Great ass staycation.
text: The place was very nice, i enjoyed my self. There was a record player and i liked the record selection. The speaker had Bluetooth and a nice base that fills up the room. Kitchen had everything i needed. The kettle was fancy and so was the coffee maker. I made breakfast and dinner and ate at the high top table. The bathroom lighting is great for people who like selfies.two shower heads for places for comfort.  There are multiple closet more than you will need. The robes were heavy but they felt like weight blankets (im a 100lb) so if you like that you have it. The tv does not come with streaming systems so I'll bring a computer and hdmi cord on my next stay. The location is very secure. To get to your floor you need a code or the elevator won't move.  Supermarket is near and many many restaurant. The only thing i can complain about was that the heat couldn't go higher than 68° . I strongly recommend it

title: An Excellent Place To Stay!
text: This has become by favorite place to stay in the Financial District!  I only want to stay here going forward.  The apartment was beautiful, clean and conveniently located.  I also dined at Crown Shy and wow, what an experience!  I highly recommend this place!

title: Excellence in the Financial District
text: The Mint House is a somewhat hidden gem located in the Financial District. Its amenities and overall cleanliness are top rate. The personnel, from the front desk attendants to the maid service, are friendly and professional.

title: Excellent Staycation in Lower Manhattan
text: Mint House is fantastic! You can't beat booking a hotel room with high ceilings, open layout, a FULL kitchen, beautiful bathroom, and king size bed. The amenities offered at Mint House are far in comparison to other hotels in the area.

title: Clean, Modern and Cool
text: Big apartment with lots of space, very clean, modern and well maintained with some very nice little special touches like a record player in each room with a selection of records to enjoy in room and at check in area to borrow.

title: Superb place for a family to stay and explore NYC!
text:
Mint House is a fantastic place and base for anyone visiting New York City, in the heart of the bustling Financial District, minutes from a subway to whisk you uptown and with eye-catching sights - Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street - within a short walk. 

As a family of four, we were looking for accommodation with a bit more space and the Mint House certainly provided that with a HUGE bed, well-stocked kitchen facilities, top-notch toiletries and ample space for storing luggage and getting dressed.

Just downstairs there is a superb grocery store with everything you can need and more, including fantastic freshly-cooked pizza and you also have handy access to a brilliant coffee shop as well as popular high-end restaurants above your head.

In summary, I couldn't recommend the Mint House more and we will be back!

title: Better than you can believe!
text: We just returned from (6) nights at Mint House & there are not enough superlatives to be heaped on this property. Not hotel rooms, apartments. Each with a turntable & NYC specific albums. Top- notch newly released hardcover books on the City as well! When they mention a food market nearby they didn't say it was one of the most well stocked gourmet markets you'll find; (I don't get excited about burgers but, try the one at Brooklyn Beef 'n Cheese located in the market) about 200 ft. from the entry door to the most beautiful architecturally lovely building. The beds were incredibly fluffy, firm & comfortable. A "nice" Subway station a few minutes walk away. South St. Seaport nearby. (Our cabby laughed when we gave him the 70 Mint address) as in - why do you need a ride there its so close! Throw a rock. Hit Brooklyn Bridge. Michelin star restaurant in the lobby if your into that. Drinks on the top floor lookout. Two-lane Bowling alley in the building. Just great !

title: Thoroughly Enjoyable Stay
text: Great room - comfortable, pleasant and very roomy.  The Mint House includes a record player and a handful of eclectic LP records for each guest's enjoyment.  I very nice touch indeed.  The decor is very nice.  The high ceilings add to the roomy-feeling.  The kitchen was a nice amenity - even though I only used it minimally on this trip.  Also, there was a fantastic, large walk-in closet.  All-in-all a great experience.  I'll be looking to stay here again upon future returns to New York.

title: Home in the city
text: The Mint House provided a spacious, quiet apartment which is near many things that made our weekend in Manhattan perfect. We walked to midtown, though easily could have taken the subway, enjoyed a late night drink at a bar on Water Street, and took a quick ferry ride to Dumbo to head to the Time Out Market. Summer time trips to Rockaway Beach would be a breeze from here.

title: 70 Pine
text: Great place to stay in an amazing historical building that has plenty of offerings close by. City Acres market, Pisillos Panini, Old Xian Noodle House. Bed was comfortable, kitchen was nice to have and the shower was great in my opinion.

title: Excellent!
text: Thank you Mint House for a wonderful stay! We will certainly recommend Mint House to any and all of our friends and family who may be looking to stay in NYC in the downtown area. We hope to see you again soon.

title: Mint house
text: We have stayed here before, it’s just everything you didn’t know you needed till you needed it. Washer, dryer, dishwasher, supermarket in the basement, coffee shop, cocktail bar, restaurant, Wall Street subway steps from the door that runs uptown to Times Sq. The Financial District is a lovely place to stay.

title: NY holiday from Australia
text: Fabulous accomodation and stay. Couldn’t fault the location which was central to all main attractions and close to subway. Rooms were well appointed and staff were very helpful. Highly recommend for a family vacation.

title: Beautiful surprise
text: From our side the building you are not impressed but as soo as u step through the revolving door the posh uptown market with contemporary furnishing takes over, the front desk are welcoming and very friendly (even when ur with ur mum and she announces she wants the toilet!) the rooms are packed with little treats from amazing night sleep in a cosy comfortable bed to wash stuff in the bathroom.!

title: Mint indeed
text: The studio apartment was amazing, one of the best hotel stays I had anywhere. The living room was huge, and so was the bathroom. The kitchen was well stocked. All the appliances were brand new and high end. And the location was also great, with subway station just across the street. Didn't want to leave...

title: Very nice apartment in a special position
text:
Very good apartment with a lot of services in a perfect position to live New York. There is also a Market inside the building and Metro station is in about 100mt.
You have inside the apartment everything you need…

title: They think of everything!
text: We absolutely loved our stay at Mint House. It was so nice to move away from the crowds of Times Square to a location that was still very easily accessible to everywhere we wanted to visit. The apartments were so well appointed - including tea/coffee supplies. Loved the keypads on the doors and the recreation areas were a lot of fun for the adult kids in the trip. Highly recommend!

title: Good Hotel BUT!
text:
Good hotel in general.
Pay attention to the room you are given if it’s what you’ve booked.
Some people in the reception are rude, your mood can take a hit!
The cleanliness is not top, there was lot of hair everywhere in the room.

title: Christmas holidays
text:
Calm location, close to commodities and subways 
Large appartement with everything at disposal as at home . You can enjoy restaurant close to Pine Street but also share home diner with family . Very secure area close to Wall Street

title: Great location and rooms
text: The apartment was spacious and clean. Great location (close to subway). The building amenities were also really nice (bowling alley, gym…). I would recommend this place for family trip. The check in/check out process was also smooth.

title: Mint House FiDi
text: Liked  · Mint House is set in a amazing building at Pine Street. I have Ben visiting this hotel in its various guises as 70 Pine, Lyric, and Mint House. The rooms especially those above floor 4 are exceptional in terms of design, decor and equipment. For me the location is amazing far away from madness of midtown, a subway directly opposite and walking a 30 minute walk to areas such as Chinatown, Mulberry Street, TriBeCa whilst being very close to the WT complex, Wall Street and the Old Sea Port. Black Fox cofeee whilst offering Wall St prices is exceptional and the buildings Gym is rarely busy and has a everything you need. City Acres market for groceries if required is amazing as well as its takeway meal offering I don’t think I have ever seen such a range of choices

title: Very Nice expérience
text: we stayed over Christmas.  the experience was ultra positive, the location, the atmosphere, the welcome and the services.  the team is available and pleasant.  the apartment was clean, comfortable with each its space for a couple and a teenager.  I recommend Mint House.

title: Nothing short of amazing
text:
This place is amazing, the rooms are huge (we had a studio and it was massive) we absolutely loved the space and the location being across from the subway, a 15 minute walk to 9/11 and the same to battery park for the starter island ferry and Statue of Liberty tours.

The building is gorgeous and there’s so many things around it including multiple Walgreens for supplies (don’t us the shop in the hotel it’s triple the price of Walgreens)

The only improvements I could suggest is that each room should come with either a broom or a vacuum as the floors get dirty and housekeeping don’t do a full clean until night 7. The tea selection should also include English breakfast (we did ask at reception but in the end bought our own)

We struggled with the tv and trying to sign into our apps or use our firestick but maintenance brought us the proper Samsung remote and we were fine from there.

For me you have nearly every box ticked but I think you could add a few “delighters” if you wanted to keep ahead of the competition for example provide a load of bread and a carton of milk in the room on arrival with the cookies and water. We also stayed over Christmas and it would have been nice to receive something on Christmas Day. Nothing huge maybe just a card and a box of cookies outside the door.

All in all we loved the stay and we will 100% be back! Mint house will be the brand we look for in all city’s moving forwards.

title: Excellent Stay in NYC
text: Mint House was provided an excellent stay in NYC. Our Family (2 adults, 2 college-age) very much enjoyed the comfort, space, and location of the apartment.  All amenities were excellent. Looking forward to return visit.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: The mint house was such great hotel!! The staff was super friendly, it was very clean and stylish, and in a nice safe  area in downtown Manhattan. Would definitely recommend and will for sure be back!!

title: A bit disappointed..
text:
The apartment is good quality but the bathroom not really. We were really surprised and disappointed. The cleaning needs to be improved.. they also forgot to clean the room one day. 
Good location close to Wall Street station.

title: Amazing stay, our go-to hotel in nyc
text:
Honestly this place is amazing and totally deserves the hype! My go-to nyc hotel from now on - great staff, amazing decor and amenities. The only thing to keep in mind is the place is kinda hidden and hard to find at first. 

Crown shy and Overstory are both in the same building (70 Pine St).

title: Amazing space
text: This was delux lodging in a quirky location, most people skip the financial district but it's full of great restaurants and is a surprisingly lively place on the weekends. We would definitely stay there again.

title: Great service and apartments
text: One of the nicest places I've stayed in NYC. It was for business. Rooms were large and great looking. the staff were very friendly and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again given the opportunity!

title: Perfect Accommodations in NYC
text: Mint House has surprisingly large studios for NY with lots of storage space, a beautiful kitchen, a simple but nice bathroom. The bed is very comfortable and the design has a nice edge to it. A metro station is right across the hotel entrance. Loved our stay!

title: Wonderful hotel in FiDi
text: My second stay here was as good as the first. Everything from booking, confirmation, checking-in to checking-out was truly pleasurable. Love the retro rooms and listening to records. The kitchen and spacious bathrooms are a plus. Will be my go-to in FiDi.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Had a weekend in New York and had a great stay here. Located in financial district but easy access to trains to get anywhere. Friendly staff and clean rooms couldn’t ask for more! Great coffee just downstairs at black fox too!

title: Fantastic property in the financial district
text:
This was my first time staying in the financial district and it won't be my last. Mint House has all the amenities you could wish for, and then some. The room was beyond spacious and I loved having access to a full kitchen, walk in closet, etc. 

The staff are incredibly friendly and there are so many wonderful personal touches as you arrive. Only thing that gave me a bit of trouble was the air conditioner - it wouldn't hold at a lower temperature, so was a bit warm. 

The gym in the building is next level (although a bit of a mission to get there). I just wished it opened earlier than 8am on the weekends. 

The restaurants in the building were absolutely perfect. 

Can highly recommend Mint House.

title: Nice but noisy
text:
I really wanted to like this hotel. It’s modern, stylish, and rooms are well appointed. However, it was so noisy with garbage trucks from 2 to 5 AM, by the second day I checked the noise level and it was almost 90 decibels. That’s like trying to sleep on a subway platform. The front desk informed me they would all be over in a minute. It lasted for hours.
I don’t know what they can do about the noise but it’s really unfortunate. The hotel has potential.

title: Disappointed
text: I chose the Mint because my daughter and her family live at 70 Pine.  I problems I ran into were: only one small bar of soap to use at the sink and no soap or shampoo for the shower; when I went to use the tub, brown water came out of the faucet so no bath while there; the railing by the three steps leading up to room 231 fell off the wall; one window shade was out of it's track but maintenance fixed that; when I came back the last night there was a crumpled paper towel next to the bed; I was not alerted ahead of time to bring log in and passwords for TV streaming services I have so was stuck with the limited "free" offerings on the TV; because there are stairs in the room from the bed area to the bath, etc.; it would have been nice to have a small, not too bright, night light rather than having to leave on the bright bathroom light at night to see when I got up in the middle of the night; I was unable to convey any of these problems via phone (no number listed anywhere to call) or by text/email which I tried to do by signing up for the app but never received a reply - so I had to go down to the desk in my pjs and a jacket where I will say Candace was very understanding and helped.

title: Great hotel for large families!!!
text: My family of 6 (2 adults and 4 kids) stayed in a 1 bedroom with 2 sofa beds and 2 bathrooms.  Our apartment was approximately 1400 sq ft.  I highly recommend this hotel for the large apartment and full size kitchen, and close location to the subway.  I would definitely stay here again with my family however next time I would reserve a 2 bedroom instead of the one bedroom option.  Both sleep 6 but the two bedroom has a washer/dryer inside the unit and is smaller ( 1050 sq ft).  I would be willing to sacrifice less space for a washer/dryer in the unit.  They provide complimentary water bottles in the front reception area.  We were walking distance to the 9/11 memorial and also statue of liberty ferry.  We were about a 15 min subway ride from Chinatown and 25-30 ride to times square.

title: Great location in NYC - for business or leisure
text:
Great 3 night stay for team meeting with a ton of convenient options including a gym, bowling, golf, coffee shop, 2 nice restaurants and a full market right in your building!
If you are traveling for business or leisure and want the convenience of an apartment with the space and amenities, this location is highly recommended.

title: Style over substance!
text: Based on the reviews, we were really excited to stay at Mint House, but sadly for us the visit really didn’t meet expectations. The disappointment began at check in. At first we were told that our room wasn’t ready. Not a problem, we’d grab a bottle of water or coffee in reception while we waited. But no, there were no cups for the coffee machine …oh, and no water either. We stood there in disbelief – there was no one else in reception and the staff were not willing to help or even call housekeeping? They’re located above a supermarket, so why couldn’t they replenish the water, at least for the guests that were due to check in? Reception staff said there’d been a wedding the day before and they’d emptied out the fridge and used all the coffee cups. Surprised at their nonchalance, we were quickly relieved to hear that they had found a room for us. We were in a King room and was quite dark, but given the location of the property this wasn’t a surprise to us. We quickly unpacked and started making coffee. But… there was no creamer, and no milk, in the room. We tried contacting reception via the app and number provided, but nothing. Also… there was no safe. What hotel room in this day and age doesn’t have a safe?! We went to reception to ask for some milk or creamers, we were told they only had milk, but as there were no cups, we couldn’t take any (!) We also asked about a safe and were told that the rooms on the second floor were new and didn’t all have safes in yet! Needless to say, we were already regretting our booking. Then one of the reception staff (I can’t remember his name) offered to get us some milk, and put it in our room. He was trying to be helpful, so we thought maybe they’re just having a bad day. The trouble didn’t end there, however… when we returned to our room later that evening, we began to be aware of a loud humming noise. We contacted reception and this time they did answer the phone, and promptly sent up a technician. He couldn’t locate the source. Reception then agreed to move us, so at 10.30pm we moved to a new room - a smaller Queen sized room. It was located near the lifts, but thankfully was a lot quieter. We were offered breakfast vouchers as compensation. At checkout, the reception staff were apologetic, even saying ‘you’ve not had the best stay, have you?’ But since then we’ve heard nothing from the management. There were other issues, but this is not a hotel we can recommend! Our stay was beyond disappointing!

title: wonderful property spoiled by overnight construction nearby
text: Otherwise terrific, spacious accommodations were ruined by construction noise through the night.  The staff was quite helpful and moved us to another room that also had (garbage truck related) noise for a couple of hours in the middle of the night which also interfered with our sleep.  Would recommend checking on the status of overnight construction along Pine St before booking.

title: When in this area of NYC,,,,,Mint House is the place to stay
text: We stayed here for my nieces wedding.  We were so pleased with the size of our room, and the overall quality. Staying in NYC we didn't expect such a great room, with a kitchen, closet space and large bathroom.  We were very pleased

title: Great for NYC Marathon
text: I stayed here for its close proximity for the ferry station and it did not disappoint. I also liked the amenities and room styles to be able to have my own meal. The main down sides were a passcode entry (no keys or card) and the echo in the rooms.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: We could not believe the size of this place and all of the little personal touches. There was a record player with records, the bed couches were amazing. Wine openers, decanters, Crystal glassware, slow trip premium coffee, perfect location. We honestly were shocked. We will definitely stay again!

title: Perfect for a Family
text: My family and I stayed here and it was perfect. We were a family with three kids. It was spacious, clean, comfortable, and they had cribs available for our two little ones. Would highly recommend staying here.

title: 2nd time at Mint
text:
And always happy to be here. Very spacious studio, clean and very convenient.
All the equipment you need for a stay for several nights, very quiet if you need rest.

I need to write more characters, but not inspired too much, so just choose Mint House !

title: Cool space, terrible sleeping experience.
text:
Pros:
- The location was perfect for me, as it was close to my office. (albeit, hard to figure out how to enter the building)
- Cool decor, great kitchen, and lots of closet space

Cons:
- Terrible pillows (too low, flimsy, no other options), uncomfortable mattress (felt old and beat up), and bedding (the bed was made quite poorly, with sheets not properly tucked in and super wrinkly)
- Hard to sleep with bad blackout curtains, that weren't wide enough to close the full span of the windows. This, paired with an empty building across the street with very bright lights on every floor, made for a really poor resting experience.
- very noisy (the windows let a lot of noise through)
- The lack of keys to the room was ok, but the code keypads on the elevators were very janky and hard to use. having to touch surfaces wasn't pleasant, and the hand sanitizer dispensers were empty.

title: October stay in NYC
text:
First stay sine Minthouse took over and I’m glad to say it’s still lovely.

Super location in a beautiful Art Deco skyscraper that provides a calm influence after the hustle of the city.

Room was lovely, we’ll appointed and comfortable, yes you do hear some outside noise, but it is a big city and isn’t too invasive.

I’d jump at the chance to stay here again

title: stylish, spacious and big apartment with every facility and more
text: Mint House is a brilliant base for a visit to Manhattan. Rooms are huge with cool, comfortable and stylish furnishing plus all the facilities you might need include a full kitchen. Supermarket in the building and Wall Street Subway right outside. Lots of extras to love like a record deck and New York themed albums in every room.

title: Amazing experience!
