text: Incredible room size and decor, friendly staff, great amenities. The most comfortable stay in NY I’ve had thus far! Our team also used the meeting room (the space used to be a vault of this historical building, that was an experience on its own). Highly recommended!

title: Hipster House
text: I enjoyed my 5-day stay very much. The apartment had everything needed for a comfortable extended stay.  It was very well-stocked, spacious, new, and nicely decorated. The vinyl records and turntable were a great addition. The bed was super comfy, and the king-suite layout is quite large, with a separate sleeping area that was perfect. The building is beautiful, quiet, and safe, with very helpful front desk staff. The building amenities are also excellent, including an on-site market, upscale restaurant, coffee shop, and cafe. The only complaint is the general darkness of the room which lacks natural light.

title: Mint is a Great Place to Stay
text: Professional and friendly staff who know their job, clean rooms, and great location. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in the Manhattan area. They even kept a package mailed to me from my previous stay and gave it to me this time round!

title: Mint House, the best place to stay downtown manhattan
text:
Third stay at Mint House when in  NY on business. I love the space, the decor, the fact that everything works and you have the ability to cook for yourself if you want. (On biz trips I really don't want to eat out every day). The room gets a quick tidy every day and consumables are restocked. 
It's less than 10 minutes walk to World Trade Center and blows away anywhere nearer there I or other people have stayed for anything like the price. 
If you want to stay in an actual room bigger than a matchbox when you stay downtown NY, just book Mint House.

title: Beautiful stay!
text: We loved our stay at Mint House 70 Pine. The room was very spacious and very cool to stay in. There were great facilities on site including gyms and a theater. You can’t beat the location in the heart of the financial district with subways very close by and so much good food and drinks in the area.

title: Great service, quality and location
text: I had a great stay and enjoyed the amenities. The staff was helpful with good food recommendations and with logistics. I enjoyed the quality of the furnishing and kitchen equipment. I was able to make a great cup of coffee from the comfort of my room and also able to grab a great coffee to go from an amazing coffee shop downstairs. I felt safe in the area Nd the location was perfect for Wall Street, the 9/11 memorial, Battery Park, Statue of Liberty and Seaport. I would 100% stay again

title: Mint House
text: The accommodations exceeded our expectations!  We would stay there again even if going to Broadway shows or 5th Ave shopping because the tranquil space of the Mint House at the end of the day was perfect!

title: Great stay at the Mint House
text: I stayed one night for a business event and it was perfect.  Easy check in and great security.  The lobby is very modern and has water and coffee, but the apartments are the real highlight.  They are spacious and well appointed with kitchens and turntables.  Very nice to easily start up some vinyl by NY artists to listen to while getting ready to go out.  Very comfortable bed and nice products in the shower.  Check out was quick.  I will stay here again.

title: Large, quiet, well appointed room
text: Large quiet, well appointed room. Fun to have vinyl record player with records to choose from. Bluetooth speakers was also an added bonus. Had to ask for batteries to be replaced in remotes which was promptly accomplished. No ice in room that we could figure out. Good location. Beautiful building.

title: Great stay at the Mint
text: Little family trip to nyc. Found the mint and decided to stay since it was larger than standard hotel rooms. Super clean spacious apartment that gave our family room to be comfortable. Easy check in close to destinations we wanted to do such as Statue of Liberty and Ellis island tour. Market on the corner where we could get shopping supplies for food and drinks. Great stay highly recommended

title: Great service, spacious and spotless studio, convenient location
text: Let me check in at 10am when I mean to drop my luggage only. Also help me to verify password for elevator and room works. Large and clean studio, walking distance to subway stations and most downtown Manhattan attractions.

title: Lovely historic pragmatic
text: Perfect location with a great market for food and a kitchen you could not ask for better amenities. Suitable for both families and others, especially for all coffee lovers as the local cafe and in-suite amenities for coffee are more than ideal.

title: Lots of space, full kitchen!
text: Room was spacious, comfortable, clean, and relaxing. Building was beautiful, staff was friendly. Having a full kitchen would be great for next time I travel to NYC with my kids. Great coffee shop in lobby. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: We recently spent a very enjoyable week at Mint House at 70 Pine. It was our first time in NYC and the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful, in particular Maalikk and David on reception who were always happy to advise and answer any questions that we had. The hotel is a beautiful Art Deco building conveniently located for sites including Ground Zero, Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge, and Wall Street plus a good selection of restaurants within walking distance. The subway is opposite which we used almost daily to travel further around the city. The rooms were spacious, very comfortable and extremely well equipped with a welcoming packet of cookies, water and an introductory letter. When here I would recommend visiting the rooftop bar with its amazing views and again exceptional service. I can't recommend this hotel  highly enough and we wouldn't hesitate staying here again.

title: Great Apartment for a reasonable price
text: The Mint House in NYC was extremely affordable yet had all the amenities, service and more that you could possible want. Fully furnished rooms with a fully furnished kitchen, the option to have the groceries stocked before I checked in is an amazing option to have, will most definitely come back again.

title: Well located spacious apartment
text: We stayed at Mint House for seven nights in Sept 22 and found the apartment (deluxe 1 bedroom) to be well sized for our family of six (6). Mint House is well located, with a subway station on weekdays directly opposite and have lots of options for food, and it is good to be away from the heavy tourist areas.

title: Fabulous stay at Mint House at 70 Pine Street
text:
Me and my girlfriend stayed in a deluxe studio apartment for 10 nights. On arrival the staff member was friendly and helpful with providing information about the hotel and our booking. The apartment was very clean and had many amenities such as coffee, sugar etc for when we arrived and was restocked daily if needed. House keeping was good. All appliances worked well. The bathroom was clean and easy to use. The bed was extremely comfortable which helped after long days exploring New York. 

The location of hotel was good in walking distance to subway stations and when departing it was easy to get a taxi with the help of the staff. Plenty of storage for suitcases and having a safe for added security. The only thing missing from the room was a chest of drawers to store clothes but this was manageable. 

Extremly good value for money, and would happily stay there again if we return to New York.

title: Highly recommended - far above average
text:
Our stay at Mint House NYC was quite nice.

The location was great.

The accoutrements were a very nice touch.

And Gabrielle at the front desk was a customer-service superstar!  She represented Mint House exceedingly well in all our interactions. Her answers to our questions were thorough, and her assistance ensured all issues were handled immediately and completely.

My daughter and I LOVED the turntable and the associated albums with an eclectic mix of music. My wife was not as impressed, but she did, in fact, like the bath robes and access to a full kitchen, complete with required tools.

The location is a tradeoff... it's in the Financial District, so it's not what one would call "centrally located."  However, NYC has a plethora of transportation options. It's a short walk to One World Trade, subway entrance, Battery Park, and (of course) Uber and Lyft will pick you up literally at the front door.

We will absolutely consider staying at the NYC Mint House again.

title: Fantastic apartment, beautiful character building
text: Outstanding apartment with something for everyone. In today's world cleanliness and service are at the forefront of any travel experience.  This accommodation stands out from the crowd & should be on everyones list. The welcome and arrival basket sets the tone, and its all up from there.  The Black Fox coffee - best coffee in town!

title: My new favorite place to stay in NYC!
text: I lived in NYC for 11 years prior to moving to the West Coast and travel back frequently for business. Every time I'm there for work I try to book at a hotel that makes me feel like I'm in truly New York (boutique hotels, not a Marriot or Hilton) but that usually means skimping on space. The Mint House concept is perfect for me--you get the boutique hotel vibe that's aligned with where you are, in addition to MUCH more space w/the comforts of home (full kitchen with cookware, etc.). You're also in an ideal downtown location if you need or want to be near the Financial District and South Street Seaport.I highly recommend the MInt House and will definitely be staying there agian.

title: Perfect for long stays
text: I love the spotless apartment, the full kitchen, the enormous amount of space for NYC, and that there is a grocery store, gym and restaurants in the building.  SO convenient and cofortable for my week long stay.

title: Comfortable stay at Mint House
text:
The room was large, quiet and well located. The bed & pillows were very comfortable which is always a bonus . 
The 2 aircon units were aliitle noisy but because of the large room we were able to turn off the one next to the bed . The lighting was also abit dim .

title: Be cautious of where your apartment is located
text: If construction is occurring and your stay is over Mon - Fri…you have been warned.  Also if you are using the living area as a bed room be cautious if the apartment is visible from nearby businesses and have a face mask when the sun starts blaring early in the morning.  Nice location for getting around NYC, nice selection of restaurants near, grocery store attached to the building, with some modifications you could make this a relaxing adventure.

title: Awesome
text: Sehr sauberes und großes Apartment im Financial District, gute Ausgangslage für verschiedenste Sehenswürdigkeiten, Umgebung mit vielen Restaurants, Personal überaus freundlich, Ausstattung sehr gut - auch für längere Zeit

title: MInt House 9/4-9/10 2022
text: This is the best stay we have had in NYC.  We come fairly often and have stayed in places all over Manhattan, but never FiDi.  It's really the perfect location.  Easy subway access, easy walking to Brooklyn, and easy to Uber.  Lots of good restaurants close by, and so easy to get to Theater District for a show.  It is quiet at night and very manageable walking around, day and night.

title: Un hôtel au cœur du quartier des affaires
text: Hôtel bien placé dans le quartier de Wall Street, à proximité de l'East River et du World Trade Center.  On  accède à l'accueil en parcourant un superbe hall et des couloirs en marbre. Le personnel est professionnel, donnant quelques informations à notre arrivée. Au 3ème étage , on découvre le studio très bien équipé (frigo-congélateur, machine à café, four traditionnel et micro-onde, plaques induction…). Le côté chambre est agréable, décoration sympathique, on peut écouter un 33 tours vinyle . La salle de bain très propre, avec tout ce qu'il faut comme équipements de toilette. Par contre la température de la chambre est très fraiche, la climatisation a été programmée sur une basse température, ce qui a relancé le système de froid dans la nuit en créant des nuisances sonores pour notre 1ère nuit. Ce problème a été signalé à l'accueil. Le service en chambre a été effectué avec efficacité en complétant chaque jour les différents effets et matériels: serviettes, sachets de thé et café, produits divers...La chambre donnant côté rue est un peu bruyante : travaux très tôt le matin, ramassage des poubelles… Une meilleure isolation aurait permis d'atténuer les bruits. En considérant le confort du studio, les équipements du coin cuisine et les services, on peut considérer que nous avons été globalement très satisfait de notre séjour.

title: Great Value!!
text: Any hotel room in Mahattan is going to be pricy so all you can look for is good value for the money.  Mint House at 70 Pine is exactly that.  With three occupants, I was looking for a King and a roll out bed.  Most places in the same price range offered only two full beds or two queens.  Mint House gave us a King and a Queen in separate rooms!  Moreover, we got a full kitchen, plenty of dining, storage, and living space, a turntable with great vinyl, and an immaculately prepared/cleaned room!  There were no hidden fees (other than that they couldn't offer onsite parking) and the staff was friendly.  I challenge you to find another hotel offering that value in the sub-$400 range.  Thank you for a great stay, Mint House!

title: Mrs.
text: Very nice experience, I liked this hotel very much, very modern , clean, big and enough space , access easily to everywhere, staff very nice and professional. Very big kitchen and a nice and big closet with all you need, extra towel and iron and extra pillow and blanket all very clean and nice.

title: Awesome stay at Mint!
text: We heard about Mint from a friend and it exceeded expectations! Very spacious room with a kitchen, refrigerator and Microwave. Very clean and well kept. Fun location an a quiet street 2 blocks from Wall Street. Awesome!

title: Great stay!
text: Clean, fun, super comfy bed and very convenient for a family traveling with a toddler. Too cold inside the apt though. It was barely 63 degrees when we first got in and it took forever to warm up. We have a toddler so yes, I travel with a room thermometer :) So anyway, really wasteful for the planet and kind of inconfortable feeling when you’re trying to sleep. Other than that, I’ll go back for sure.

title: Best and comfy place in NYC
text: Not comparable big chain. Time sq or mid town is too busy to stay. It was best place to enjoy NYC. Their amenity, coffee, and cookers are very good condition and memorable items. I will highly recommend to my friend who is planning to visit NYC

title: Wonderful stay at Mint House
text: Loved everything about our stay here.  The location, the building, the amenities, the apartment, the space in the apartment, the decor, the linens, the very comfortable bed, and the lovely soaps and shampoo.  Front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and very much appreciate that they let us check in early after a red eye flight.  Would highly recommend, and look forward to staying again.

title: Stylish home from home
text: The apartments at Mint House are fabulous. Spacious (especially for New York), stylish, and full of all the little things you want in a stay. The building is beautiful in itself. I had a really comfortable stay and would stay again no question. The only thing is there is no help with one's luggage.

title: Spacious in Manhattan
text: Room was very clean and spacious, which says a lot in NYC. Great for families as the location is less chaotic and within the hotel you could hear nothing from outside nor from neighbors. Overall, when compared to other hotels, you get way more bang for your buck.

title: More than 5 stars place
text: Awesome place , clean , tidy, friendly staff, good location , great coffee place on the building ,  lot of things to do near by, close to the metro, nice apartment with all kitchen stuff included, family friendly

title: Stylish Modern Apartment in Art Deco Surroundings
text: Clean & spacious. Comfy beds. Great amenities. Nice area, felt safe and relaxed. Staff helpful. We loved the coffee and music collection. Easy walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge & ferries. Subway near by.

title: Mint House is now our favorite place to stay in Manhattan
text: We absolutely loved staying at Mint House and loved the beautiful Art Deco building and the FiDi location.  Our apartment was spacious and comfortable.  The few requests we made (like foam pillows and bar stools for the counter) were promptly answered.  Rob and Brie were particular standouts among the staff. They  always greeted us warmly and were receptive to any suggestions we made on how to take Mint House from a five star property to a five star plus property.  We loved having a full kitchen and the convenience of having City Acres in the building.  We also ate at Crown Shy (what a plus to have a Michelin star restaurant in the building), and had a workout in the spacious and well-equipped  fitness center in the basement.  Now that we have experienced Mint House, we can't imagine staying anywhere else in Manhattan.  We will definitely book again at Mint House on our next trip to the Big Apple!

title: 2 weeks in NYC
text: First time staying in the Financial District and at the Mint House.  The Mint House was a pleasant surprise and I very much enjoyed the convenience to the Ferry, Seaport and all the other attractions in lower Manhattan.  Having a decent market, City Acres, right in the building, was a nice perk.

title: Mint House at 70 Pine
text: Golf simulator and gym were great. Bed top class. Room very well cleaned when needed. Shower gel and shampoo/conditioner provided. Record player was a lovely touch. USB charging next to bed was ideal.

title: Great stay at Mint House!
text: We booked the two bedroom suite for a family reunion and it was perfect for the occasion. Very clean, comfortable and well appointed bedrooms, kitchen, dining room. The building had great restaurant, coffee shop and grocery store on the premises. Staff was friendly, and very accommodating. Only drawback was the block that the hotel was on was closed to traffic, so made check in and check out a little challenging.

title: Wonderful place for a honeymoon
text: From the lovely room to the honeymoon care package to the neat gym to coffee at Black Fox, we thoroughly enjoyed our honeymoon stay at Mint House. We plan to return to NYC and we will definitely stay at Mint House again.

title: Mint House 2 month stay
text:
Excellent amenities, weekly room service was great. Gym is amazing but closes really early (6 pm) on weekends.

Only complaint is that the interior of my room was too dark and didn't have central lighting. Walls were also dark-colored, and was a bit depressing at times.

title: extra
text:
Nous avons eu la chance de réserver longtemps à l'avance, en période covid, avec des tarifs intéressants.
Pour New York, et pour Manhattan, le rapport qualité/prix/localisation est imbattable.
Le tout dans des appartements vastes, très bien équipés, avec goût.
Le 70 pine est magnifique.
Expérience formidable à renouveler

title: Excellent apartment
text: Well located close to the financial district, lots of space, everything you need for a short or even long stay in NY. Nicely decorated and kitted out. Bed was very comfy and relatively quiet (even though it’s NY)

title: This was my second time staying here.
text: This was my second time choosing here. This time I was impressed with the cleanliness and the quick check in. Reception was willing to answer my  questions. And this time, my room, use the code to enter the room instead of the keycard.

title: Mint House Best!
text: I stay here for months at a time for business in NYC. The cleanliness and kindness is the best! Location is close to anything and everything to eat, activities, shopping and the water! The price is very comparable and I would even pay double it's that great! Looking forward to coming back this fall!

title: Huge NYC Home Away From Home @ Mint House @ 70 Pine
text: I booked the 1400 sq ft 1 bedroom and it was huge.  I knew how big it was when i booked, but i was still pleasantly surprised when i actually arrived.  The location is not the greatest, but the size and price is great.  The gym is a nice full sized gym, not one of those hotel gyms.  The staff is super helpful and friendly and they really get things done quickly and are to the point.  i really like that.  I would definitely stay here again next time i'm in town if they are available.

title: Excellent stay
text:
Excellent stay at Wall Street. Near the subway and a lot of restaurants. 
A few walk to Brooklyn bridge and battery park to the ferry .
Very nice appartement for family and good restaurant and bar in the building

title: This place is Amazing!!
text: First time staying in the Financial District and Mint House was convenient to plenty subway stations for ease of getting around. The Studio Apartment was very spacious and the kitchenette had everything you'd need. The bed was huge and so, so comfortable. Because the rooms are on the lower floors of a building located in narrow streets they can be quite dark in the living/bedroom area - but honestly that fault is not a fault - that is just being picky!! Check in and out was swift and hassle free and the staff were friendly and communication was great. My husband and I absolutely loved every minute of our 3 week stay here and would highly recommend.

title: Nos sentimos como en casa, un apartamento con TODO lo necesario.
text: Más que recomendable!!! las habitaciones grandes, la cama era comodísima, la cocina no le faltaba detalle para hacer la estancia como estar en casa. la ubicación perfecta junto a la boca del metro 2 y 3,  un supermercado cerca.....  y cerca de todo lo que buscábamos.... EXCELENTE

title: Truly Amazing Property that Is Not to be Missed
text: The Mint House property is the best hotel in all of New York City, the entire United States, and one of the best hotels in the world.  The onsite gym, bowling alley, golf simulator, private movie theater etc., is unmatched by any hotel anywhere, and that is before you get to the Michelin star restaurant, second restaurant that is just as good and a top 50 in the world bar with a roof top view that is among the best in New York City.  The hotel staff and manager are also truly amazing and make the property feel like home.  This is my first review, as I thought it important to commend the truly amazing experience my family and I had at this hotel, because the attention to detail (specialty coffee from a top roaster in NY available in every room) and level of service is unparalleled.  We had a truly excellent and memorable stay at this hotel, and I highly recommend it as an avid user of American Express’ Fine Hotel and Resorts program who has stayed at some of the world’s best hotels.

title: Sehr gute Unterkunft im Financial District
text: Hervorragend ausgestattete Apartements im Financial District, in unmittelbarer Nähe der Wall Street. Subway und diverse Fähren gleich um die Ecke. Rooftopbar Overstory mit phantastischer Aussicht im gleichen Gebäude.

title: Outstanding
text: Outstanding experience - the room, service, location were great.  We visited our son and his family who live in an apartment in the same building.  It was very convenient to see them.  The location was near a lot of sites in walking distance. Would stay there again.

title: Fabulous stay at the Mint House
text: Super quiet area of NY. Was perfect for my family of four. Highly recommend for those traveling with families. We took advantage of the stock your stay option so that we could have breakfast and snacks readily available. Great location. Great staff. Great room.

title: One of the best in Manhattan
text: I am a frequent visitor to New York and have to affirm, that this hotel is of it's own class - nothing to compare. Huge rooms, magnificient bedding, all the appliances needed for comfortable stay and even vinil player - get your favorite discs with you!

title: above and beyond
text: This hotel has excellent service and wonderful accommodations.  Parking at 201 Pearl is definitely your best bet if you are driving into town.  This place is the real deal with both the 9/11 memorial and Battery Park within walking distance.  It's the only hotel I've stayed in with a record player and music related to NYC.  I highly  recommend this hotel!

title: Great Stay In NYC
text: I viist NYC often and was amazed at this GREAT find - we visited with friends and so enjoyed the spacious quarters, the lovely people at the front desk and the amenities of The Mint.  Well done!  We'll be back.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Check in was fast and efficient.  Staff was helpful with luggage.  Room was spacious and had nice amenities.  The turntable was a plus.  Requests for extra pillow was responded to quickly.  The Caspar bed was extremely comfortable.  Check out was also easy and efficient.

title: exceptional accommodation
text: accommodation is exceptional for New York large spacious the quality of the accommodation is very high the cleanliness the cleaning is perfect the staff very welcoming and very professional and kind thank you to them because our stay was a dream!

title: Mint House stay for (delayed) 30th birthday trip
text:
This was hands down the best hotel we’ve stayed in, period. Great room by New York standards, but beyond that it was so crisp and cool - colourful yet considered. It was on the pricey side against what we’d normally pay, but we absolutely felt that we got what we paid for. 
Stand out parts were the abundance of size/room which were big in general, and not just big for New York. The tasteful, modern decor. The fully equipped kitchen (proper old school coffee machine with high quality coffee!). The mini hifi set up. The bed. I could go on, but you get the idea. It was truly excellent and made our trip.

title: Amazing apartment hotel in financial district
text:
Spacious modern apartment. Really well appointed with aircon. Kitchen had everything for self catering. 
Bowling Alley was great fun. 
Great communication before and during our stay. Friendly approachable staff 24hrs. 
Easy access to multiple subway stations made getting around easy.  
Would definitely recommend and stay here again!

title: Just wonderfull!
text:
Un super appartement où le moindre détail compte!
De l’espace, du confort, une literie exceptionnelle ! Le top à New York a proximité de toutes les activités .
Aller dans le quartier financier était finalement un bon choix, proximité des attractions au sud et accessibilité en quelques minutes des attractions au nord! Top!

title: Best hotel I’ve ever stayed in
text:
Where can I start!?! The space, the luxury, the convenience, the location, the staff… everything was magnificent. I was in a 1400 sq foot 1BR/2BA room (407) with my husband and step daughter for Memorial Day weekend 2022. Everything was magnificent. Art Deco is my favorite architectural style, so it was a treat to stay in the building. 

As a life long New Yorker, who just moved to Miami, I know how tiny most hotel rooms are. Having 2 full bathrooms  and an insanely comfortable sofa bed was great, especially when traveling with a 20 year old. The high ceilings made it feel extra spacious. We had a full kitchen, so bringing home leftovers was thr move. 

The curated music was fantastic and the welcome package of cookies and water was a lovely surprise! 

The only con (if you could even call it that…) was  that shampoo contained sulfates, so I couldn’t use it on my hair. I always pack my own, so it wasn’t a big deal at all. 

Be aware- this is a LUXURY location. It has a luxury price tag. Our room was about $675 a night. This money is well worth it for the price, luxury, location snd convenience. If you don’t need all of that, there are thousands of other places in the 5 Boroughs. This was a first class hotel and my new favorite!

title: Perfect place to visit New york
text: The size of the appartment and its localisation just in front of subway make it perfect to have an optimal visit of New York with no waste of time. Close to Seaport (lot of resaturants, pubs...) and Brooklyn bridge.

title: A real find!
text: I give the Mint House a 100% rating. It was very clean, spacious, comfortable with all the amenities you would need. The building is beautiful and we loved the neighborhood. It was quiet too considering it is in a busy city. The staff was friendly and communication was great. I have no complaints!

title: Another Great Stay at 70 Pine Street
text: Wonderfully stay. A hidden gem in the NYC. Everything is so convenient, groceries, train station, and FedEx. The staff was very helpful and always available. I am looking forward to my next stay. M. Johnson

title: Einfach toll
text:
Wir waren 4 Erwachsene und hatten das größte Appartment (2 Schlafzimmer, 2 Badezimmer, 1 Wohnküche). Die Räume waren sehr groß, sehr sauber, jeden Tag wurde wie bei einem Hotel geputzt und sogar unser Geschirrspüler eingeräumt wenn wir es mal eilig hatten. Es gab gratis Wasser, Kaffee, Tee, WLAN. Supermarkt direkt im Gebäude. Eine sehr ruhige Gegend, ideal zum Schlafen da wenig Autoverkehr und die Gebäude gegenüber leer sind. U-Bahn Station direkt gegenüber, aber alles im Financial District bis zu Chinatown kann man zu Fuß erreichen - die Lage ist also wirklich tip top. Außerdem sehr sehr freundliches Personal. Bei Check-Out kann man die Koffer versperren lassen und auch noch am Ende des Tages vor dem Flug die Duschen im Fitnessstudio benutzen. 
Hatte schon viele Hotels in New York, aber Mint House war mit Abstand das Beste! 
(Ein Punkt Abzug für Sleep Quality, da uns die Betten zu weich waren, aber das ist Jammern auf hohem Niveau.)

title: Huge well appointed room
text: Beautiful and enormous suite for any city but especially for NYC. The staff was friendly and the location was great. I highly recommend for business or leisure.  The furniture was well appointed. Loved the sustainability focus.

title: Great place
text: High quality apartments with full kitchen and exceptional service in the best part of Manhattan. Having stayed here in 2018 when it was the Q&A I already had high expectations, but they were exceeded by the top quality staff.

title: Great rooms
text: Rooms are very spacious, staff is pleasant and ready to help.  However the rooms being in the lower floor of a building located in very narrow streets they are quite dark; a better lightning would be appreciated.

title: Mint House at 70 Pine St. in NYC is an Absolute Gem
text: Could not have been more pleased. Our room was very spacious, well supplied, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. Staff were friendly and helpful. We loved the unique touches like the turntable and vinyl albums (Dylan, Jay-Z to name a few.) We were in town for pleasure, but if I had a work project which took me to NYC, I'd also stay here again in "a New York Minute."  What a gem this property is!

title: Stop your search, stay at Mint House!
text:
If you're like me and you're scouring the internet to find a hotel stay in Manhattan that has great amenities and won't be the size of a small closet, just stop the search now and stay at Mint House.If you're going to be there for an extended period, there's nothing better in the city. Trust me. I looked.

First of all, don't think of it as a hotel, think of it as your own personal apartment in one of NYC's most luxurious high-rise buildings (though you'll be on the 3-6th floor). 

We rented a studio deluxe for four people and had more space than we could imagine. We took advantage of the full kitchen and stocked up on some food items at the full grocery store in the basement of the building. This helped us save on the Manhattan restaurant costs, so we could really do some special gourmet experiences at night.

The Black Fox coffee shop is attached to the building, meaning you can fuel your NYC experience with caffeine to your heart's content. 

The staff was incredibly helpful. Housekeeping took care of everything nicely. 

Stay at Mint House. You'll be glad you did.

title: Top Appartment in Wall Street
text:
Top location and appartment in Manhattan, great neighborhood.  Great services. 
Great communication but really too many text messages and e-mails• all information gathered in one message would be sufficient.

title: AMAZING APARTMENT IN WALL STREET
text: I loved EVERYTHING, the apartment is beautiful and fully equipped. The location is perfect, just cross the street to get the subway, shops and stores close by. Staff is very kind, the building is amazing! I can t wait to come back again!

title: Celebrate!
text: There to celebrate a birthday. Love this hotel and its location. Staff is wonderful! Biggest rooms in NYC to stay in!!! Fully modern and hip. Best place to stay in the area! You can walk to everything!

title: Mint House - Family of 5
text: Mint House was the perfect stay for a family of 5.  The size for the price is incredible.  It is very difficult to find such a large space for a family of 5, especially in NYC.  The room was very clean and stocked well.  The location is perfect if you prefer to be away from the hustle and bustle of Midtown. Lovely and attentive

title: Perfection of apartment living for the business traveler!
text:
Room was very clean and spacious with tons of amenities (record player, yoga mats, kitchenware) to make it feel like I was in an apartment instead of a soul-less hotel room - which is one of the worst parts of business travel. The staff were all friendly and helpful. And the gym in this location blows any hotel gym out of the water in terms of size, equipment, and vibe. Will definitely stay again if I'm in NYC. Also looking forward to checking out Mint Houses in other locations.

Keep up the great work!

title: A Pearl on Pine
text: The front desk staff were outstanding. I interacted a lot with Robert. He made me coffee and was knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. Your multipurpose building is beautiful (I love Art Deco), conveniently located, nicely situated near attractions and businesses, and your rooms have an awesome "cool" vibe. They featured everything and more that one could need. Sleeping was easy. Overall excellent experience! Thank you! A+

title: Perfect apartment and location
text:
The location of this Hotel/apartment is cool. Not as crowded as the usual tourist places, and with easy access to Subway taking you to all directions in Mahattan. Many options for food etc. in the local area.
Appartment was excelent. pleanty of space and nice condition.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
Starting with the good stuff:
Location is perfect if you need to be next to Wall Street and not bad for the rest of Manhattan (very close to subway, 20 minutes to Times Square) 
The apartment is huge (and I had the studio one) with tones of closet space. Not resembling a hotel room in any way.  
Great kitchen with great coffee making facilities (and really good  coffee from the always justifiably busy Black Fox company coffee in the lobby of the building - give them a try) 
A very big if a little outdated gym at the basement, a large self service  laundry room, and a  free printer to use. Also a great supermarket/food market in the same building (City Acres Market). 
However:
The water pressure is terrible and water heat change from one second to the other making shower not such a great experience. They had water works for 4 hours each morning while i was there (so no water) and only notified me about that after check in (Would have expected this to be announced as soon as they knew about it letting me decide if that would influence my choice to stay there). 
My room was on the 1st floor. The sound proofing of the windows is not good. This is new york but it’s not a specifically lively place during the night and still there was constant central heating or similar noise coming from street level all night. Also at around 0400-0500 each day garbage truck would noisily wake me up. 
The apartment is very dark and obviously have no views  - a small window on the first floor in a New York street doesn’t let much light in. 

For the price they charge I would expect a better product. I think if you need to be in Newyork for an extended period of time for work and can afford this its a great choice. Also for a family needing  lots of space. As for me, I would  probably not stay there next time I’m in town.

For first time in 40+years we stayed in fidi at Mint House.We will most definitely return.The turntable in room plus the selected albums clinched for us.And I even brought some of my own vinyl collection.Every interaction with Mint House team was pleasant and very professional.And they expedited the return of left behind glasses!Thanks

title: Appartement im Skyscraper
text: Die Appartements liegen zwar nur in den unteren Etagen aber in der Lobby und den Aufzügen steckt der Geist des tollen Gebäudes. Das Appartement war voll ausgestattet und für NY sehr groß. Man konnte sehr gut schlafen und die stylische Einrichtung nutzen. Im Haus ein sehr gutes Cafe ein toller City Acres Einkaufsladen. Nicht zu vergessen im 63/64 Stock das Restaurant Saga mit Barbetrieb und Aussenterrasse. Rundum perfekte Lage nahe an der Wallstreet oder Seaport und Brooklyn Bridge. Alles sehr gut zu Fuß zu erreichen oder die Subway Station in der Nähe.

title: Mint House NYC
text: Had a great stay at Mint House at 70 Pine in NYC. The smooth check-in and check-out, the size of the apartment, the kindness of the staff, the location, it was all good! I'd definitely stay here again when in NYC.

title: Large, Modern Stylish apartment in the financial district
text: We stayed at Mint House for 10 nights and felt very relaxed & comfortable there. The apartment is of a very good size, modern, stylish & clean. Gourmet coffee and boxed water included and the apartment was cleaned daily. We had a studio plus so this may have given those little extras. The location is excellent, with plenty of amenities like coffee shops, eateries and supermarkets. There are plenty of subway options also which meant you could get to times square within 20 mins or so and only a 2 min walk from Wall st and a 10 min walk to Battery park

title: Mint House 4-2-2022
text: Top flight room, service, location.  Trip Advisor wants 200 characters, so I am filling this out with meaningless text.   Parking is an issue, so before you go and if you drive, know where the garages are located.

title: multi-month long-term stay
text: Excellent facilities, location.  Front desk team very professional, helpful, friendly.  Highly recommend.  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Fantastic place to stay in NYC
text: Exceptional location and room layout.  When you want a home in the city, it's a great choice.  Battery Park, Wall Street and a quick walk to Soho / Lower East Side / restaurants around every turn! Will return!

title: Long weekend in NYC
text: Great location, staff, and a full apartment at a very reasonable $.. If you want a place that is close to everything in lower manhattan this is it, yet a quick train ride to Times Sq, etc.  but totally a walkable location!

title: Apt living in perfect location
text:
Highly recommend

We rented a 2 bedroom / 2 bath unit at Mint House for a long family weekend. The space was very large (1,100 sq ft) for the family and having a full kitchen, washer and dryer made the trip seem more like apartment living than the usual hotel experience (though the amenities were there). We loved the modern decor, features, and wood floors.

The building has a ton of great options: City Acres Market, Crown Shy, Black Fox Coffee, and more. The doorman who first greeted us was incredibly friendly and helpful (whisking bags to the front desk) and the front desk staff was amazing as well.

This is a perfect options for those wanting / needing more space in one of my favorite NY neighborhoods. We charged exactly what we were quoted at in the reservation email.

Will definitely stay here again.

title: Paul from maintenance saved the day.
text: Great place to stay for many reasons and I have stayed there before. I have written this review however for one particular purpose. Thank you Paul from maintenance for your quick work, friendly outlook and good work. Paul saved the day.

title: Fantastic
text: Beyond expectations.  Amazing staff. Amazing rooms! It’s a quiet area.  Expect to take transportation to more lively areas for night life-  but 1000% WORTH it for the room!! Perfect for business or family stays with full kitchen! Lovely amenities including all the water you could ever need and cookies and a hand written card welcoming you.

title: Scandi style hotel in downtown New York
text: Modern, with decent room sizes, much bigger than normal for this price point.   Scandinavian style rooms, with lots of wood flooring.   Michelin starred restaurant, but I preferred the local deli for breakfast and local pub for a beer and dinner.  Good location for downtown.  Noisy when there was a storm and some noise from trash collection.  Ask for a room not on the top floor and away from the back alley.

title: Perfect place to stay in NY City
text: Our apartment was wonderful.   We had a studio deluxe reservation and it was truly just that.   Plenty of space including a lovely table to spread out our morning paper (picked up from reception) and comfortable seating area by the turntable where we could spin some tunes from a wide collection of albums (also picked up from reception).

title: Excellence in the Financial District
text: The Mint House is a gem in the Financial District. The accommodations are spacious and well appointed. The staff is friendly and responsive. The hotel combined modern conveniences in an historic building. There are restaurants and a market in the building, a functional gym and, for us, the building is close to public transportation and restaurants. It is the place to stay in Manhattan.

title: Great place to stay for over a month!
text: My new employer put us up here for five weeks because I was moving to the city and the housing market is wild. Everything was great! By the end of the stay, we didn’t even want to leave for our own new apartment.

title: Magnificent Mint House
text:
It was time for a well needed time to restart my travels as we come out of the global healthcare crisis, determined not to use the ‘P’ word any more time to let it go. Whilst making my travel plans which hopefully included my favourite spot in Florida, yep Miami baby, I received the sad news that my favourite Uncle in Upstate New York had passed away suddenly. It was time to revise my travel arrangements I was now going to the minus 10 degrees of Poughkeepsie NY. 

The apartment is really easy to access using public transport and is within 5 mins walking distance from Wall St Station (take the 2 or 3 lines for the closest exits) Broad St & Fulton St Station are also within 10 mins walk. Getting around the city was super easy from this location and the World Trade Centre site with the Oculus site very impressively housing Transport, Shopping & Restaurants along with Broadway and the Brooklyn Bridge are all within a short walk away. 

This is a place to stay in NYC if you want to be close to the centre of activities but off the beaten track without the immediate hustle and bustle of this great city. There is a fantastic gym with a grimy feel that makes you want to train just that little bit harder, this is not a gym for the light weights. So, in conclusion, I enjoyed my stay here so much that I have booked another stay before returning to London the staff are extremely attentive thank you Malik, Robert, David, Gabby, Richard and the young black lady who had me laughing about the energy required to move home (hope it went well). 

The staff who maintain the rooms at the Mint House do an excellent job and my room was kept in five-star condition and I am sure that my dishes wash themselves, I could really get use to this lifestyle at home!! There is so much more I could write about my great stay at the Mint House (cookies & coffee)but if I did you would have no reason to go and discover this great spot for yourself. 

Thank You for a great stay, Mint House Team.

title: Preferred Hotel during my stay in NY
text: Mint House has become my preferred hotel for whenever I travel to the city. It's clean, the staff is accommodating and the rooms are very spacious;  The hotel is also conveniently located near Water and Wall Street.

title: Fantastic time at mint house
text:
Mint house apartments are fantastic and the facilities on site are excellent with so much to do for the whole family 
We will defo be back in the future 
The apartments are 5 star and the location is brilliant with a tube station right on the door step

title: Great place, especially for a longer stay
text:
Very clean & super spacious (even tons of closets).  Wonderfully quiet.  Kitchen fully stocked with necessities to prepare meals (there were even filters for two different types of coffee makers). Plus there's a supermarket on the lower level, with a cafe offering take out on the main level.  And, upon request, groceries can be provided by the hotel.   Laundry available on floor as is trash disposal if you need.  

Front desk staff is super helpful, which is what made my stay perfect.

Only downside for me is the location (midtown would have been much better for me), tho the proximity to the FDR Drive makes it relatively easy to access,

Highly recommend.

title: Best Bang for Buck, Mint standing for brilliant and top draw. 😀
text: Fantastic Studio Apartment with all modern cons, hotel has a grocery store on the basement lift accessed internally but also you can walk around externally.  In walking distance from all down town attractions, however tune is 2 min walk to get you anywhere in NYC. I’ve been to New York 3 times now and Financial district is the best place I’ve stayed with Mint House 70 being the best bang for buck.

title: Great stay
text: Safe, convenient location, close to water. Very helpful staff and good service. Nice apartments for extended stays with groceries, cafes & gym in the building. Justin and staff were very responsive to any requests. Able to host guests and dine in with plenty of room while in town for my daughter’s wedding. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Fantastic!
text: Great room, great building, great location, great service.  Best hotel I've ever stayed in, because it had everything I like and none of the stuff I hate about more traditional "full service" hotels.  I would 100%, without hesitation, recommend it.

title: Wow an amazing hotel and experience!
text: Mint house at 70 Pine was absolutely amazing. The staff went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable. The rooms were breathtaking a full kitchen and living room. Such a great experience overall and awesome location!

title: Valentine stay
text: I reserved the space for Valentines/SuperBowl weekend.  Room was excellent as always but the telecom/Cable needs to improve.  No smart TV offerings or Netflix option when you just want to hang out in the room.  Cable is shaky and was constantly resetting or just not working.  Option to connect your phone to the TV only works with Android devices

title: Outstanding
text: Fantastic, comfortable, & amenities beyond expectations. The building is outstanding with a grocer, three restaurants, a coffee shop, very spacious, an extremely accommodating staff.  We bowled, worked out, cooked, and entertained clients in the game room.

title: Valentine’s Day Weekend
text: Everyone at the concierge was so nice and welcoming. The hotel and room itself was so perfect and clean. I wouldn’t have changed anything about my stay, and I would definitely come back here again. 10/10, would recommend.

title: Beyond clean, chic and convenient was my stay at the Mint.
text: Clean, chic and convenient. Wanted just a quick getaway weekend and the Mint made that happen. From the customer service the moment we walked in. I texted to see if it was possible to have a cart ready upon my arrival and they made that happen right away.  Will definitely make this a weekend getaway place for future stays again. Thank you.

title: Hidden Gem!
text: I truly enjoyed my stay here and it  had everything I needed to make my birthday celebration complete! Thank you so much Mint House! I will definitely be back again in the future! It's such a great place to relax and get away even when you live within the city.

title: Perfect comfortable stay for a young family.
text: This was my 1st trip with my 3 month old infant. Mint house made my stay not only possible but enjoyable and relaxing. The entrance was right across the street from the Pine st subway exit off of the red line. The staff was kind and helpful. The room was huge, modern, clean, and very comfortable. Having a kitchen made taking care of the baby so much easier.

title: Pretty bare bones if that's what you need
text: I understand the model, makes sense, if you're a digital nomad, this is your place (but the analog turntable doesn't fit in?).  Spacious kitchen, small living room, clunky TV and inability to plug/play apps/devices like Apple TV/Fire - if digitally forward, should be more turn key.  No central temp control (again, digitally forward?).  Great to have on-premise activities like golf, bowling, and a great fitness center, plus food options.  If you're looking for heavy service, room service, concierge - not your place.  If you're self-sufficient and need a clean, spare, place to work/stay, this works.

title: Gracias
text: Muy buen lugar, confortable excelente el tornamesa con discos de acetato fue lo que más me gustó me recordó a mi padre, muchas gracias y la habitación en general muy buena espaciosa limpia es un lugar que sin duda recomiendo

title: A great stay, highly recommend
text: I stayed 4 nights on a business trip. Although single I reserved one of the larger rooms because I knew I would be spending a fair amount of time in it. Also liked the full kitchen so I did not have to go out for every meal. The staff were great, the room nicely appointed, and the wifi worked seamlessly. Lots of food options nearby.  Downsides, it is a little shy on natural lighting but plenty of lighting options in the room.  The rooms are on the lower floors and the building is between two others, so not a lot can be done. Didn't bother me, but others did note it. There seemed to be a lot of work being done on the building across the street and I did notice some noise. It was only during typical work hours and I was on the 6th floor, so again not an issue for me but for a light or late sleeper on the lower floors it might be. All and all I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

title: Great Experience
text: The Mint House was a great home away from home while I was in NY.  Everyone was kind, helpful and made the experience more pleasant.  And for almost a month stay this stay was worlds beyond any Hotel I have stayed in NY for the price.

title: Beats hotel living
text: All the amenities of a hotel with the comfort of a home. Hip design, super comfortable apartment in a great building with many amenities, great access to food/dining alternatives and a super gym. And a bowling alley to boot!

title: GREAT PLACE
text: Everything was perfect, best place Downtown, big Suite, authentic  ART DECO style and the Roof Top Bar SAGA is amazing. Good location, shops and restaurants in the House. Subway WALL STREET opposite if the building. Sports on the basement (golf, bowling...)

title: Good for a week stay
text:
Very well decorated. Room is big and comfortable. Kitchen is adequate.

Staffs are helpful. Cleaning and room service is inconsistent though.

Location is good, next to wall street. The entrance is a little hard to fine.

Room is quite dark unfortunately.

title: Hotel and more
text: We have stayed at the Mint at 70 Pine many times - ideal location , well equipped apartments and extremely friendly and helpful staff . We will definitely be returning, feels like our home away from home

title: Great experience, 5 stars
text: The entire staff was very friendly. Rob, guest services manager, was very accommodating. The place was a great stay. Kitchen, fully equipped. Rooms were immaculate. Would definitely consider, coming back

title: BRAVO MINT HOUSE TEAM
text:
Whether a business traveller or personal, you will just love MINT HOUSE at 70 Pine
The staff made ALL THE DIFFERENCE to me. Helpful in every way and delightful personalities!  Also social savvy so if you need speed, they get you going where you need to go fast!
Appartment had everything i needed, spacious and airy, super vinyl record player touch, thoughtful and tasteful books and magazines both in the appartment and to switch in and out in their reception space.  That area too was very spacious and refreshingly modern and calming.  Fridges full of boxed water at your 24 hr disposal and a nice selection of teas and coffee.  Black Fox Coffee in the building is only an elevator away too.  Plus a lunch nook and about the best Michelin Starred resto CROWN SHY that I have eaten in in years.  WHOA guys!  This is where you have to stay in NYC!
Wonderful location close to Wall St and Fulton subway stations
City acres market in the block has great hot food meal options daily, cold salads, groceries, beers, fresh fruit and loads of shots of ginger, turmeric etc especially needed right now when we are needing to remain healthy and immune high.
Wall St Wine Merchants across the road is brilliant too.  Bordeaux & scotch selections meet most tastes and budgets, but the guy goes around the globe too with some interesting wines.
As a former broker with Merrill Lynch I would say you don't want to stay anywhere else for quality, price and convenience!
BRAVO MINT HOUSE TEAM!

title: We felt at home at Mint House
text: The suite, the staff (special shout-out to Bree), the service, everything at Mint House was outstanding. We enjoyed our stay from start to end and would definitely recommend Mint House at 70 Pine to any of our friends or relatives. We will be back for sure!

title: Amazing NYC hotel
text: Such a nice hotel with great amenities! The room was beautiful and had some really nice touches that made it feel special. Would definitely recommend! The building is a great location and has a coffee shop and multiple restaurants on property.

title: Mint House - a great find
text: Huge room for NYC with full kitchen and dining room table. Ability to text front desk is great.  Close to both west and east sides of lower Manhattan. Very close to Wall St area, Seaport area, World Trade Center.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Very nice hotel, huge rooms/apartments very clean.
Well located, with all possible metro few min away
very nice staff and good service - excellent room equipment 
strongly recommend this hotel.
Our room was noisy in the mornings (starting at 7AM), but this is normal to the location

title: Family got to experience NYC living
text: This place was perfect for a family (2nd & 5th grade) that want to get a glimpse of NYC living.  We enjoyed getting food from the market downstairs, using the building amenities, walking to the subway and ferry.  This was a large room too.  We would definitely return.

title: Fabulous stay!!!
text: What a wonderful apartment-style hotel in NYC - we had everything we needed and the room was unbelievably well-set-up and comfortable.  The staff were so courteous and would go out of their way to make sure our stay was just what we had hoped for!  We loved our stay - absolutely amazing!!!

title: Spacious Weekend Getaway
text: Check-in/check-out process very fast and easy; personable front desk staff!  The room was unbelievably spacious and well-furnished; well-maintained.  Quiet neighbors; felt like we were in the building by ourselves.  Will definitely return; excellent stay!

title: Large and well appointed rooms, excellent service, great location
text:
Stayed in a studio here for a couple of months. Much bigger than a typical hotel room. Comes with standard kitchen stuff such as utensils, cookware, and plates (no rice cooker though sadly). Internet was pretty fast and stable all throughout the building (except elevators). One con is the lack of sunlight due to the surrounding buildings and Mint House only occupying floor 2-6 of 70 pine. This was further compounded by the somewhat lacking lighting inside the rooms.

Excellent location for the 2/3/4/5 trains (which go uptown or to Brooklyn easily). Good selection of food within a 5 min walk (my favorites for everyday were Dig and Blue Park Kitchen). The attached grocery store was convenient for small/rushed purchases but grossly overpriced for consistent shopping.

The 24/7 front desk was awesome. They did a great job with packages and guiding food delivery people upstairs. The complimentary monthly cleanings were well done (remember to ask for them if you are staying for a while). The few times I made requests (extra hangers, some Lysol, etc) they were granted quickly.

title: Mint House Hotel stay
text: Awesome hotel with wonderful suites with a really impressive care of the details. We really enjoyed our time there. The staff was super nice and resolutive. We deffinitely come back there. We truly reccomend this place for families and the market downstairs of the building is a super nice touch!!!

title: Excellent in all ways
text: Clean, comfortable, like being at home but with a housekeeper. Perfect for business travelers who don't want to spend all their free time in restaurants and prefer to eat "at home" via grocery store and food counters found on ground floor.

title: Family Friendly | Great Location
text:
We LOVED our stay at Mint House! 
We have two kids, 7 & 14 and we chose the deluxe suite. Their pull out sofa was super comfortable and the king bed is divine! The sofa area was separated from the main area so at bed time, you still had that sense of privacy! 

In the hotel you have a coffee shop, restaurants, a bar etc. & when you Uber eats or Grub Hub they can leave right at the Mint House Reception Desk. 

The building also has a bowling alley (kids were in heaven!!) and a room with a ping pong & pool table. So you could basically have a wind down moment every evening if need be. 

You are a corner away in same building to the market to get groceries for your suite, you’re a few blocks from Pier 17 and other great spots to eat and explore. 

If you want to have the “city experience” without the excessive over crowding, sirens and horn honking every five freaking seconds, but still within a 15 min Uber into downtown to do the tourist things, then this is THE place. 

The staff is amazing, the building is secure, the rooms are modern and equipped with everything you need. 

Added bonus, you can text them or call about anything.. Super responsive, and they are so friendly compared to other NYC hotels. 

10/10 Would stay again!

title: RL
text: Great building and units.  Location is a bit tough but the pricing and the quality of the asset truly makes the location palatable.           I would definitely Recommend Mint House to friends, family and colleagues.

title: NY Visit
text: Mint House is an excellent concept allowing us the luxury of having food delivered and having a comfortable place to eat it. I loved having the kitchen and kitchen table for us to gather around in the morning and evening. Front staff was amazing, especially David. So helpful.

title: Beautiful modern space
text: We wanted to extend our trip just to stay in this beautiful room another night. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. The space was beautiful, large, clean. Would absolutely stay here again and 10/10 would recommend.

title: Wonderful stay @ the Mint House!
text: Great stay at the mint house! We stayed in the studio plus and it was HUGE! Especially for being a hotel in NYC. The amenities were nice, spacious room with lots of closet space, clean bathroom. The bed was comfy & the hotel was a quick walk to the subway station. They provided free water and had extras for guests in the lobby- this was an AWESOME perk!! My only 2 downsides were the pillows & the A/C in the room. The pillows sucked and were so uncomfortable (an easy fix for them) & the A/C seemed to switch from cold to heat throughout the night- my husband and I would both either wake up shivering or dripping sweat. Other than those 2 minor issues it was a great stay! You definitely get your money’s worth & the location is great!!

title: Perfect Place in NYC
text: Great location, very well equipped apartment, and, most importantly, very friendly and helpful people at the front desk.  I loved the old style paper hardcopy of the New York Times available every morning.

title: Beautifully decorated spacious apartment.
text: This apartment was perfect for a quick weekend getaway for some shopping and fun. The building is absolutely gorgeous, the room was extremely clean and the staff is very friendly. I liked staying in the financial district because it’s not full of tourists. Plus it allowed me to explore other parts of the city that I don’t normally have a chance to see because I usually stay in midtown. I would recommend Mint House to anyone. I will stay here again definitely!

title: Fantastic Stay!!!
text: Great place!  Wonderful service.  I can’t say how great it was to have a whole apartment instead of tiny hotel room. The staff was the best I’ve ever had.   Location was quiet and easy to get to subway.  Super!

title: Never disappoints
text: I've stayed at the Mint House a few times this year and yet again it did not disappoint. The front desk staff is friendly, efficient and accommodating. In contrast, I stayed at a Marriott recently and they did not answer the front desk phone for over a 4 hour period. Not the Mint House! They answer on the 1st or 2nd ring and are always available to assist. Great team and I'll look forward to returning in 2022!

title: Great gem in Financial District!
text: This is a great hotel if you want to spend and extended amount of time with family. I booked a two bedroom suite and the room was spacious with its own full kitchen. Nice little touches like a record player and trendy comfy furniture. Staff is friendly and the area is walking distance to most sightseeing places. Grocery store on first floor made this even better.

title: 99% of Staff were awesome
text: Perfect experience, no unpleasant surprises. Ms. Gabby was the perfect host. I plan to stay at Mint House again because no request was too much to accommodate and with the exception of one person, everyone was a team player and extremely polite. Mint House must have a charm school of its own where front desk staff are trained before taking up the position.

title: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome
text: First, there is nothing about this hotel that isn’t great. Nothing. The location is excellent if your party, business or interest is downtown. The hotel is located in a beautiful landmark building, right in the lobby is a lovely independent coffee shop, a fabulous upscale restaurant and a wonderful snack shop. Underneath the building is a grocery store, a bowling alley and a gym. The front desk people are always friendly & super-accommodating and the rooms are outstanding. (The suites are four times the size of an average hotel room. Book in advance - worth it!) We’ve stayed here a few times and I can’t wait to go back. I’d live here if I could. Seriously. Don’t hesitate to stay here when choosing a hotel in downtown Manhattan.

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC
text: The hotel is located in on of my favorite areas of the NYC. The staff is very welcoming and they go above and beyond to make sure your stay is perfect. The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and not to mention they have amazing mattresses. My fiancé loves using their golf simulator when we stay. I highly recommend to anyone visiting NYC to stay here. You won't be disappointed.

title: ❤️ The Mint House
text: The rooms at The Mint house are very spacious and clean.  When I walked in there was a dining room, kitchen area and a relaxing living room to watch TV comfortably.  The bed was so comfortable I didn’t want to get up.  This will be my first choice to stay in NYC

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text: The room is massive and so beautiful. It is across the street from the subway and NYSE. I honestly have not had a nicer place any other time I’ve stayed at a hotel. The staff was amazing as well. Will never stay anywhere else

title: Perfect place to stay
text: highly recommend. Clean, quiet, spacious, and more. You get a whole apartment to yourself! Staff and building were wonderful. I will be returning. Snacks, water, coffee, and tea were provided each day.

title: Incredible value and SPACE
text:
If you are traveling with a family you can’t beat this place. The amount of space you get for the price and location is unbeatable. Ive been to NYC 5 times and this is the best hotel Ive stayed at (which includes having stayed at 2 of the top 10 hotels in NYC per TA). Compared to the Library or Conrad Downtown this place could easily charge double or triple just for its location in the financial district. In fact the “master” bedroom and bath is the same size or larger than 90% of the entire rooms of 5 star hotels I’ve stayed at across the world.  

This doesn’t include the full kitchen, 2nd full bathroom, dining/den area and living room with pull out sofa and tons of closet space that had. Facilities were clean and staff were helpful and friendly. Special thanks to Kelly for helping us with luggage on our last day. There is a grocery next door to the hotel and a cafe on the ground floor as well. 

Great location, value and incomparable SPACE for NYC. Stop reading and just book Mint House for your next trip to the Big Apple. I know I will.

title: Very comfortable
text: Travelled from UK to NYC with our two adult children. Spacious comfortable room with kitchen. Good location to Wall St subways giving quick access to midtown, Central Park etc. 10 mins from 9/11 Museum. Much better than conventional hotels, just like having an apartment. Definitely would book again.

title: Most accesible place!!
text: This place has everything you need for your stay. If they don’t have it, steps away is available. Clean, quite and well equipped apartment. Everything works perfectly. Crew is top service oriented. We stay for my wife’s birthday.Thanks all. Definitely we will stay again

title: Best place to stay
text: Imagine having an apartment for the price of a hotel room.  Location is excellent and staff is very accommodating.  Best kept secret in NYC!  There are places to shop and eat in the building.  70 Pine Street and the surrounding neighborhood is old New York.  There are many sightseeing opportunities right in the neighborhood.  The financial district is right at your doorsteps.

title: Best place to stay in NYC!! Hands down, no dispute.
text:
All the place is a lovely design and decoration is impressive.
The rooms are big, very clean, comfortable, and with an exquisite design. You will never want to stay in another place in NYC. You have everything you need at walking distance, and when I mean, everything is everything: bars, restaurants, markets, shopping, coffee shop, etc. And the best part, all the people that take care of the hotel are amiable and always help you with anything you might need.

title: Great place, great space for NYC.
text:
Stayed here for a week on business in NYC. Picked Mint House because of the reviews and the much greater space than usual for a NY hotel. 
Location is fine for anything downtown, it was a few minute walk to WTC. Not perhaps the best location for good eateries but that's just the area, you do have the Seaport and Stone Street just a short walk away for that. 
Room/suite is excellent. Plenty enough space that you felt quite happy hanging out there which isn't the case for many NYC hotel rooms which you often just want to sleep at. Place was clean, well appointed, good simple decor. I didn't use the kitchen much during the week but if I were staying longer it would have been plenty enough to cook in, fully equipped and actually a pretty decent size. Bathroom was bright, plenty of hot water, enough towels etc. Just soap, shampoo and conditioner provided here, so take anything else you need with you. Someone came in and made the bed daily, cleaned up the bathroom and put out fresh towels. Wasn't there long enough for a linen change, could have asked if I wanted one mid-week. 
Reception was super helpful (once you found it), everyone was friendly and helpful. 
Rooms are on low floors so you do hear NYC noise overnight, wasn't a problem, that's just living in the city. 
Overall a great stay. Gave me just what I needed, a really good sized suite with amenities to look after yourself . Was modern, clean and warm and very convenient to downtown and the rates were super reasonable. This will be my go-to place for business stays in NYC.

title: Perfect Stay in NYC
text: It’s nice to have plenty of space and nice accommodations while vacationing in NYC. The property was in the perfect location with plenty of places to eat nearby and the subway station right across the street. The East River ferry was within walking distance less than 15 minutes away. Room was clean and provided plenty of amenities. The Bluetooth record player was a nice bonus to listen to some classic albums while relaxing and resting your feet from walking around the city all day. I will never stay in a standard NYC hotel room again because the Mint House spoils you with the plenty of space. You feel like you’re in your own small apartment. Thank you Mint House for making our family vacation perfect!

title: 5 star property but some changes were made that should be undone
text: Let me start by saying Mint house is the nicest hotel ive stayed in within NYC as of yet. However it was called LYRIC before this and they had better policies. Mint house changed the TVs so all you have is youtube, cable and android phone sharing so if you have iphone then you cant use the TV for netflix or anything. Secondly, they changed the check out time to 11am from 12pm. Very annoying because the maids start knocking immediately at 11 or they start calling you from the front desk. Like damn if im paying $400 a night atleast give me till 12pm checkout, very annoying.

title: Great Experience
text: My Family and I traveled to NYC for a weekend. The condo had everything we needed, was clean, and spacious. My favorite part of the stay was using the huge workout room and golf simulator that you have access to in the basement. Other amenities include a movie theater and a bowling alley. Overall stay was great.

title: Champions Classic
text: Wonderful place to stay. Largest place I have ever stayed in NYC.  Besides a full kitchen and room for 6 people to relax comfortably, it had great amenities including a golf simulator and bowling. Close to Wall Street and subway. Would highly recommend Mint House to anyone planning on coming to NYC solo or with a family.

title: A modern apartment in a beautiful old building
text:
I booked here many months ago for an eight night stay during a three month business trip to the US. I wanted something with some room and away from the night time noise of many NYC neighbourhoods.

Modern and comfortable with great amenities in a beautiful Deco building, this had both that old NY feel without the stuffy old interior, furnishings and fixtures. 

Fresh ground coffee, not pods, a good sized kitchen and fridge, plenty of closet space and a large safe that fits plenty.

A laundry upstairs at a reasonable price it made living out of a suitcase easy.

Good food and coffee joints downstairs in the building and Wall St Subway station literally steps away.

Great communication before, during and after my stay.

title: Great place for work or extended vacation
text: Perfect for those desiring both space and quietude in a convenient FiDi location.  We stayed here for a week in a two bedroom that was tastefully decorated (even had a cool retro phonograph player!) and all the conveniences you would need for an extended stay.  One block over from Wall and Pearl, and in the same building as City Acres supermarket (think smallish Whole. Foods), and Michelin-starred Crown Shy.  Staff is great, friendly and helpful.  Pricier than other hotel options in the area, but with three or four times the space and all the comforts of home (e.g., kitchen and washer/dryer), hotels aren’t really the right reference point.

title: Wonderful place - can't recommend it highly enough
text:
What a great place this is. Loved my stay here for the New York Marathon (it's ideal for the Staten Island Ferry if a future NY marathon runner is looking for somewhere to stay). 

The room was enormous (and very quiet on the 6th floor) compared to the typical hotel room size in this city. I've stayed in NY before in rooms the size of a postage stamp :) But this one had tonnes of space.

Everything was clean and modern, and the room kitted out with everything I needed. Big comfy bed, too. The location is also incredibly convenient. Pretty much everything I needed is in a very short walking distance from the hotel - the supermarket and gym, in particular.

When I return to New York, I will be checking Mint House for vacancies. Thanks team.

title: One of my favorites in NY
text: I need to stay in NYC for work often, and the Mint house is my first choice (depends on price, sometimes it's just too expensive). The hotel has the best service in NY, the most amazing rooms/apartments and I would strongly recommend it to anyone looking for the perfect stay.

title: this is the best...
text: Mint house at 70 Pine is so beautiful, clean, and accommodating. We had 4 loads of items to bring in and couldn't find a cart. Robert made 2 trips back and forth to get our things up to our apartment, and did so with a smile!!!. The apartment had a full kitchen, beautiful room and the shower was delightful!!!   No need to go anywhere else for accommodations !!!!!

title: Great New York hotel
text: Huge room. Great amenities in the room such as kitchen, coffee maker, free water and cookies. Plenty of towels. Comfortable bed. Lots of closet space. Front desk staff especially Kelly very helpful. Location is great. Across the street from the wall st subway. Great stay

title: Excellent Experience!!!
text:
Everything was perfect!!! It was a great experience.!!! We enjoy very much staying in the hotel!!!
I recommend it 100%.I would stay at the Mint hotel again without hesitation !!!

Congratulations to the Mint Team!!!

title: Mint House
text: This was our first stay at Mint House. Excellent location in the Financial District. Our suite was really large for NYC and perfect for our family of 5. Service was great and we’d definitely stay here again!

title: Love, Love, Love This Place !!!!
text: My wife and I couldn't say enough good things about this hotel. The rooms are more like a loft space with a full kitchen, turntables, and spacious bathroom. If you're planning to stay in the city multiple nights, highly recommend making Mint House your headquarters. Bowling ally and gym in the basement. subway station across the street and market. Only one train stop away from Dubmo. Couldn't say enough nice things. Highly recommended if you plan to spend time in your room working, relaxing or meeting up with others.

title: Redemption
text: Last time I stayed a few years ago, I was awoken by garbage trucks. I decided to try again due to the high ratings and rebranding. I stayed in a 2 bed 1 bath, which was enormous. We didn't hear trucks at night, though we were on a higher floor. I would stay here again!

title: Awesome hotel in the heart of the Financial District of NYC
text: The suite that we chose was big as most NYC apartments. We had a full kitchen, separate dinning area, and a huge bedroom.  It was the most quiet stay we have ever had in NYC.  The room was very comfortable and clean.  There is a grocery store in the same building so we ate breakfast in the room and we actually had dinner with guests there one night.  With family in the DUMBO area it was an easy walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to go visit.  We will stay certainly return.

title: Great Find
text:
We recently sold our apt in Manhattan and have been staying at various hotels when we want to be in the City.  The Mint House is our favorite.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed.   Vibe is cool and we were warmly greeted by Claritza and Gabby at the front desk, who were very helpful.  

We were so happy with our stay that they told us about the Mint Pass which provides discounts for frequent users, and we plan to purchase one.  

I highly recommend the hotel, which is also conveniently located to all major subways and location is easy both for Brooklyn and Manhattan destinations.

title: Plenty of Space, Just Way Downtown
text:
We stayed at the Mint House at 70 Pine for a long weekend in early September. I wouldn't mind staying again if it weren't for one thing - the hotel is way downtown, and most of what we want to do in NYC is in midtown, leading to excess commute times for every trip.  

The building itself is art deco and has a coffee shop, restaurant, and other amenities on-site. It is situated between two small streets downtown near Wall Street and the World Trade Center. While its a perfectly safe area, the streets are small, dirty, clogged and smelly in that New York way.  

The lobby for the hotel is in what feels like the back corner of the lobby of the building, with a separate bank of hotel elevators. The front desk staff was pleasant and efficient the entire time.  The rooms appear to be remodeled apartments, as they have a huge square footage. Understand that this company thrives on upselling you on early check-ins, late check-outs, and selling you the things furnishing your room.

After checking in, our front door opened into a large, albeit windowless dining room, with a large closet, through the dining room was the small bathroom, wide galley kitchen, leading into the living space with couch, chair, tv, and record player with half a dozen assorted records, which in turn leads into the bedroom area with large bed and a fairly small single window.  The room was plenty big and comfortable (except the low hanging floor lamp in the living room that I hit my head on all of the times.  

The kitchen came fully stocked with what you need, including great instructions and equipment for your morning cup of pour over coffee or tea.  It also had full-size appliances and an offer that the hotel would get you any food you want delivered without additional costs.  

The room was quiet and dark enough, the bed comfy, the tv options adequate. The downsides were the smallish single window, and the not-special small bathroom.

title: What awesome Hospitality from this Hotel!
