text: Actually we were very impressed by your service you offered and we really appreciate your response since the day we arrived at Your Hotel the rooms,restaurants,pups,and security were strong to the experience.the area was beautiful with a lot of Historical and Many outdoor activities. I and my husband we enjoyed a-lot for sure we are planning to come back for another tour and we wish to book with you.Perfect

title: Great Experience in Convenient Location
text: Mint House was a great pick for my 10-day stay! I want to mention Hospitality Associate, Gabrielle Codispoti, for her excellent customer service both at check in and at check out. She stood out among her co-workers. I also want to mention both Pedro and Luis who helped me sort out issues with the TV. The room was clean at check-in and the daily refresh was helpful to make my stay more comfortable. The gym is amazing, and the bowling alley and theatre were fun amenities; and the laundry room on the sixth floor and the market with access on the lower floor were super convenient. The room was quiet, and I only heard other guests on a couple of occasions. I stayed in the studio deluxe; the set up was a little funky but ideal for my situation (you can see photos that will help you better understand the setup on Expedia). The hotel arranged transportation to/from the airport which was convenient even if it was slightly more expensive than Uber. My top rating is based on the price for the size of the accommodations and the quality of the staff. As an aside, the sandwiches at Pisillo Italian Panini on 97 Nassau Street are amazing and it is a very short walk from the hotel. The Mint House will be my go-to hotel whether I am in NY for business or pleasure.

title: Incredible experience!!
text: Had to find a place to bridge the gap before moving into my apartment and was so lucky to find Mint House. Incredibly clean and awesome place. Spacious rooms! The staff was could not have been more accommodating as well during my entire stay!!! Especially Gabby and Brie!!! 100% recommend staying here.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel
text: The accommodations were luxurious. A lot of amenities included and very sophisticated items in suite. The “studio” was very large with a full kitchen. An extended stay is definitely appropriate. The area is beautiful with historical and outdoor activities. Many delicious restaurants and pubs. The building is Art Deco style and very well preserved.

title: Wonderful rooms and Excellent Customer Service
text: You know how everywhere you travel there is that one hotel that you will always stay in whenever you go visit the city? MINT HOUSE is the one for our family in NYC. We were exhausted when we arrived the area after a 16 hour flight and were dying to check into our hotel room; CLARITZA, who was at the check-in desk that day got us sorted and prepared our room in a shocking HOUR despite us arriving at 8am in the morning. She was extremely helpful and kept us updated on housekeeping all the way. If you need any help, CLARITZA is definitely the one to go to. The two rooms we stayed in both had a massive kitchen and walk-in closet, even though one was just a studio room. We will definitely recommend friends and family to stay in this hotel when coming to NYC and we have already booked our room for our next visit!

title: Amazing customer service
text: Claritza provided the most incredible customer service I could have ever dreamed of. I had very stupidly booked a non-refundable reservation through www.hotels.com and even though Mint House at 70 Pine was willing to let me move my reservation to another night, neither Clartiza or I could speak to someone at www.hotels.com who could implement that change. She spent hours with www.hotels.com trying to resolve this for me (as did I). She held the room for me (the last one they had) while this all got resolved and booked me at a better price than on www.hotels.com I could never have dreamed of such excellent support. And then when I got to the room, she had even left me cookies! That team at Mint House is the best!!!! Thank you, Claritza! You have really earned my loyalty.

title: 不能正常毕业？辍学？
text:

title: Exceptional hotel
text: This is an absolutely fantastic hotel that is located near the financial district. The rooms are equipped with a kitchen, large wardrobe and substantial sized bathroom. The rooms were very comfortable and had plenty of resources to make your stay pleasant. The staff were more than accommodating and I couldn't fault this hotel, will be happy to stay here in the future and recommend to friends on their trips to NYC.

title: Big rooms, excellent for extended stays
text: Loved the size of the rooms, stayed for 2 months, you are required to  change rooms after 28 days which can be challenging on a work trip. Feels like an apartment, quiet and safe area, excellent proximity to ferry, 2/3 trains

title: Perfect location for our weekend visit.
text: The hotel is a beautiful art-deco design.  The room was large and well maintained.  We were visiting our son and daughter-in-law who live in the financial district so the location was fantastic for us.  We appreciated everything about it including the record player with albums we played when we returned after a full day out and about.  It was remarkably quiet.

title: El mejor lugar para alojarse en Manhattan
text:
Increíble este apart hotel! Super amplias y completas las habitaciones. Es la segunda vez que nos alojamos ahí, y comparamos muchas opciones, pero ninguna se le parece. Elegimos un Studio Deluxe, enoorme para NY (65 m2). Tenia un living, otro espacio de cocina con mesa y todos los electrodomesticos, y luego la cama con todas las comodidades. Realmente un placer. La atención de las personas en el front desk excelente, nos ayudaron en todo, nos respondieron rápido, super amables.
Además el hotel y la habitación lleno de detalles de diseño, excelente gusto. 
La ubicación hermosa, la zona de wall street es muy linda y a la vez tranquila, y tiene una estación de subte al frente así que conectados con todo. Una maravilla, la pasamos genial! 
Gracias Mint House, cuando volvamos a NY vamos ahí seguro

title: Incredible long term stay with family of 5
text: We just checked out of Mint House and it was an amazing stay. We were there for ~5 months while we were renovating our apartment. Incredible staff. Claritza was outstanding - the first person we met  helping us get checked in and helping us with so many things over our stay - and the whole staff made us feel right at home. Very professional, terrific accommodation including a very well appointed kitchen and outstanding amenities with one of the best gyms I’ve been to. Would highly recommend all around!

title: My 2 Month Stay was Great!
text: I stayed at the Mint House for 2 months with my dog. Gabby and Claritza were super helpful whenever I needed help. I had everything I needed in the kitchen and cooked often. I worked daily from the room which was very comfortable. Make sure to get a room with an island to sit at if you plan to work often. Washer dryer was on the floor so, that was easy too. The neighborhood is great. So close to the Seaport and Stone Street for dining outside. There is a super market in the building which was very convenient and the gym was a great amenity as well. Very pet friendly. Make sure to try Crown Shy which is also int he building for dinner or brunch on the weekends.

title: Stellar visit!
text:
We loved everything about our stay at the NYC Mint House!  
The rooms are beautifully curated with an eye to high design which makes for a very relaxing and visually pleasing stay. 

We appreciated the attention to detail from stylin' furniture and beautiful art to a turntable with rad LPs and  cultural publications.
If one were to look up the word perfection in Webster's, for us the definition would be The Mint House.

This is a truly lovely place to stay in NYC!
We will be back.

title: Anniversary getaway weekend
text: The rooms are so mint and modern. Everything was clean and beautiful.  Love the handwritten welcome note and the water carton , NO PLASTIC!😊 love that it is walking distance to waterfront and some great bars and restaurants!! Staff is always sweet and friendly.

title: Amazing Hotel & Top Notch Customer Service
text:
This hotel was nothing short of amazing. I booked it for my birthday weekend trip and wanted a place that was larger than the typical hotel to host my friends. 

Location: The location was ideal for me as it's ~10 minute Uber from Brooklyn. The location within the financial district also meant it was relatively quiet at night and over the weekend, which was great. 

Room: The apartment style rooms were great, and I was surprised I could find something this spacious in NYC. I had a 2/2, with a very large living room and kitchen. The bedrooms were also very spacious, and more than enough closet room

Front Desk Staff: The service of the front desk made the trip even more memorable. Claritza was the front desk agent during our trip and was super helpful the entire time. She made sure we had everything we need and helped us with recommendations. Any request we called them for, they were sure to accommodate and were so prompt! 

Overall: Highly recommend, and I will absolutely be staying here during future NYC trips.

title: Great spot for a city break
text: Mint House was a great spot for a long weekend in NYC as the pandemic starts to cool off.  Got 1/2 price via Travelzoo.  Good location near Wall St., full kitchen, nice size apartment and closet, and good bar and multiple food choices in building or very close by.  Please note- if you get the discounted parking behind the hotel, you must get your voucher stamped!  We were not told, and also not told you cannot take car out and back on same paid date.  Front desk was little ditzy, but the service was otherwise very good.

title: I don't want to leave this review.
text: I don't want to leave this review because like others who have stayed here I don't want any one else to know about it. I want to keep Mint House all to myself! But I had to come here and write a review because I found out about Mint House from other TripAdvisor reviews so I have to pay it forward. I had an amazing stay and I am already looking for an excuse to return. I stayed in a Studio Deluxe from Thursday-Sunday for my birthday. I live in Brooklyn, so this was a staycation but I felt like i was in Amsterdam or some other European city living in a fab apartment. First of all the rooms are HUGE -mine was 700 sq ft and I could feel all 700 of those sq ft. You can't even compare Mint House rooms to other New York hotel rooms, which are notoriously tiny. There's just no comparison. Even if we go outside New York, I have stayed at tons of hotels all over the world, and honestly this is larger than many suites I have stayed in. The layout is clean and uncluttered, the kitchen and bathroom were spotless and the towels were so soft. And the price point? Ridiculously affordable for what you get. The walk-in closet in my room was the size of a regular hotel room - and I am only exaggerating a little it! Overall, it just felt luxurious. They do a quick background check on guests before check-in which surprised me (clearly one should always read the entire Terms and Conditions) but even that was great because as a woman traveler, staying alone I felt totally safe, secure, and relaxed.

title: Best Place Ever
text: The service is great and the building is luxurious , it feels like employees are a small family. I appreciate each and everyone of them specially Claritza, Gaby and Ariel at front desk and Francis from housekeeping. Thanks a lot!

title: Third visit, same 5-star review
text: My daughter and I decided to spend our birthdays in NYC.  We've been so delighted with our previous 2 stays at mint house 70 pine, why not stay again?  Very glad we did.  Spacious, comfortable and quiet!  If I could make one suggestion.  I'm not crazy about the portraits on the walls in the room.  It feels like I'm sharing the space with strangers

title: Wonderful accommodations
text: My sister and I took her two kids for a staycation here this wknd. From the friendly, accommodating staff to the large apartment like rooms, we plan to stay here again very soon. The ceilings are high, there is a full kitchen and we were able to make Mac and cheese for the kids! It was very quiet and its proximity to 3 great playgrounds and south street seaport made it a TOTAL WIN. Thanks Mint House!

title: Perfect for families
text: I just stayed at Mint House & had a great experience.  The staff from management to housekeeping were professional and helpful.  Our suite was very large (larger than it appears in photos), clean and well stocked.  Location is great.  Would happily stay again.

title: Relaxed, chic hotel with AMAZING customer service.
text: We had a wonderful experience at the Mint House- whether you are local or a tourist you will love staying here. The employees are pleasant and accommodating. Lots of amazing places to grab dinner whether you want to order in or go out for a bite to eat. Stay here, you won’t be sorry!

title: Engineer
text: My wife and I  stayed one night at Mint in New York City, unexpectedly.  The manager,  his name was Robert ,was able to  find us an available room that was both quite clean and spacious.  The front desk help were most helpful and courteous. Quiet area, great for getting a good night's sleep. Would definitely use this hotel again!

title: Amazing
text: Favorite hotel in NYC officially. I don't see myself staying anywhere else. Lobby is beautiful, front desk is kind, and I personally love feeling like I'm in an apartment (cause of the kitchen). It just makes everything so much more comfortable, plus the rooms are beautiful. I really hope the hotel continues being so reasonably priced so that I can always stay here when I'm on business in NYC, which is a lot lol.

title: Love Mint House at 70 Pine For Apt-Style Rooms in NYC!
text: This was my first time at Mint House and I was very impressed. We upgraded from a Studio Deluxe to a 1-bedroom for a sisters staycation in the city and the suite was extremely clean and spacious. The staff was also super helpful and quick to attend to requests. I love the fully-equipped kitchen aspect and the record player in the room, with a selection of records to choose from! Bed was super comfy and the building felt super safe. Such a great new option for affordable stays in the city!

title: Highly recommend mint house at 70 Pine street!
text: Helpful and friendly staff, clean and spacious room, great price, perfectly meet our needs! It’s also unique with kitchen and dining area. Will highly recommend the hotel to anyone’s, family friendly!

title: Perfect Staycation
text: My boyfriend and I stayed in a deluxe studio suite for Valentine's weekend, and it was everything we had hoped for - they even gave us a late checkout for free. The decor was chic, everything was so clean, and the bed was CRAZY comfortable. We LOVED having a kitchen in the suite and took full advantage of it - there was a very nice grocery as well as a liquor store down the block which had everything we needed. I also highly recommend the cafe in the building, Black Fox! I didn't catch any names, but all the staff we interacted with were so helpful and kind.

title: Excellent experience, thanks in huge part to Claritza!
text:
First off, a big shout out to Claritza, who saved us from what could have been a reeeeally unhappy Valentines Day weekend. I'd booked this hotel for a one-night staycation through Agora - but turns out, Agora is no longer connected with this hotel and basically took my money but made no booking with the hotel, despite confirming it with me! Yikes! This is obviously the worst news to get when you're trying to check in at front desk, and the person there patiently goes through all their records and finally breaks the news to you of what must have happened. The fact that my money had already been taken by Agora was a separate issue (I was able to take this up with Agora subsequently and get my money back, and if not I'd have taken it up with the credit card company) but knowing that my credit card company would reimburse me for what turned out to be this bogus charge, my immediate concern was, were we going to be able to stay? And were we going to have to pay same-day, off-the-street prices for a junior suite on Valentines Weekend? (It would have been almost double the cost of the reservation I'd made weeks prior.) Luckily, no. Claritza carefully and patiently made sure she found a room equivalent to the one I'd booked, and ensured we were given the same price as the one I'd booked online through a third party. Obviously she (and the hotel) did not HAVE to honor this booking in any way. It was just great, great customer service to do so. What I appreciated most was that throughout the whole process Claritza never once made us feel like this was our fault, that we were taking up too much time, or that we'd been somehow irresponsible in making the original booking or were somehow trying to game the system - all of which are attitudes I'm familiar with getting from all sorts of customer service interactions and sadly, I'm sure you are too! On the contrary, she seemed so relieved and genuinely happy for us when she was able to make everything work - and was so reassuring throughout what was obviously an unexpectedly long and complicated process. I commented to my girlfriend later that it makes you realise that customer service really is an art form. What could have been a terrible start to our staycation actually turned into a great one, because we had such a positive interaction and it felt like we'd been given a gift. 
Aside from that: yep, nice room, nice hotel. Elegant design with nice quirks. Record player for room use, along with a few "NYC native" LPs, was a very cute touch. Well furnished kitchen (although was missing any dish soap to run the dishwasher; I hope the staff didn't mind taking care of this part as we were unable to!). Overall a chic layout that the photos do justice to. It's in a densely high-rise part of the city so you're nlooking out on other windows, although they're not right on top of you - we kept the gauze privacy curtains down throughout, but it was still quite a bright space. Loved the little cocktail-shaker table, and the wine decanter which we were happy to have a chance to make use of. Beautifully quiet, felt like the walls were very thick. VERY comfortable king-size bed, nice robes provided. My only critique, which may sound a bit trivial, is that contrary to the photos of this particular room size, there was only ONE sitting chair. This seemed a bit silly, given that the room is obviously for at least 2 people. To be clear, there were also two dining chairs, but these were not the sort of comfy chairs you might sit in to read a book or watch TV, and they were also a very different height to the one sitting chair, so it felt a bit comical to pull it over to sit next to the other one. It's a minor design flaw, but if Mint actually reads these reviews, I'd certainly recommend adding a second chair to improve future folks' stays! (I guess it wouldn't matter if you were using the room just as a base while you explored the city, but I'm hazarding a guess that for the foreseeable covid-y future, everyone is coming here to curl up and be cozy for a spell, when the 4 walls of their own apartment are driving them mad). On that note, I should also mention that the stay felt very covid-safe. Staff and other customers very punctilious about mask usage, santiiser available everywhere, and a disposable santisation kit in the bathroom too. The room was also in a very clean and tidy state immediately upon arrival, the whole thing was very confidence inspiring.

title: Amazing Location and Wonderful Staff.... great experience
text: The accommodations were clean, trendy,  modern and comfortable.  Amazing amenities and the staff was knowledgeable of the downtown area and so very warm.  Gabby and Claritza made our stay feel like a home away from home.  I would stay here again and recommend it to everyone.  Room had a nice kitchen with all necessities and despite Covid lots to do in the area and Gabby & Claritza knew all the fun things to do.

title: Best Visit Ever
text:
There is not one negative thing to say about our stay. From the time I arrived, Daniel came out to my cab to help me bring in my luggage. The check in process was simple, especially because I filled out their paperwork ahead of my stay. Ariel, was super helpful, accommodating, and answered every question I had. Same with Daniel. They were helpful from checkin on Friday to check out on Monday. The room was amazing in size, cleanliness, and the hotel amenities, out of this world. The grocery store, the bowling alley.... My partner and I had a wonderful time. We will back, soon and often!!!

Thank you to the staff!!!

title: CLARI IS LITERALLY THE BEST
text: So I’d like to start off with saying Clari made my stay extremely accommodating, besides the fact that I was upset with there not being a Television in the bedrooms, everything was amazing. Anything I needed, clari was there for. She would be the only reason why I would come back to Mint House at 70 pine to be very honest because her customer service skills were impeccable! Thanks clari for making my stay flawless, I will see you soon - Bella

title: Just What I Needed
text: I booked the room for two nights for a mini staycation, and I was blown away. The minute we stepped into the room I knew I didn't want to leave. The whole experience was wonderful, with amenities everywhere - not to mention the building it's located in is BEAUTIFUL. 10/10. I will most definitely be coming back.

title: Outstanding!
text:
I had such an incredible stay at Mint House,I'll never look at a business trip the same way AGAIN - EVER!!! I felt so much gratitude for the thoughtful and attentive staff. I was overcome by it... the gratitude, that is! Haha. 

Checking in and out was seamless, and Daniel was extremely warm and helpful with the entire process. The room was pristine & clean, and the location is great. Definitely will be back!

title: No Really. Its Worth it.
text: I have one word for mint house: Outstanding. I booked the room at a great rate due to their fair pricing and was Super pleased with everything at mint down to the front lobby. Truly an experience for everybody 21 and up. But the true highlight of my stay was the front desk clerk Ariel. She went above and beyond to help make me and my girl stay phenomenal. Super clean, Super dope.  Book a night while its low.

title: FIVE STAR
text:
Booked a room at the Mint and was greeted by Ariel. She was super accommodating and helped me through the check in process.

After spending time getting to learn about the hotel and the area from Ariel I checked in to a stunning room. Very clean, kitchen, and really felt like a home more so than your typical hotel room. 

Loved my stay, highly recommended and can’t wait to return.

title: Valentines Day Stay
text: The staff at MINT HOUSE went above and beyond to make my Valentine’s Day evening a special occasion. Great customer service and incredible decor . Major thanks to Gabby , Claritza , Ariel , and Daniel .

title: Valentine’s into Galentine’s stay
text: My stay was originally planned as an anniversary/Valentine’s celebration. That changed at the last minute and Ariel at Mint House made sure I had a more than pleasant experience. The room was beautiful and breakfast was delicious!

title: Excellent staff !
text: Daniel and Claritza were super helpful, they helped me  get the room I wanted. This is by far the most spacious hotel room I have ever seen , very nice and clean. Location is excellent as well ! Will definitely be back .

title: Amazing and spacial rooms
text: I love Mint house.  This is my favorite place to visit anytime I get to nyc. Customer service is top notch. Thank you to Daniel and Claritza for their phenomenal customer service. They make mint house feel like home and that’s why I love this place. Book mint house for your stay

title: The BEST Stay of My Life
text: I don't know where to begin from the service to the cleanliness. I was in Heaven. Ariel at the front desk was amazing she truly new the ins and outs of Mint House and answered any questions I had. The room is so stylish and what's neat is they do daily housekeeping and on the 7th day a refresh. Also!! there's a grocery store downstairs with EVERYTHING you can think of. I would recommend this place in a heart beat!!!

title: Terrific Experience— Fantastic Staff
text:
We have been bouncing around to some lovely downtown hotels while our local apartment is under construction.  

I have to say, Mint House is definitely by far and away the best, particularly because of the staff, extra shout out to Candace- we had the privilege of interacting with her several times.  Always professional, courteous, extremely responsive- she to me exemplifies what a difference a person who truly strives to make guests comfortable can make. 

We have a young family and appreciate the large size of the rooms and the terrific amenities.  The gyms are world class and there is even a bowling alley.  

The rooms themselves have struck a great balance between luxe and comfortable.  I have a new favorite coffee and tea brand thanks to what they stocked our room with, the bedding is heavenly and the layout is efficient.  Absolutely top quality and wonderful.  To top it all off, there is a lovely grocery store with just about anything you could want, a delicious coffee shop, and a couple of dining choices... all without leaving the building!

title: One night stay
text: I must stay this was an amazing experience we had the honor of being helped by Ariel she was the best. Made us feel at home and we wanted for nothing. Thanks Ariel and mint house. I will surely be back

title: MintHouse 70 Pine Review
text: Upon arriving to Mint House, the main lobby was absolutely stunning. Although the location of the front desk was a bit strange, the host working was very friendly and personable. He interacted well with the customers and was polite and accommodating. The check in process was well informed and very helpful, although some of the rules and regulations were not included in the booking process. It should be mentioned that there is an expected quiet time, although there wasn’t any issues, it would be nice to have expected that before arrival. After checking in, I was surprised to find some not so appealing art work that filled the hotel, halls and the room. Although the portraits were colorful and fun I did not find it very comforting to have large faces all over the room, across from the bed and next to the kitchen table, essentially just “staring”. I found it pretty odd. Also, the room was extremely spacious, but was confused as to why the layout placed the couch near the front door separate from the kitchen and everything else. The couch did not end up being used since it was so far away. Loved the kitchen and bathroom. Overall, the room was well worth the price and I can say that my guests and were satisfied. 4/5 stars, glad the Mint House could provide a location for me to send off my going away get together.

title: Great Space and Great Customer Service
text:
We have stay in this location before under different ownership. The customer service now is by far much better. The unit we have was very nice and spacious. When we tried to work in the room one day we found that the table was a little small for 2 people and 2 laptops. When we ask at the desk if there was a way to get a larger table, Daniel, the gentleman at the front desk, did something better. He offered us another room with a much larger table and even helps us to move our belongings.

Daniel went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. He was outgoing, personable and took genuine pride in doing his job well. During the short time we interacted with him we witnessed him re-direct and unregistered guest to the front desk and an unmasked guest back to her room for her mask. He did this in a professional and courteous way that was impressive to see. This hotel is very fortunate to have someone like Daniel represent them.

We will definitely be back to stay again

title: Amazing stay at Mint house
text: I had such an amazing time, the staff was so helpful I never felt like I was overwhelmed and couldn’t have anything answered and they were extremely kind. The room we stayed in was so beautiful and a great size. They were helpful in letting us know the areas around the hotel so we could go find food easily. I will 100% be coming back again I’ve never had a hotel experience like this in my life. I’ve had great stays but never like this and that’s saying something.

title: Mint House NYC
text:
Wonderful place for a long NYC stay, rooms complete with kitchen and plenty of space. Very residential like and designed very well. 

LOVED the Casper mattress, down pillows, and Frette linens. It made the sleep experience amazing and that is super hard to find when i travel. I will definitely return

title: Long term stay/ extended work from anywhere vacation
text: Where do I begin, I am on the process of closing on a condo that has been delayed and needed a place to call home. I work from home so space, ambience and location where at the top of my list. This place meets and exceeds all expectations for everything I need and want from a hotel that feels truly like home. The rooms/ apartments are super well appointed with incredible ambience and legit makes me feel like I’m at home. I want the info to their interior design team for real! The bed is incredibly comfortable and the space just makes what is a stressful process of waiting to close on a home not stressful at all. Additionally, the staff here has gone above and beyond to make me feel welcomed and right at home.... they even offered to grab groceries for me!! Needles to say, I would without a doubt recommend this place to anyone visiting NYC or in transition when it comes to a move. Thank you Mint House for an incredible experience!!

title: Best Place to Stay in NYC!
text: I couldn't have wished to stay in a better place in NYC than Mint House at 70 Pine. The room was HUGE for NYC. It was clean and it had everything I could have wished for. And more! It's a gem, and I cannot wait to stay here again.

title: I'm forever spoiled
text:
I've been to plenty of other hotels in the city but THIS place was AMAZING. The building, the spaciousness of the room, the cleaniness, how much people cared and the attentiveness of the staff to calls, texts, literally everything. 

The bath soaps and shampoo's didn't irritate my scalp like most other hotels do, they smell extremely nice. The bathroom itself didn't feel like some afterthought and compared to every Marriot and Hilton I've stayed at blew way past even the priciest ones. 

The closests were a lifesaver for all the things we packed and brought with us and weren't the slamfests I've had in other places. 

When the cleaners came you could smell it, because it felt like they actually used normal cleaning supplies on things and generally left the place spotless. 

The kitchen was stocked with Crate and Barrel dinnerware that you could probably drop on the floor and not worry about it cracking like I've cracked other plates in hotels with kitchenettes just tapping them a bit hard on the countertop. 

MOST IMPORTANT TO US WERE THAT THERE WERE NO SMOKERS AND NOISE. Seriously, every hotel I've been too I could hear someone's high heels at some point in the night or loud music, and faintly smell someone smoking a cigar, tobasco, weed, or something else at some point. Not here. I had someone next door with kids clearing trying to break the sound barrier but as soon as the door closed? Not a peep. 

I rarely write reviews but I'm more than happy to make sure everyone knows how amazing this place is, they deserve every bit of success. I hope more places like this pop up because THIS is the future.

title: Great NYE Stay
text: My needs and expectations were definitely met, including a complimentary upgrade to a much bigger room. My airbnb was cancelled so finding a modern hotel with a full kitchen last minute was a godsend.

title: MINT HOUSE
text: Excellent boutique hotel in FiDi.    Quiet, comfortable.  With kitchen, fridge, freezer, stove, etc.   Parking garages minutes walk away.   Very close to all Fulton Subway.   Beautiful lobby.    Beds are a bit low to the ground and a little soft but still very comfortable.   Shampoo, conditioner and body gel provided and all were lovely.   Pets allowed.

title: Large, comfortable, modern and clean apartment for family
text: We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the apartment, being in NYC. Everything seemed new, worked, was technologically up to date, and very clean and uncluttered. The kitchen had all of the utensils, cooking needs, bowls, and equipment that I would expect to find in an AirBNB but without someone's personal clutter. The Frette linens were also quite nice. But being able to fully use the kitchen and dining area was by far the best amenity for us, traveling with 2 elementary aged kids during COVID times, and there is an excellent full grocery store in the same building. We even ran the dishwasher once during our stay, and it was efficient and quiet. The front desk service was also excellent.  If you are ok being in the financial district/south Manhattan (much quieter than mid-town), this is a wonderful property and a good value for the money in NYC.

title: This Place is DOPE
text: Ok I’ll try to make this short, I book this room on line, and they have 24hr check in. We came in around 10:30 - 11:00 pm and I had an issue with my credit card. I was working with Daniel and I was kind of nervous but I was lost and thinking I’m about to be stuck here in the city with no room But DANIEL was very Kool and was more than willing to help he said ok give me a minute and see if I can work something out and boooooom he was able to look in his computer and do something magical and was able to get me in the room. He was very helpful getting tea and records (I believe each has a record play). All I can say is Daniel played like an MVP in the crunch time for me in a time of need! I’m greatly appreciated for his help... also I have to give an honorable mention to his co-worker Clarissa when we called in she was breaking down and helping us with the decision of getting a car or not and just being they are personable and not just a worker.... I love staying here this place is the truth! Oh I forgot to mention that there is an full grocery store in the basement with hood fresh food. You have to check out this spot called Brooklyn beef and cheese... to me the Turkey burger was the best but I had a few from there....just an FYI please try it out... I think that’s it if you check in with any one I’m sure they will take care of you but Daniel is the truth

title: Real Experienced Based Review
text:
I visited the NYC Mint House property in December of 2020, amid the harshest of times for the hospitality industry; especially in NY. I am a restaurateur, so I have a keen point of view on hospitality when I'm on the receiving end, with the highest of expectations. I must say that 'Mint House' NYC has surpassed every expectation I could have dreamt of!

I could rave about the decor; the sq footage you received; the cleanliness; the amenities and every other physical attribute one could wish for in a hotel, but what actually makes it even better (as if I wasn't already completely sold on being a repeat customer), was what I consider to be the pulse of this greatly put together body of a property... the amazing manager Robert Naeder, as well as staff Danny alongside a young lady whom name escapes me, but I remember it starts with an M. The care and service I received was second to none! 

In my travels I frequent hotels internationally and domestically, looking forward to receiving the highest expectation of hospitality as every day I have to ensure I meet these same expectations in my restaurant business. With moral amongst hospitality workers low with the state of the current pandemic, this can easily be lost. Well, not at Mint House! If you are looking for a place to say, be it business or pleasure, do yourself a favor and look no further than 'Mint House' NYC.

title: Clean and Excellent Service
text: Shout out to Robert for giving us the best rate ever and to Clartiza for giving us the most welcoming check-in. Definitely will be back in the coming days with friends and family. You will not be able to find such spacious and artsy suites anywhere in NYC!!!

title: Family time nyc
text: Wonderful large rooms with everything you need for a family stay. Great staff and friendly . Love the shower dispensers,and boxed waters, less plastic waste . BEDS AND LINEN ARE SO SOFT AND CUDDLY.Our go-to place when we are in manhattan.

title: Mint House/Lyric Sets the standard. Again.
text: Another stay at the Lyric. This time it was to mark a milestone. On arrival, we witnessed the concierge Daniel, dealing with two rather "taxing"  guests. His composure, professionalism in managing the situation was award-worthy.  After checking in we went to our room at arrived to a magnificent birthday surprise (can't share exactly what). The Lyric knows how to look after its guests. The sparkling clean one-bedroom deluxe apartment had a king-sized bed that was so comfortable the entire stay could have been spent there. The bedroom had ample closets, plush cotton robes, a subway tile bathroom adorned with the luxurious scents of Malin + Goetz. The second bathroom (yes, second bathroom) also was spacious. The stylish living room area had a cozy sofa, good sized TV, and even a turntable. The sleek designed kitchen with the Stagg kettle had an array of thoughtful extras such as coffee, tea bags,  to-go cups, a dishwasher, and a smoothtop range oven (bakers, no smoking allowed in the listed building). There was also a separate dining area with the striking portraits which adorn the walls of the Lyric throughout. Stay experience out of 5, hmmm..... I'd say a 10. Thanks to Daniel-stellar service. Epic stay.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Excellence from start to finish. I'm not sure if these rooms are so affordable because of COVID, but the price is an absolute steal. I booked the deluxe king room and it was by far the biggest room I've ever seen in NYC. Full kitchen with dishwasher, dining table, nice television and a cool modern record player. The bed was comfortable, everything was clean, there was a COVID safety kit for people that like to take extra precautions. I only had the pleasure of staying one night because of the storm here in NYC, but I could see this as a lovely place to stay for a week or longer. One small note, there is no mini-bar and no refreshments are provided, but there was a note in the full sized refrigerator that said they will shop and stock the fridge for you. I imagine you can call ahead or just drop an order form at the front desk. Speaking of the front desk, Gabrielle and Ariel were warm, welcoming, and pleasant to deal with (and look at.) I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC, especially for a longer trip if you want to make yourself feel at home.

title: Exceptional style and comfort
text: The Mint is an ideal location for when we come to NYC to visit our family - the studio apartments are very comfortable and well equipped . The front desk staff are exceptional and remember us and even ask about our granddaughter ! We stayed at the hotel ore COVID and not feel especially safe and comfortable during the pandemic . Thank you

title: Amazing Experience
text: This was our second time staying at 70 Pine. First of the woman who greeted us remembered us from our last stay (two months before) and I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed in the one bedroom, two bathroom suite. The atmosphere is so homey and comfortable. We had guests and they were amazed. The kitchen comes with kitchenware and equipment which was great. Only thing I would change is having later quiet hours. It starts at 9. I think 10 or 11 would be better. The main office called to remind us about quiet hours because we were playing music. But they were very polite about it and we lowered our music down immediately. Love the place. Will definitely be back

title: WOW - There's a reason why this is #1 in the entire Tri-State area!
text:
Look no further; I'm here now after a few nights and can only say, being a Platinum member of 2 hotel chains, that I have found my new favorite. 
The dedication, professionalism and care of the MintHouse team here at 70 Pine is second to none; I've been part of the hospitality industry myself - yet never came across such a group effort to take care of every single detail of the guest experience.

Mint House on 70 Pine embodies everything right about this industry: it offers HUGE (I do mean that, not even just in NY standards) apartments with the consistency of a boutique hotel and the attention to detail you find literally nowhere else. The team is kind, proefssional, caring and action-oriented - from signing my packages to refilling my coffe (amazing boutique coffee they curate), from offering an umbrella to suggesting COVID-safe hangout spots to enjoy the brisk sunsets here -- they got it all. 

I have landed here for work while between apartments and even as a New Yorker in hospitality I was amazed. You won't find anything better than that. I promise.

title: In a socially distant world, personal connection was 5 stars
text:
Arielle (Ariel?) and Gabby (Gabriele?) were incredible stewards of this property. Professional, kind, helpful. The room itself is lovely and well outfitted and equipped. Great spot. 

I'm a professional traveler and this place has a uniqueness that sets it apart.

title: Amazing
text: Super clean, beautiful boutique hotel. The customer service is amazing. Daniel at the front desk is wonderful person and very helpful. Every thing you need is in the room. And pier 17 is walking distance

title: Great stay! Big room and amazing service
text: We had a great stay and Lyric, employees were so nice and friendly. Me and my boyfriend worked two day in the room and it was very comfortable, especially having a kitchen. The staff accommodated all our requests and we really appreciated it. Also very convenient that there is a food market/grocery in the same building.

title: Great room and outstanding service.
text: I love this place! How is that the staff made the whole place even better? Great room-like a studio apartment both inviting and warm. We stayed a couple days and used many of the kitchen amenities; stove, toaster, full-size fridge. I Played records and did some work while in the room. Amazing. Why will we come back? The SERVICE is old school charming and efficient.  Daniel B at the front desk is knowledgeable, helpful and kindly. We saw him in front of the hotel when we were a little lost and he walked us to our destination during his lunch break. The housekeepers were very polite, too.

title: Lyric Becomes My Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: Where do I begin? The Lyric Hotel of 70 Pine has always been on my list. Fantastic location, historic building, phenomenal service and assistance, all in one place. The Financial District is quiet, but yet provides adequate amounts of things to do, places to eat, and things to see. It’s also in a central location which allowed me to travel to and where I needed without difficulty. The staff was more then great, providing me with recommendations, as well as answering all questions. Rob was able to accommodate me despite an error on my end in the booking process, and provide me with a fantastic room. The entire staff had a lovely presence and feeling to them during my interactions as well. I will most certainly be back.

title: What A Great Place!
text: Chose this place due to its proximity to an event on Wall Street. What a great place! We chose the studio deluxe. It was huge, very cool looking,and had a kitchen. The building has a restaurant, coffee shop and a convenience store. Guest services and housekeeping was fantastic. The check in folks were the best we’ve encountered in NYC.And the price- unbelievably low for the value.

title: Really very nice
text:
Very very nice hotel. Staff was super friendly. Many times better than most hotels rooms. Everything was super clean and chic. 

Cool things: pour over coffee maker, drawing paper on the counter, vinyl record player, cool mirrors, etc

title: Excellent stay in NYC
text: We only stayed one night but can plan to make this our go-to for NYC trips.  Staff is great and attentive, ability to text them with any questions or concerns is super convenient.  The room was spacious, well-appointed, and clean.  No complaints.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: Will forever and always stay here when visiting New York! This hotel is the best in the city and accommodates travelers with so much space, amazing amenities and the best location that makes getting around the city a breeze.

title: The Best!
text:
Lyric is my favorite hotel in the city for a few reasons. The rooms are beautifully designed and their kitchens are perfect. It’s the perfect place to get work done, have a lovely evening with friends or family, or take the night off for yourself. They have an amazing selection of vinyl in the lobby and you can bring whatever you’d like up to your room! When do you ever see that?! Also, the plants downstairs have a wholesome vibe.  

The best thing about Lyric is the front desk. Daniel, Claire, Ariel, Kevin and Rob are always on top of everything and some of the warmest, friendliest and loveliest people in the city. I keep extending my stay here because I never want to leave. You always get more than what you pay for when staying here. <3

title: Ariel is a life saver!
text:
I stayed two nights at Lyric about a week ago with some of my closest friends. The first night I had a delightful check in with Ariel and as the night went on met more of the lovely staff and was just in shock at how everyone was so gosh darn welcoming. The second night I ran into an issue with the room that really looked like the whole experience was going to be turned upside down but Ariel came to save the day and really set the bar for taking the time to get to know a guest and making sure they are going to leave very satisfied. There's great things about this hotel but the entire staff is the reason why this place is so high in my book and you need to stay here to see what it's all about. Thank you again to the entire staff, I'm sure you guys won't remember me but I will always remember you!

Best Regards,
Joseph

title: THE BEST HOTEL I’VE BEEN IN!
text: This place was HEAVEN!! I booked a studio suite here for my 21st birthday and oh my god was it the best room I’ve ever seen! I definitely got more than I asked for, this place was a whole apartment!!! ❤️ The room was huge and super clean and the aesthetic of this hotel is out of this world! It is also super quiet for being so close to Wall Street! I will definitely be going back this place was everything I wished for an more!

title: Amazing!!!! Hidden GEM
text: being a native New Yorker I was very impressed by this low key beautiful hotel. the staff was amazing especially Claritza she was so helpful, polite and made me feel welcomed!! Definitely Would recommend

title: The best hotel in Manhattan
text: Looking for space, comfort, privacy, peace and quiet? The Lyric does everything to the best degree. Located in a bustling, yet quiet area in the Financial District, you’re poised to enjoy as much or as little adventure as you’d like. The high ceilings and spacious rooms are a breath of fresh air in the city, and with a fully furnished kitchen in conjunction with a supermarket in the same building, the convenience is unmatched. This is the only hotel my family of three books each time we return to the city, and we always look forward to the cozy comfort of a beautifully outfitted space.

title: Amazing!
text: The staff was warm and welcoming, Daniel and Clarissa were absolutely amazing! I told them I was celebrating my boyfriend’s birthday and they were able to accommodate a late checkout for us (greatly appreciate it). I will definitely be back, thank you again! :)

title: Simply put, LYRIC 70 Pine Street sets the standard
text: LYRIC sets the standard for independent boutique hotel travel offerings. The external building is Art Deco at its finest.  Staff member Ariel who welcomed us was stellar. Beautifully conceptualized contemporary interior space. An eye for the small details. Wall Street (willams st) subway is a block away, also walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge and reflection by the water. A gem.

title: Delightful staff, comfortable suites and a historic building
text: I was at the Lyric through the worst months of the pandemic in NYC, and so I spent more time in my room than I might have expected! Fortunately it was comfortable and spacious, with a well equipped kitchen, a Bluetooth-connected sound system, french press & pour over coffee makers and a ready supply of coffee beans, towels and toiletries. The staff were ever helpful and friendly, so I want to say a big thanks to Dan, Ariel, and everyone else for making me feel so welcome. Our chats at reception were always a pleasure and helped keep me grounded through what was a very strange time to be in NYC.

title: The Lyric was a place to remember
text: The Lyric was wonderful from our arrival to our departure. This was our second time and we plan on coming back again in two weeks. I liked the cleanliness and spaciness of the room. There were plenty of towels and kitchen plates and utensils to use. I liked the rooms wi-fi speakers and used them a lot with my tablets Alexa app to play plenty of music. I love the layout and art work around the hotel and in the rooms. Everything looks freshly painted and cleaned. The Lyric staff was very attentive to all our requests. I do not have any issues with this place. I am very much looking forward to my next stay.. I love this place and highly recommend it. I really hope the gym opens soon. I look forward to using those facilities.

title: A home away from home
text:
Ever since the reopening of NYC in July, I have resumed my business activities in the city which requires regular trips to the financial district. I have to say that it was truly fortunate to find Lyric and it's amazing staffs when I was searching for a comfortable place to stay. I want to give a huge shout out to Dan, Claritza, Gabby, Ariel, Kevin, and all the amazing staffs for going above and beyond every time. Because of all the amazing experiences, Lyric has been my top and only choice of FiDi hotel whenever I come to the city for business. Thank you all once again for making this a home away from home!

Best Regards

Kevin Y.

title: Lyric at 70 Pine is Fantastic FiDi Option
text: The Lyric team was responsive and professional, although I did not have any issues beyond a faulty room key. The smallest suite is still very roomy and impeccably clean. Fully equipped kitchen (you bring the food/bev), very nice bath products and a stack of records and turntable! Only two blocks from Seaport and Wall Street and four blocks from the Manhattan side of the Brooklyn Bridge. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Perfect For Romance
text: Everything was perfect! Friendly staff, discounted parking, clean rooms and all the amenities! I called ahead and told the staff of my plans to have my personal chef come and cook for my girlfriends birthday and it was REMARKABLE! The Rooms Had Everything!!! You guys made me look good! Thank you so much!

title: Perfect home-from-home in Fidi
text: My husband and I took a three day anniverarymoon/quarantine break at the Lyric at 70 Pine.  The hotel was pristine, the staff was extremely accommodating, and our deluxe suite was perfect.  There was a large kitchen where you could, if you wanted to, cook Thanksgiving dinner for your family.   The alcove area with closets and a sofa bed was perfect for our dual work-from-staycation scenario, and there were plenty of extra towels, pillows and blankets.   The hotel is a 3-5 minute walk to the Fulton transportation center and subway lines to anywhere you need to go.  We WILL be back.

title: Best Experience by far !!
text: I discovered Lyric at the beginning of the summer. I have been coming back ever since. One of the main factors in me returning was the customer service. The Host Gabrielle and Arielle were very helpful and professional. Any questions I had they answered it. Overall 5 star experience, I would definitely recommend 70 Pine.

title: Trip to see friends
text: The hotel is located in a beautiful building in the Financial District.  The rooms are very spacious and attractive.  There was plenty to do close by, but the hotel was not far from  my friends and the areas where we hung out most of the weekend.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Highly Recommended
text: Had a wonderful week-long stay here in March. Excellent location minutes from Wall Street, and well connected to central Manhattan and Brooklyn by subway. The room was huge with great facilities and good, strong air-conditioning. It would be difficult to find a better place to stay if you are visiting New York for business or leisure. I would highly recommend the LYRIC, and I am sure that we will be back soon!

title: Second stay.
text: Everything was perfect. Large room. Great amenities. Very quiet room. Great rate.  Very helpful staff at the desk. Very happy. We are staying here again for a week in September. Would highly recommend !

title: Love It!
text:
I loved my stay here. It was a much needed staycation for myself and the room did the trick. I extended my stay for two extra nights and look forward to my next stay. 

The area has all food delivery options. I had a great time. The receptionist are friendly and call you to let you know your food has been delivered. A+ treatment.

title: Best hotel everrrrrrr
text: This place was nothing short of AMAZINGGGGG. Hallways were huge and always smell great. The rooms have everything you need and they are big and beautiful. All the soaps lotion smell so good. The bed felt like you were being hugged, I never wanted to get up. The staff goes above and beyond sweetest people ever and I know I can be annoying. Gabby made sure check in was quick easy and hassle free. Luis was greatttt, so helpful, super friendly, great hospitality, more than willing to answer any questions we had, he was just an all around great person, hope we see him again. Now Dorian, no words can describe, you can contact him for anything, overly friendly, more than amazing hospitality all staff were good. Being able to text front desk instead of calling all the time was such a nice touch.. Loved it.. I stayed for 10 days and had to extend because I never experienced a hotel like this and I stay at plenty.There is a game room, bowling alley and elite gym which are closed due to pandemic but I'm sure we would have enjoyed those amenities as well. Hopefully they will be open soon. Overall you won't be disappointed when you stay here the area is pretty great, supermarket below the hotel had literally everything, liquor store across the street great restaurants and fast food.. Loved everything about this place.. I have already told friends about this place and they have booked for Sept. I will also be booking for my birthday as well, Can't wait.. Again the staff is amazing.. Gabby, Dorian, Luis, Arial hope it's spelt right but thanks again for your hospitality. Great job LYRIC, see you soon.

title: Outstanding!!!!
text: Outstanding hotel!!! There is everything you need to have an amazing stay. Very very very comfortable bed, OMG, we slept so good. Kitchen has also everything (fridge, dishes, cups, glasses, dishwasher) very stylish kettle and coffeemaker, I’m pretty experienced traveler and can tell for sure it was the best coffee I’ve ever tried at the hotel. Everything looks very new, apartment was sparkling clean. Front desk are super nice, it was birthday of my boyfriend they recommend for us very nice restaurant and things to do around. Location is also great, close to subway station, walking distance to restaurants and shopping.

title: Home away from home
text:
Lyric is the best kept secret in Manhattan!  I almost hate to share this review...now I’ll never get a room!  
This hotel is truly unique!  The rooms don’t feel like you’re staying in a hotel, it’s more like you rented a cool NY apartment for a few days!  Way more elevated than other hotel properties in the area charging twice as much for half the space. The decor is modern, sexy and cozy all at the same time.  
But the best part is the staff!  I’m always happy to check in because I know I’ll see a recognizable face like Robert!  He is  one of the managers at Lyric. He and the rest of the team are superb!  They are not only accommodating, they truly care about you enjoying your experience.  Some of the staff has been with the property for at least 3 years now and it shows by the way standards are maintained and the care taken to ensure you not only have a wonderful stay but also come back in the future!

title: Superb Customer Service!
text: I can't say anything but great things about my entire experience at 70 Pine! Everyone was extremely pleasant and welcoming which I greatly appreciated. The room was even more beautiful than the images on the website.

title: Best hotel experience ever
text: The decor of the hotel was impeccable. So was the bang for your buck , but what wow’ed me was the customer service. Your desk representative by the name of vanica ramsundar went above and beyond to accommodate my every needs to surprise my wife for her birthday. From the every check in so I can set up to constant updates the week of to keep me informed. She def needs a raise . When hiring any new employees she is definitely the benchmark.

title: The single greatest hotel experience. Period.
text:
Many a times we’ve stayed in a hotel just to feel we’ve wasted $300 on an uncomfortable bed and a shower thats too small. Lyric pulls out all the stops. Total luxury through and through. A record player and small collection in each room, nice TV’s, super comfy beds, beautiful kitchens and bathrooms, and every amenity you could hope for. You can tell thought and care was put into each item you’ll encounter. 

Customer service is outright top notch. Extremely accommodating - if they can do it complimentary, they will. Parking conveniently located with 2 garages within a block, they validate for both. A nice market in the basement of the building. If you’re traveling for work or play, you’d never need to leave campus and will have everything you need for an incredible stay!

title: Great Visit!
text: Loved my visit to Lyric. Can't say enough good things about my stay. It was really pleasant-the room was clean, spacious, plenty of snacks and great collection of vinyl records to play. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice. Would definitely recommend staying here and will do so when I'm in NY next time.

title: Robert Matthews
text: i recently visited the lyric which was already my favorite hotel in new york.but last night i was very tired but daniel berkey really came thru for us. a night that would have been disaster anywhere else just simply wasnt ...... thanks daniel berkey

title: Gold Standard of Hospitality
text: I have been staying at the Lyric during the COVID pandemic. The home away from home suites is spacious, inspiring, and immaculate. However, it is the staff that makes this the best hotel experience ever! The team is the gold standard of hospitality! Total rock stars!

title: Lyric Hotel (Rhythm without the Blues)
text: Suite was very spacious and provided everything I needed to make it a comfortable stay.  The theme of the hotel had an overall great vibe. As a music lover I appreciated the decorated homage to pop-culture and various genres. I’ll definitely stay again and will recommend to a friend.

title: best hotel in nyc
text:
This is by far the best hotel in nyc I have visited, large spacious room for a good price definitely 4 star luxury modern and artistic they even upgraded my room for free and completed all my request for my gf birthday. Ariel and Gabby were both very nice and provided great customer service had no problem
helping me and providing me with all the information I needed for my stay. The manager robert was also nice kept in constant contact with me replied quick to any of my questions and made sure we had a great stay. Kevin was nice enough to set up everything in my room for the Surprise. Definitely recommend for any couples out there that want to get away and plan something nice as this is a hotel you can do that with.

title: Delightful!
text: My first, but definitely not last, stay at Lyric! Beautiful building, creative decor, and excellent service. I had some special needs, and Gabby was incredible with her assistance and delightful manner.

title: La miglior struttura per vivere New York al meglio
text:
Financial District, Wall Street, 
situato all'interno di un palazzo storico di 66 piani, all'interno dell'American International Building si trova questo fantastico residence. Le camere molto nuove e ben tenute hanno una cucina completamente attrezzata, (piastre ad induzione, microonde, forno, lavastoviglie e macchina caffè), bagno e camera da letto. Poter cucinare fa risparmiare molto e non si è costretti ad andare sempre al ristorante. Arredate con cura hanno un tocco in più considerato che sono fornite di un impianto audio Bose, un delizioso giradischi e una bella scelta di LP da far suonare alla vecchia maniera. Delizioso. Televisore HD con schermo piatto e connessione a Netflix. Ottima la connessione Wifi. Non essendo un hotel, ma un residence si è molto indipendenti ma l'attenzione al cliente non manca mai per qualunque cosa di cui si abbia bisogno. Al piano rialzato, nella Lobby, c'è la reception dove c'è sempre qualcuno pronto a rispondere alle tue domande e gentilezza e professionalità la fanno da padrona. Le camere vengono riassettate tutti i giorni e a fondo 1 volta alla settimana. Ovvero il cambio lenzuola è settimanale ma all'interno degli armadi sono riposti set di asciugamani per coloro che usano cambiare asciugamani tutti i giorni. Al piano rialzato, dove c'è la reception c'è un coffee shop che serve anche colazioni e snack. All'angolo della via la cosa più preziosa, un fantastico supermarket fornito di tutto, inclusa una serie infinita di piatti pronti, sushi, pizza nel caso si voglia mangiare in camera ma senza cucinare. All'angolo opposto un negozio di alcolici dove acquistare ottimo vino. Non manca nulla, neppure la palestra, con accesso dedicato agli ospiti e lavatrici e asciugatrici al piano 6. Volendo trovare un piccolo difetto posso dire che le camere sono abbastanza buie, in parte perché come tutti sappiamo a causa dei palazzi molto alti a Manatthan gli appartamenti non prendono molta luce, in parte perché forse è un po' carente l'illuminazione all'interno della camera, soprattutto nella zona tv/letto, ma direi che si può ampiamente sorvolare. Credo che la prossima volta tornerò qua continuando a scegliere questa soluzione a quella dell'hotel classico. La metro è a 2 minuti, comodissimo. Un ringraziamento particolare va a Robert che è stato sempre presente, disponibile e gentilissimo. Su di lui potete contare. Grazie.

title: Just incredible
text:
Having worked in hotels for the last 15 years I’ve been spoilt and now quite fussy about hotels I stay in. 
This hotel provided one of the best experiences I’ve had in many years. It is not only breath takingly beautiful, but also the staff were impeccable. I was traveling alone for the first time to NY and I could have been made to feel more welcome or safer. 
The room/apartment I stayed in was stunning and I was gutted I was only staying for one night. Ariel on reception couldn’t of been more helpful in safely looking after my bags before and after check out which was a brilliant help. 
We did have a little upset at check in but it’s nothing I haven’t done myself so it didn’t bother me. 
I can’t say anything bad about the place. Had everything you could need and want.

title: Amazing!
text: Such a fabulous hotel, in fact much more like having a super cool apartment in New York. My husband and two teens and I stayed for a week. Such a gorgeous Art Deco building in a great part of NYC. I’ve always stayed mid town or upper but this was the best choice ever. Beautiful room, lovely kitchen, gorgeous furniture, loads of space. And the Beastie boys LP! Kids had their own sleeping area in the studio. Great bathroom products. Lovely staff. Just perfect! You can see the building form all over, fascinating history. Take me back there!!!

title: Splendide
text:
Appartements superbes!!
Décoration moderne et épurée.
Équipement top (cuisine complète, salle de bain avec nécessaire, platine avec vinyles....)
Idéalement situé proche du mémorial, bateau pour la statue de la liberté, quartier wall street et station de métro juste en face le top!!!)
Nous y reviendrons avec plaisir

title: Incredible Property in the Best Part of the City
text: Incredible property - huge rooms in an amazing art deco skyscraper and a very quiet part of the city. The rooms have high ceilings and are very well appointed with comfortable and useful furnishings including a turntable and a great selection of vinyl. The bed is very comfortable and lots of additional bedding is provided. Service is top notch and very attentive - my wife and I were there for our anniversary and were nicely surprised with rose petals leading to the bed and on the bed one evening. Nice and very unexpected touch. The gym, which is included for guests staying at the hotel, has everything you could possibly need and is not overly crowded. There is a market attached to the property that is open late and has a huge selection of both prepared food and groceries in case you want to stay in and cook instead of eating out. Location couldn't be better - close to the 2 and 3 subway lines for quick access uptown, walking distance to great restaurants including Nobu downtown and Joe's pizza (a NYC institution) and walking distance to One World Trade, Chinatown, the Brooklyn Bridge and Little Italy. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Premium experience!
text: I'm travel a lot for business. This is a premium experience (but not a a premium price)! Space, amenities, access, location, comfort and customer experience were top notch. Arguably the best I've experienced in NYC. I'd bring my family--the space would allow us to be very comfortable.

title: THE best place to stay in Manhattan
text:
I posted a review early in my stay but wanted to follow up on my stay now that it's concluded. 
Bottom line - This place is pure gold! Aside from the little bumps I mentioned earlier, our stay was perfect.  So wonderful to have space in a Manhattan hotel room! While the street noise is quite loud during the day/early evening, nights are not bad at all. Plus the hotel provides both earplugs and a white noise machine for us light sleepers. And I did not hear any noise from other suites whether adjacent or above/below. Fantastic for an older building!
The bed is incredibly comfortable with high quality linens and side tables/shelves that provide both an outlet and usb ports.  
The bathroom is lovely and functional with large built in cabinets behind the mirrors, which helps make up for the lack of counter space. The shampoo, conditioner, and body wash by Malin & Goetz smells great and feels luxurious. 
We had the 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms, which was a nice feature when my daughter and I were both getting ready at the same time. 
There's a small dining set as you walk into the suite, but it's not super convenient and doesn't have a window, so we just didn't use it and thus was wasted space. 
The record player was perfect for us as we are vinyl junkies. And the selection of music upon arrival was perfect to get us started. 
Other wonderful details:
-bar cart with beautiful accessories including a wine opener, pourer, stopper, etc. 
-coffee table had a lift up top so you could eat while watching tv if u choose
-Fello Stagg electric kettle pour-over coffee system with Sey coffee - I had never used this system before and I was blown away! Incredible - so incredible that I purchased one as soon as I got home! 
-lots of teas provided as well
- a couple of throw blankets and poufs, which made the suite very comfortable and cozy for a night of movie watching
-upon arrival the suite had 2 cartons of water and some chocolate-covered almonds waiting for us
There's a great market right downstairs in the same building to grab items to stock the kitchen and the hotel will actually do it for you if you'd like without any extra fees!
And there's a fabulous restaurant as well by the  Michelin-starred chef behind Nomad. Amazing food and drinks. 
Easy walk to various subway lines. It took us about 15-20 minutes to get to midtown. So we found the location to be perfect. 
As you can tell, we loved the place! I make frequent visits to NYC and plan on making the Lyric at 70 Pine my home away from home.

title: Easily Best NYC Experience We've Had! Love Lyric!
text: We're doing an apartment renovation and needed a place to stay locally. My wife is pregnant, so we had looked at traditional hotels, renting an Airbnb, corporate housing, etc. And then heard about Lyric. We had done 1 week of hotel and the Lyric was like a revelation. We were so relieved to have found it. The Studio Suite we were in as HUGE. It had a full kitchen, a fridge that they fill up for you if you fill out a card, and so much closet space. Even had a full dining table which really made it feel like we were normal people again. TV has Netflix and really it felt like a home away from home. Staff is super friendly. We had Amazon packges sent there. Plus the building it's in has ALL the amenities. Super nice Gym below (NYSC Elite, which was new to me), great coffee shop (Black Fox), super swank restaurant (Crown Shy), and maybe the biggest grocery store I've seen in Manhattan on the corner. We were there 2 weeks and are going back for 2 more weeks until the renovation is done. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Was a lifesaver for us.

title: Amazing !!!!
text:
What a great place !!! 
We was 2 kids and 2 adults, best bed ever, nice atmosphere, warm and beautiful very clean ... We really enjoy the record player with good NY music. 
I recommend this apartment hotel. 
We'll definitely go back.

title: Wonderful choice for a NYC visit!
text: I booked as a last minute, overnight getaway in Manhattan with a great deal.  We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel! It is in a beautiful art deco building, convenient to the FDR, subway station, Wall Street, Battery Park, 9-11 Memorial and Freedom Tower, South Street Seaport and piers, close to many wonderful restaurants and Irish Pubs :).   The room was impeccable, beautifully decorated,  spotless and had more amenities than we could ever need (full kitchen, water, chips, chocolate covered almonds, coffee and tea in the room and more available in the lobby!!!).   There is a record player in each room with albums plus more albums to chose from in the lobby.  The king size bed was super comfy (Casper mattress,  I believe).  I loved the  shampoo/conditioner and body wash, had to order some for home.  From check in to check out the front desk staff were friendly, efficient and very helpful (Clarissa and Kevin, I think).   I am so happy to have found the Lyric hotel.  I will definitely stay there again when visiting NYC.

title: Love Lyric!
text:
I traveled to NYC to visit my college-aged daughter and to see a show.  I was shocked by the large-sized clean, modern room.  It was well laid out with a small sitting area away from the sleeping area so the night owls in our party could have their space without bothering my early bedtime.  There was a well outfitted kitchen area and a large bathroom.  The closet was almost as large as the bathroom and inside the closets were great surprises, like soft bathrobes.
Others mentioned being bothered by outside noise.  I did not experience loud outside noise.  But if I had a problem there were ear plugs and a white noise machine in the closet.
The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean.  At 700 sq. ft., It was very spacious.  The best part of all were the vinyl records and turntable in the room!  It was such a treat to listen to good quality vinyl.
I had a few glitches.  Two of my family's devices could not connect to the internet.  We also could not seem to get regular cable channels.  We called the desk a few times for assistance and got no answer.  That's not good.  There was a tag on the door offering a tote bag, but no tote bag was present.  It seems like a tiny issue, but I really wanted the tote bag.  Nevertheless, I highly recommend Lyric at 70 Pine.

title: Au top
text:
Super séjour en famille en studio deluxe.  Nous étions deux adultes et deux enfants de 5 et 7 ans.
Spacieux, cuisine toute équipée avec électro ménager de bonne qualité, grande pièce de dressing,  propre, literie très confortable, ménage quotidien, peignoir, sèche cheveux...
Juste en bas vous avez le métro, qui vous ramène en  10 mnt, 15 mnt max à  times square par exemple. 
L'hôtel est très  bien placé et vous pouvez vous rendre à pied au pont de Brooklyn, battery Park.
En remontant sur pine street, direction le mémorial, vous avez pleins de food truck, pour manger à la maison.

les supermarchés aux alentours sont assez chers je trouve : 4 yaourts 5 dollars,  une bouteille d'eau à 3 dollars ect

Je recommande et je pense que si nous devions revenir à NYC, nous reviendrons sans hésiter à LYRIC 70 PINE

title: A couple of anoying glitches but impressed so far
text:
I'm here at the Lyric for my first night of 4 at this hotel in the heart of FiDi. To start, it's extremely hard to find out how to get into the building, especially lugging a 50 lb suitcase, carry-on, and purse after flying cross country all night.  No bellman in sight to assist. Only a doorman to indifferently point to the other side of the building. Staff at check-in were very nice and informative. No lobby space to really hang out in. (Or for UberEats to find - it took him 25 minutes searching the building! Lol)
When I say hotel, I mean apartment! Beautiful, clean minimalist rooms. I've never seen hotel rooms quite like this in Manhattan. Note: in this particular suite (1bd/2 ba.), there are only 2 small windows so the rooms are a bit dark. Had I known, I would have definitely inquired whether the larger suite had bigger/more windows and booked that. (I don't care about a view - this is Manhattan- but natural light is important to me for stays of this length)
And be warned - street noise is LOUD! It literally sounds like the windows are wide open. I know that's par for the course in NYC, but I'm on the 5th floor and this is probably the worst I've heard it in my 20 years of visiting NYC.  Thankfully, the hotel provides earplugs! 
There were several things missing from my room upon check in (like the promised coffee! Lol) that required me to have to contact the front desk. The staff responded and made sure I eventually received those items. But it made me feel like an a**hole and embarrassed that I had to keep calling down for things that should've been in my suite.
I will update my review at the end of my stay to include a review of the bed, whetger the earplugs work, etc. Hopefully, no more glitches!

title: A Fantastic Stay!!
text: This was the best hotel I have ever stayed in, in the city. We stayed in the deluxe studio and it exceeded our expectations. The room was so spacious and comfortable. There was a full kitchen that included a fridge/freezer, stove, oven, microwave, and dishwasher. The hotel is located in the heart of the Financial district with many great bars and restaurants nearby. It was even a short walk to the Freedom Tower which was a plus! Lastly, the service was amazing. Claritza went above and beyond to make sure that we were satisfied throughout our stay. We will definitely be returning!

title: Fabuleux
text: Exceptionnel !!! Un hôtel parfait! Quel bonheur de séjourner dans ce lieu. Les appartements sont immenses et magnifiquement décorés. Une décoration design et raffinée. Le service y est exceptionnel. Métro à 2 pas , supermarché sans sortir de l’immeuble !! Un sans faute. Séjour inoubliable assuré ! J’y retournerai !!

title: Perfect stay for a few days
text:
I stayed in a deluxe studio which included an eat-in kitchen and more closets than my own home!  There was a supermarket on the corner, a liquor store across the street, a pharmacy a block away and the subway was a short 7 minute walk.

I was unsure of staying in the Financial District, but found that it was really ideal to be far away from the maddening crowds.

The place was clean with maid service daily.

I stayed there the same time a friend was also staying there.  It was really nice to be able to chill at night in each other's apartments.  It was much more comfortable (and cheaper since some meals were eaten in) than a hotel.

I would absolutely consider staying there again.

title: Séjour fantastique
text: Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits dans un appartement dans cet hôtel . La décoration était très jolie et vraiment moderne avec des tableaux de photographie magnifiques . La cuisine est très bien équipée on peut cuisiner facilement ( four, très grand réfrégirateur ... ) . L’appartement est très bien isolé ( on entend pas les bruits de la rue ) . L’accueil est très sympathique, beaucoup de conseils par l’équipe de l’accueil surtout avec notre anglais plus que moyen .

title: Lyric at 70 Pine - FANTASTIC!
text: We had a quick two night stay at Lyric at Pine and it was more than we could have asked for.  We stayed in a Studio Deluxe room and it was so spacious and well decorated.  The Lyric is thoughtful from the record player (BEASTIES and JAYZ) to the super soft linens, we felt as though we were in our own apt.  The lobby service was amazing - so helpful, even sent up some treats for a birthday girl!  Location is surprisingly fun with much to do, the Oculus, Southstreet, The Jewish Heritage Museum and a quick subway ride to anywhere you desire.  We took advantage of the gym and the bowling alley - so much fun! STAY HERE and you won't regret it.

title: Best suit in NYC
text: I got a 2 bedroom suit for my friends and I to stay there. Everyone loved it!! This was the best hotel I have ever visited in NYC. Very posh and expensive. It was clean and the rooms were very spacious. I felt like a celebrity. And for the price...omg. The staff was friendly and I have absolutely no complain. It was even better than I expected ted. It looked just like the photos. Everyone was left bragging after our stay. There is nowhere else in Manhattan that had all the amenities like Lyric did. Also, the location is centralized. Book now!! You won’t regret.

title: What a great choice for NYC!
