text: For less than the price of a small room in a Midtown hotel, we had a wonderfully furnished one-bedroom suite with living room, kitchen area and 2 full bathrooms.  Moreover, the location in the Financial District proved to be very convenient, since the Lyric is easy walking distance to subways heading to both the West Side and the East Side, as well as Midtown.  And the staff were great!  All in all, I can't imagine a better choice for Manhattan!

title: My stay on Valentine's day 2/14/20
text: I want to start out by saying this is by far the best hotel I've been to in NYC (reside in NYC).I booked this hotel for Valentine's Day they fulfilled my every request. My man was so surprised on how huge and amazing their rooms were. Everything was so perfect. They have record players and the whole nine!! I had the pleasure of speaking with Clarissa and Gabby they made sure my stay was phenomenal. They knew exactly what I was looking for.I usually don't do reviews however I have to give credit where it's due. The room was so beautiful,spacious and CLEAN!! Their staff is super friendly and very informative on any questions you may have. They know how to treat their guests. I will definitely be going back to Lyric Hotel. Thank you Lyric & staff.💙

title: I'll stay at the Lyric occasionally under our corporate account with DY Consultants.
text: When I arrived, there was an issue with my room regarding a temporary fan was running for maintenance or repairs.  Claritza was very good in handling this situation, put me in a nice room, moved my items into the new and larger room and left me a nice note with a bottle of wine.  Claritza handled it very well.

title: Great time in Lyric@70Pine
text:
As returning guests to Lyric@70Pine we were greatly surprised to see that the hotel had redecorated the rooms. A nice “welcome” card was a nice touch.
In January 2019 we enjoyed already the luxury of the spacious rooms and the wonderful service. Seeing the new decoration of the room we felt like returning home. The room is not only redecorated but also new furniture has been added.
The daily service, for kitchen, bed and bathroom, works perfectly. Just like the very friendly service of the reception staff. Any question, any reservation, everything was arranged immediately. I surely recommend the Lyric@70Pine.

title: Unbelievable space
text: The room was incredible. Such fantastic interior design, a comfortable couch/seating, and even a full kitchen. There's even a record player (which I didn't actually use). I will certainly be staying here again on future trips.

title: Birthday Bonus!
text: The Lyric Hotel is AMAZING! The property simply takes your breath away from the Beautiful Art Deco building to the minute you hit the front desk. I was greeted by genuinely kind people. Rob took care of everything and made sure my stay was seamless. He picked a lovely large room for the perfect birthday experience! It was great, the bed is comfortable, the art is striking, the box, water, record player, music selection, the towels, there isn’t a detail they haven’t thought about! I will definitely stay again! It was the best birthday EVER!

title: A wonderful stay
text: Lyric at 70 Pine is an amazing hotel. The room is very spacious. It seems newly and tastefully renovated. It even comes with a Fellow coffee set, Rabbit bar set, and a Denon LP record player! What I appreciate the most about this hotel are the people working here--friendly, attentive, and just flat out cool. They really strive to make you feel at home and have a comfortable stay! Shout out to Louis and Kevin, who were super helpful in making my stay at the hotel a wonderful experience. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent hotel in New York
text:
I stayed at the Lyric in May 2019 so when I decided to return in January, I booked to stay at the Lyric without any hesitation. The reasons for staying at the Lyric are multiple. Let’s start with the value proposition. You get a full kitchen with a very comfortable and large room with a comfortable bed, loads of storage space, funky records with a turntable a well as welcome chocolates and chips. There are also bath robes, a good sized bathroom and a daily room service. I also appreciated the friendliness of the staff who went out of their way to make sure that my stay was comfortable. For example, when the TV streaming service was not working, they quickly moved me to another room. There is also a laundry with a large number of washers and driers which work efficiently. 
If you like Art Deco, the Lyric is located in a magnificent 1930s skyscraper. The foyer has been restored to one of the most stunning Art Deco designs that I have seen. The elevators are fast and reliable. Also, if you like great coffee, there is a fantastic cafe just off the foyer called the Black Fox with coffee which matches a Melbourne cafe experience. Friendly staff and a convenient location ensured that this was my daily place for breakfast. The Lyric is also located close to the Wall Street and Fulton Street subway stations as well as easy access to the 9/11 memorial and museum and Westfield and Century 21 shopping precincts. Overall great value for money and a hotel that will be make your New York stay an enjoyable experience.

title: Perfetto per NY!
text:
Struttura meravigliosa, camera al 6^ piano con un grandissimo openspace, cucina modera e letto comodissimo.
Seconda camera con letto alla francese e bagno tutto bianco, molto curato, con prodotti per il corpo e saponi di ogni tipo.
Lyric è vicinissimo alla metro, comodo per ogni tipo di spostamento.
Lo consiglio a tutti, comprese le famiglie. Noi eravamo due adulti e 3 bambini (13, 15 e 1 anno), ci siamo trovati veramente bene.

title: Birthday weekend
text: The Lyric apartment is immaculately clean, spacious, well stocked with extra towels, robes and chocolate, plus freshly ground coffee and traditional as well as more exotic tea. The staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful. The apartment is cleaned daily. We like being  away from mid-town. There are numerous terrific restaurants within walking distance that are half the price of restaurants uptown. During the weekends the immediate neighborhood feels residential, with lots of parents walking children along with the ubiquitous dog walkers. It is easy to take the subway and be mid-down in less than 30 minutes. Its hard to imagine staying at a hotel after staying at 70 Pine Street

title: The best hotel experience in NYC thus far
text:
Rooms are phenomenal and I love every detail about the design and attention to details, and I must say I love every aspect of it. 

 The team at the desk is just wonderful.

A special shout-out to Ariel from the front desk, she was on top of everything and made the stay even more amazing.

title: Already planning my next trip
text: I recently spent a couple of nights in the deluxe studio with my mum and sister and we were each equally impressed with lyric. The room was modern, spacious, elegant and clean...you could have stayed there all day. The bed was super comfy....almost too comfy, and the pull-out couch was great. You really felt like you were in your own little apartment and we absolutely loved it. We can’t wait to come back.

title: 50th birthday
text: Visited this hotel early Dec after a 7 night stay in Miami to celebrate my 50th birthday. We were here for 4 nights and wanted to be here for the Xmas lights. There's only one word to describe this hotel AMAZING it's beyond anything we expected. The rooms are so spacious it was like our very own apartment, we could have lived there. The staff are fantastic sorry we only got the name of Robert but he was brilliant and really funny, but all the staff we met were really helpful and couldn't do enough for you. It's close to the subway,although we only used it a couple of times as we both like walking and wanted to see as much as we could in the short time we were there. It's close to Brooklyn bridge, the staton island ferry, wall street, 911 memorial and stones street which had lovely bars and restraunts all was within easy walking distance. There's a food market practically next door where you can get more or less anything,one night we were tired after a full day's walking round we called and got a hot chicken, baguette and rice and a few beers (you need photo id to purchase alcohol) and took it up to the room, we had a lovely dining table to eat at and a big comfy setee to chill and watch telly,there was even a record player with a selection of records to listen to. The bed was huge and so comfy, we had 2 bathrooms and a walk in closet with a safe and plenty of drawer and hanging space. We had a full kitchen with an island and even a dish washer, we didn't want to leave. I would definitely stay here again, so much nicer than being on Times square, we loved it and the surrounding area it was perfect in every way.

title: NY in Dec 19
text: We enjoyed our visit to NY and the stay at the Lyric provided excellent access to the subway for visits midtown and uptown. There was also lots to do downtown. Staff were helpful and the facilities were excellent.

title: Lyric 70 and pine NYC
text: Room was so spacious, clean and modern. Loved that toiletries were not in single use containers. Loved the french press coffee maker and record player. Staff was great,especially Robert. Anytime we called for anything they were at our door in 2 minutes. Wonderful place for a family of 5 in the big city!! Felt like home instead of hotel room. Can not wait to stay again.

title: Wonderful staff & great stay
text: We were so pleased & appreciative of Lyric’s excellent staff -their friendliness & aim to serve attitude enhanced our stay greatly.  Kevin, Louis, Ariel & Gabrielle were very nice & professional.  Thanks to Louis who took time to give us a tour of their different room types.  We enjoyed our two nights stay so much that we’ve already booked for our next visit in March.  Our apartment is spacious ( a rarity for NY city), clean & comfortable.  Location is great -far from the touristy area.  Subway, many good restaurants & shops are nearby.

title: Great place to feel at home on the road.
text: Spacious and comfortable, with all the amenities you need. The turntable for music is a great touch. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I will return and plan to try one of their offerings in other cities!

title: Bestes Hotel in New York City
text:
Das Hotel ist in einer super Lage. Das Team ist unglaublich hilfsbereit und macht den Aufenthalt in New York perfekt. 

Die Zimmer sind super sauber, schön eingerichtet und hat alles was man braucht und noch viel mehr. Die Küche ist rundet das Zimmer ab. Hier kann man mal schnell Ewas kochen. Im Gebäude findet man noch zwei tolle Restaurants und ein geniales Cafe. Hier findet man das beste Essen und einen guten Cafe. 

Großes Lob verdient sich echt das Team, vor allem Claritza, Ariel und Kevin!

title: Unlike any hotel you’ve ever seen, especially in nyc!
text:
Wow! The building, the rooms, the amenities, the staff, all of it was fantastic and unique. 

The rooms are huge, like 3x a normal New York hotel room. They’re super thoughtfully decorated, with nice touches like a great coffee & tea setup in the unit, record players with local artists’ records included, and of course, a full kitchen.

It’s  awesome especially on a longer stay to be able to make an egg in the morning or heat up some takeout vs having to go out for everything.

Thank you Lyric!

title: A week in NYC
text: So much can be said about the Lyric at 70 Pine. There are so many positives about staying here. It starts at check in, everyone was so professional, informative and helpful. They great you with a smile and explain in detail everything you need to know about the facilities as well as getting settled in to your room. Once you open the door and enter your HUGE apartment style room you’ll know you made the right choice for accommodations. The rooms are the closest thing to feeling like being at home I’ve ever experienced. Clean, spacious and comfortable. The kitchens are fully stocked with everything you need. They have goodies, coffee, tea, water and snacks waiting for you free of additional charges. There is an abundant amount of closet space in each unit, including multiple dressers for all of your personal items. We personally loved the white noise machine for drowning out the very little city noise when trying to sleep. Speaking of sleep, the beds are some of the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in. Every night of sleep was the best night of sleep in my life. The location of the hotel is perfect In my opinion. Just far enough away from downtown to feel like you’re able to wind down from the fast pace of the city. There is a subway stop directly across the street, so you can literally jump on one train and be at any of the numerous popular city spots in a matter of 5-20 minutes. There is a grocery store on site and numerous food options within a minute or less walk. The 9/11 memorial and many other popular attractions are within a half mile or 10 minute walk away. Also, if you pack lite or are there for a extended amount of time, it’s very nice to be able to do laundry on facility. Again, there’s a million things that can be said for this place. Not one being negative in my opinion. We enjoyed our stay very much and 100% will be staying at the Lyric every time we visit New York!

title: Fantastic place.
text: From the reception desk to the size and quality of the rooms, this is my preferred place to stay in lower Manhattan.  The ambiance is great, location is perfect and there is a grocery store and top class restaurant in the building.

title: Hip stay for older folks
text: We loved having vinyl records and a turntable in our room- a throwback to our younger years.  We also loved the pour over coffee maker.  Really, everything was fantastic.   We’ll be back for our next romantic weekend in NYC.

title: Amazing
text:
This apartment/hotel was worth the money. The staff are helpful and you get complimentary water at the reception and other goodies in the room. Everything was great the beds especially the sofá bed and pillows are immaculate and so comfortable. The front desk are efficient and helpful over the phone and the cleaning staff are great, always helpful and clean the room when you want it cleaned. The location is right opposite wall street station (the entrance to this station is sometimes closed) but is local to several other subways. It always a walking distance from fulton centre where there’s loads of affordable places to eat considering it being in the financial district such as chic-fil-a.

Lastly, the building is very nice and and safe place to stay in general. I would highly recommend this hotel as it was quite spacious and had nice features such as the painting and the vinyl set along with the white noise player 

Trendy, Medium Priced and greatly located

Only downside I would say is to provide a dish rack. I don’t really use dishwashers and there was no place to dry dishes that were hand washed.! 

Loved it

title: Truly a home away from home
text: If your image of NYC hotel rooms is of small rooms in cookie cutter chain properties, then the Lyric will blow your mind. Housed in a classic downtown skyscraper (once the third tallest building in New York), it is the perfect mix of classy art deco of old and modern amenities. These aren't just rooms, they are truly apartments, perfect for a stay of one night or one month. Until a few years ago I had lived in Manhattan and I can tell you that my recent room was larger than my last studio apartment. The full kitchen, ample closet space, sound system, premium (free) snacks, and thankfully plenty of electrical and USB outlets will make you feel like you are staying at a friend's place. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. The location is right in the middle of plenty of dining options and access to transportation, but the room was quiet. There is also onsite fitness and recreational options. I can't wait to stay again.

title: ”Serendipity” finding something beautiful without looking for it.
text:
Lyric at 70 pine is an experience apart, a different approach to a hotel in fact, I probably need to make up a different category for them, because the word hotel doesn't do justice. 
First they welcome you honestly with a friendly lovely spirit that makes you feel like you have known the forever. They make checking-in easy relax and offer you a list of things to do around the city such as restaurants and fun entertainment. The look of the lobby/office is a unique Boho style but modern is that a thing? The entire place has a vibe. The room or suite is compact but well planned, a real place to sit to work to eat and to relax. Did I mention there was a record player on the shelf? Box water, chips and cookies let's not forget the coffee and everything you need in the kitchen like utensils etc.. 
Minibar to create your own cocktails of course alcohol bottles would have to be ask for to room service. 
The bed wow! I call the room with the most positive possible connotations a sleep cave. At night dark quiet, just a glow from the mineral lamp, mattress a cosy sheets, marvelous bolster pillows. On both of my trips, I enjoyed a wonderful night’s sleep and the feeling of being away like an overnight vacation especially in the city that never sleeps hahaha I was surprised. In the morning the fresh smell of coffee with amazing taste to start the day with cool ideas recommend by our favorite host Claritza who has made me Love coming to New York for spontaneous adventures. Can't wait to come back. 
Thank you so much Clatitza and Kati’s for the amazing hospitality.

title: Serious amount of SPACE for NYC
text: We couldn't believe this awesome space was ours for our trip to NYC. We had been so used to a shoebox for our visits we thought there must have been a mistake. This was a family trip with teenagers for a Xmas visit to shop and eat and 'sightsee', so having the extra space to spread out was amazing, and the extra bathroom was a bit of heaven! we also played records and used the coffee and tea making facilities every day! The staff were lovely and the location was good. We took a couple of Uber rides when we wanted to head up town and this worked fine. The seaport area was a good area for wandering around with good places to eat and some good local interest, and a short walk to wall street for some xmas lights ! We will be staying at Lyric again, for longer next time, maybe in the summer. You can't beat the beautiful living space!

title: Weekend Stay
text: I had a great time during my 3 day stay, I was accommodated greatly by Claritza as she made sure my girlfriend and I were well taken care of. She even suggested restaurants and places that we should visit. Safe to say I'll be coming back here on our next visit!

title: Hidden Gem!! Your new home away from home
text:
My experience here was wonderful! Everything was so seamless from the moment I got off the subway. (which was conveniently located right across the street from the hotel.) The hotel is right in the heart of the financial district. It’s near so many restaurants, bars, and places to shop. Anything you could want or need is only a few steps away. I was also pleased to find out that the 70 Pine Building itself not only holds the Lyric Hotel but a few other establishments including Crown Shy, a beautiful restaurant where we rang in the new year. 

Customer service was also impeccable, I was greeted by Claritza with a warm and friendly smile as she checked us into our room and gave us some tips on what to do around the city. 

Once we finally got to our room I could easily say that I was impressed. Although there were so many things that I could have done outside,I really wanted to just take some time to enjoy the room. This wasn’t your typical NYC hotel room. It was too cool to just drop off your bags and come back later. It was so inviting! The room was spacious, clean, and sleek but some how also still kept it’s warm and cozy essence. (Like my imaginary home away from home) I LOVED the full kitchen and other amenities that came with the room. You could tell there was so much thought put into even the smallest details, which I greatly appreciated. Without a doubt, I can see more Lyric stays in my future!

title: Discrétion et efficacité.
text:
Au cœur de Wall Street, dans la rue Line, rue bordée de building en tout genre. Accès à pied au métro Wall Street et à Quelques mètres de la station Fulton street. 
A quelques pas de du mémorial du 11 septembre et donc de la World Trade Center. Nombreux magasins, century21 et autres. 
A 500 mètres de l embarcadère pour la statue de la liberté, battery park et autres destinations. Héliport à proximité. 
Immeuble typique Art Deco 1932, superbe, immeuble le plus haut de Wall Street avant la construction de l’empire state building.

Pont de Brooklyn accessible en 20 minutes à pied. Traversée du pont à faire absolument. 
East river accessible à pied à 10 minutes avec une jolie promenade « verte » qui doit être encore plus agréable au printemps. 

Au printemps 2020 ouvrira un roof top... à suivre. 

Un supermarché à l angle de la rue permet de faire ses courses. Nombreux restaurants au alentour du fast food au restaurant plus haut de gamme.
Accueil sympathique, efficace et discret.
Appartement neuf, fonctionnel et grand. Service de ménage discret et efficace. 
Attention c’est Wall Street, immeubles serrés, la vue est quasiment nulle, de plus les appartements sont répartis du 1eme au 5eme étage.

title: Stay Here!! You won’t regret it!
text: This hotel is such a hidden gem! It’s steps away from the seaport right in the heart of the financial district. I stayed with a few friends in October and it was such a great weekend get away! The rooms have a modern clean feel, and the room was huge! The entire staff was amazing all very helpful and assisted with all different questions and recommendations. Stay here!! You won’t regret it.

title: Worth Every Penny!
text: I stayed over Labor Day weekend, decided to have a staycation in the city and this hotel was perfect! The location was great, the rooms were spacious, the beds were comfortable and the full kitchen was a huge plus. The entire staff was friendly and so helpful. Definitely looking forward to my next staycation here!

title: Spacious, Modern, Cozy Experience
text: My wife and I stayed over for New Year’s Eve into New Year’s Day  and  we were very impressed. The room was very spacious, the layout was very clean and modern, bed was very comfortable and the amenities were great. Having a full kitchen is a nice detail to have when you’re trying to be cost effective on food or you’d just like to make little stovetop snacks throughout your stay. We were also able to ring in the New Year  at Crown Shy which is a full restaurant with a bar that is located within the building.  That added an extra level of convenience for us. My wife and I will definitely be returning for future stays and will also be recommending a stay there to friends and family. A special thanks to Claritza for being so helpful and polite during our stay especially in helping us figure out last minute plans.

title: A Wonderful Experience!
text: Everything about Lyric at 70 Pine is beautifully thought out and designed - the service, amenities, and rooms are beautiful, comfortable, and the staff is at the top of its game. The Lyric is housed in a landmark building, and the room itself was luxurious and an incredible value. I live in Brooklyn, and this was a lovely overnight getaway that recharged my batteries and sparked my creativity. And the neighborhood, from Wall Street, the Freedom Tower, and the South Street Seaport show you the old New York, where it all began. We will definitely be back to Lyric, and soon. I want to live there!

title: Great Hotel
text: The room decor was very modern and everything was super clean. I really appreciate all the amenities. Claritza was super helpful during my stay. I'd definitely go back just because of her amazing customer service.

title: Really great hotel
text: Really great hotel, and special thanks to Katie, She was extremely helpful during all my staying, including giving me options of special places in NY, and even helping me with an embarrassing situation I had, She was extremely cute and friendly. The Hotel has also great rooms, there was space for everything, the service was fast for everything I needed including a helicopter flight. It’s nice to see places where people still care about doing a great job and not only do the necessary. Next time in NY, I am probably staying at Lyric again. Thank you for all the people envolved.

title: Great suite, great location
text:
The staff was wonderful and the suite was huge.  Easy walk to the 2-3, 4-5, and J-Z lines.  A great place to see the city, including the neat stuff outside of Midtown.  Beautiful Art Deco building and lobby with very modern rooms.

The kitchenette las large, and there is a city market downstairs.

title: Absolutely amazing place to stay, great location and phenomenal staff!
text: We stayed in the Studio Apartment. Great room space, small kitchen area with everything you could need, fridge/freezer/cooker/microwave/coffee maker. Free wifi which stays connected through the stay without having to keep putting in the password like some hotels.  The front desk staff were amazing, JP and Robert helped us on a daily basis! The Lyric is in a great location, a 2 minute walk from Wall Street subway, 10 minutes from Battery Park and the 9/11 memorial. We will definitely stay again on our visit to New York

title: GREAT hotel!
text: I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly. It's essentially a studio apartment, beautifully appointed, lots of room.  We booked two rooms (family -- with teen and college-age kids), and could huddle around a kitchen counter before heading out for the night. We were spending time downtown for 9-11 museum, Freedom Tower, Revolutionary War tour, and Tenement Museum visit.  Perfect.

title: Fantastic stay in the heart of FiDi!
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with Lyric! From the service, location proximity, and staff, it was an all around amazing visit. The hotel has a wonderful modern feel, and allows a good balance of comfort and luxury. The staff including Robert, helped us feel more than at home. With all of our inquiries came floods of information about the surrounding areas, recommendations, and more! I will certainly be staying again! They help’d with some adjustments to the room prior to our arrival to help make a birthday even more special for my significant other, and I couldn’t more thankful. 

Thanks again team!

title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else
text: This was my second stay here, the first with my family and we had such an awesome time. With kids in tow, it was great to be so close loads of subway options and have enough space for everyone with all the modern facilities you need. Being a short ride away from the craziness of.Times Square over Christmas was perfect for us as there are loads of fab restaurants and supermarkets a stones throw from the  hotel. My husband said the bed was like sleeping on a fluffy cloud. If we are lucky enough to go back to NYC again, we wouldn't stay anywhere else - loved it!

title: NYC personal apartment
text: Booked lyric just to spend the night after going out with my friends. Had some people over for drinks before hand and it felt like I was hosting at my own apartment. The room is so spacious, and is decorated to perfection. Robert at the front desk was so sweet and told us everything we needed to know before getting upstairs. Lyric will always be my top choice!

title: Gorgeous building, amazing location, beautiful room!
text:
From the warm welcome at checkin to the fresh welcoming room when we opened our room door, I knew  I’d  be sad to leave. The king bed was comfortable and cosy! Yes - a king bed was cosy! I must have a cup of coffee upon waking up and the lovely kitchen with coffee maker a few steps away made my day!
Another great benefit of staying here is the subway exactly 2 mins across the street and the amazing Seaport 2 blocks away. New York at your feet from this location!

title: Family holiday vacation in NYC
text: Staying at the Lyric hotel far exceeded our expectations. We were intentionally looking for a hotel that was not in the Times Square area to avoid large crowds, but still convenient to everything and Lyric was perfect. It provided easy access to 4 or 5 metro lines which made getting around the city very easy. It is only a 10 minute walk to the 9/11 Memorial and One World Observatory, the ferry to see Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty, and walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge. The hotel is very spacious, which was a big positive for a family of four. Plenty of closet space and a separate sleeping area for the kids on the pull-out couch. It has a full kitchen, which we took full advantage of, making our breakfasts in the hotel room before heading out for the day. We even decided to stay in on Christmas Eve and cook a gourmet dinner with fresh pasta and sauce we had purchased at Rafetto's in Greenwich Village. This will definitely be our "go-to" hotel in NYC from now on.

title: Great location, beautiful decor, incredible staff
text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Lyric in one of the creative suites and we didn't want to leave! We loved the quiet location and the close proximity to the subway. The hotel has great amenities and there are several places to shop near by for any necessities. The decor was exactly our style, and the record player in the room was an extra special touch. The staff was friendly and very helpful! We can't wait to go back again.

title: Excellent service in beautiful art deco building.
text: Lyric is a well- maintained property with expansive living spaces and friendly, helpful staff.  My husband and I stayed here for a couple's vacation and found the amenities to be excellent.  There was a nice breakfast delivery to the room included with our stay.   This property is literally one block from a subway entrance and located in the financial district.   Neighborhood was quiet at night, especially for New York City, but just a few subway stops from most popular sites in Manhattan.  Staff were always willing to help and gave us several great suggestions.  Will be back with the family on our next New York trip.

title: Great spot
text: Lovely large apt. Close to subway. Several good take out or eat in options within minutes, one even in building itself as is a good coffee shop. Walking distance to westfields shopping centre. Reception staff professional, friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

title: Beautiful hotel and amazing staff!
text: The hotel room was beautiful. The size of the room was huge and the decor was amazing which is hard to find in a New York City hotel. This hotel room did not disappoint. The service was unbelievable and Robert was especially helpful and went above and beyond. I recommend this hotel.

title: Rob was awesome! Great place in NY.
text: Lyric was a great place to stay at. Newly remodeled. Stylish/apartment room. Rob at the front desk was super friendly. He recommended cool brunch places to eat at. He also recommended Crown Shy which is right in the hotel. The food was amazing! Overall, our experience was great! Definitely will stay here again!

title: Great spot, great service
text: Lyric hotel is a nice hybrid of a apartment / hotel. The style of the hotel reminds me of The Standard or Ace, with the features of a nice Airbnb. Location is near a Wall St / World Trade Center. Staff was great. The gym, bowling lane, golf simulator, and theatre room in the basement are nice features.

title: The Lyric is THE best place to stay
text: I can’t imagine a better place to stay Thanksgiving week in NYC!  It offered all the amenities imagined and more!  Having the full Kitchen available to cook a few family traditions along with the city market grocery, Crown Shy restaurant and Black Fox Coffee shop was the cherry on top!  We will be staying at the Lyric for all NY trips in the future!

title: Sometimes you just make a mistake
text: I was in NYC on business and booked my room at Lyric ,70 Pine street on line a very easy process. When I went to check in I had only booked for one night , I thought I had booked two nights. The hotel was full and I was not sure where I was going to stay on the next night. Understanding my dilemma, the staff moved some things around and were accommodate me. No questions asked they were very polite and professional explaining all the new amenities of the hotel. I would highly recommend Lyric to anyone I town on business or pleasure.

title: In the beginning, it was better
text:
During our last stay, the level of service worsened.
- WiFi:
 it’s easier to say that it didn't continuously work than vice versa
 - Lighting:
 There is not enough lighting in the room.
 Previous times we had a room on high floors, perhaps there is more light penetrating through the windows.
 Now, on the third floor, the lighting was very lacking.
 Need to add some floor lights.
 - Housekeeping:
 No one comes until you call yourself; we threw out the trash on our own.
 But, on the day of departure, the cleaning lady, from 8 a.m., repeatedly knocked on the door (not only for us but also for our neighbors)
 and went further down the corridor.

We like your hotel, but these little things are very unpleasant.

title: Thanksgiving Week at the Lyric New York
text: My family of 2 adults and 2 teens stayed in a 2bed/2bath suite at the Lyric on Pine Street near Wall Street instead of taking our chances in an unknown Airbnb.  What a great decision we made!  On previous trips we always stayed midtown or Soho which can be noisy at night but this location is super quiet so everyone was well rested.  The Wall Street subway is opposite and several other subway stations are close by so you are well connected to the rest of Manhattan. Only 10 minutes to Union Square and 20 minutes to Midtown. A really well stocked supermarket is downstairs open until midnight, coffee shop, restaurants, pharmacy and liquor store are also close by.  The Suite was well appointed with super comfy beds, a very well equipped kitchen, comfy lounge and plenty of closet space. Washer/drier and dishwasher made our stay so easy.  There is also an excellent gym downstairs.  We will definitely be staying at the Lyric on Pine during our next visit to NY in 2020.

title: So much room
text: Our room was perfect. We had the 1 room plus 2 bath. We had our adult son with us and only stayed one night. There was so much space. They made up the pull out couch for my son and it was great for one night. We each had our own full bathroom to get ready in the morning. It had a full kitchen which would have been wonderful if we were staying longer. We enjoyed the turntable in the room. The space was incredible for Nyc. Would be great for an extended stay.

title: wonderful all around place to stay
text: only here for one night but would definitely return. deluxe suite was very roomy with all you needed, plus with supermarket and deli on lower level, you really don't have to leave. staff was AMAZING, helpful, thoughtful, and polite

title: Thanksgiving 2019
text: We loved Lyric! Every aspect  of our stay was perfect. The decor of the room was so stylish, the cleanliness of the room met my high standards and the staff's customer service exceeded our expectations. We would like to especially thank Robert,Kevin ,Gab , Hector and Claritza for their assistance during our stay.  They were friendly and made our first time at Lyric comfortable. We will definitely  choose  Lyric again!

title: Unbelievable find!
text: This hotel was absolutely amazing! Gorgeous, brand new, classy, sparkling clean, and extremely large. That would all be great, but the amazing thing is the price! Can't say enough! Excellent customer service as well.

title: Nice Hotel in the Financial District
text: I loved the place, location was perfect. The staff awesome. Room satisfied our needs. I love having access to a refrigerator and microwave when we are away. The only issue; the fire alarm went off one day at 5am. We had to rush and get clothed rather quickly and leave the room. No one apologized and I was surprised at the events. However, a nice hotel overall. And yes, I would stay here again.

title: Perfect
text: Excellent location; rooms are very comfortable and offer many amenities you would not typically expect in a big city hotlel room such as a fully functional and stocked kitchen plates glasses pota and pans - the works. We will defintely be staying at Lyric again.

title: Great location, fabulous service
text: Enjoyed staying at Lyric.  Amazing rooms, quiet evening hours.  Great location downtown.  It’s great having the market located in the same building to buy food. The kitchen is very large and the bed was very comfortable. Also, create artwork throughout the hotel and a great selection of vinyl music in each room.

title: Ideal
text: After lots of research decided to try Lyric due to the extra room compared to other New York hotels! Rooms are designed very good as well as being practical with everything we needed and more! Rooms very clean as well, no hesitation in using again. Nice touches with the local brewed coffee etc! Staff always friendly. Location good for nearby subway stations also handy for ferry used if for a trip to Dumbo.

title: Work trip to nyc
text: My stay felt surprisingly more like a high-end hotel stay then what I originally planned. The room was extremely spacious and thoughtfully decorated. There were free treats on my arrival and I had the option to order food. While I was out, someone came to do basic servicing of my bathroom, which was a pleasant surprise. Additionally, having a 24 hour help center located in the building was an enhanced level of service that I was not expecting. I was wow-ed on possibly every front.

title: Like a stylish NYC apartment!
text: Couldn’t have been more impressed with Lyric! The room was as chic and as spacious as an apartment, had great little touches like a record player and Malik + Goetz toiletries. But most of all, the service was fantastic. I left my bag in my room and Kati personally returned it to me. I’ll definitely be back!

title: Great place to stay
text: It’s first time for me staying here & it was great. The staff were welcoming, helpful, attentive & always acknowledged you when passing. I was there for round xx of my bday celebrations & it became a running joke. it was the longest bday celebrations ever. the staff would wish me everyday for the week I was there. Rooms were fab, comfy & spacious. Very quiet. Conveniently located. Highly recommend.

title: Best experience at Lyric
text: Very friendly front desk. The rooms were very specious and very clean. Everything in this hotel is amazing; the bed, well equipped kitchen, nice large fridge and very nice spacious bathroom. Very nice location.

title: Perfect for Families
text: I looked at all the traditional hotel options in NYC and none could properly accommodate my family with three kids. Lyric offered something no where else could....an extremely comfortable 2 bed / 2 bath unit with spacious living area and an amazing kitchen with all the bells and whistles. The rooms were expertly cleaned each day and the staff was very friendly and helpful with making plans for my young kids. A great gym with everything you need is available for guests, a great coffee shop (Black Fox Coffee) and one of the best new restaurants in NYC (Crown Shy) is located in the lobby.

title: Excellent séjour
text: Habitués au Radisson, nous avons opté pour le Lyric, appart'hôtel (studio deluxe 60 m2). Cette établissement est merveilleux (amazing! ) : accueil, propreté, qualité du lit, du linge de bain, du matériel de cuisine, discrétion du service d'entretien ....Le personnel, très gentiment,  s'est demené pour recontacter le shuttle qui nous avait oublié pour la liaison vers l'aéroport  ( agence go airlink à fuir). Bref, tout était parfait jusqu'aux vinyles proposés - un choix très new-yorkais.  À conseiller fortement !

title: A great base for short or longer stay in NY
text:
We loved Lyric for its classic design features and amenities. The hotel occupies several floors in a recently converted Art Deco building in the finance district. 
Great sense of space with high ceilings, good lighting, big windows and in addition to a fully equipped kitchen, a nice  touch of a record player and half a dozen NY themed records in our room. 
It’s styled for short or long stay with access to gym, laundry and cafe on site. There’s an excellent supermarket in the next street with an eye watering array of choices if you prefer to eat in. 
Convenient subway access to a choice of lines is on the doorstep. 
We would happily stay at Lyric on a return visit to New York

title: Love the Lyric
text: I was amazed by my stay at the Lyric.  The deluxe studio was incredibly large by New York standards.  The decor was great, plus the room had a full kitchen with an island big enough for 3 stools.  The coolest item was a turntable with several vinyl records.  I was traveling with an adult son who had been a DJ.  He loved the selections and enjoyed playing the records. The hotel was very quiet, which is a real plus in a place like New York. I have often stayed in Manhattan and even in 4 star hotels found the street noise very annoying at night. The staff was friendly and helpful. I fractured a tooth during my stay.  The staff referred me to a dentist a block away who saw me right away.  The dentist patched up the crack which allowed me to finish my trip and get home for a permanent treatment.  Boxed water is free.  There is a market in the basement with a few vendors and a big selection of food items.  The building has a high end restaurant, a great coffee shop and a healthy fast casual restaurant.  Up the street is a deli that opens early for breakfast.  There is a subway stop across the street and other lines are nearby.  It is in the FiDi, but it’s a short subway or ride share ride to the Village, Times Square and Central Park, walking distance to Soho.  My son and I were both very impressed and we plan to stay here on our next trip to NYC. Highly recommended!

title: Wow!
text: I just have to say this place is amazing to stay. The suite & environment was great! Shot out to the staff especially, Rob, Gabriel, Claritza, Kati & JP. You guys are the best staff! Thank you a lot!!

title: Short stay, but a lasting impression
text: I have stayed at 70 pine before, but this was the first time with lyric! The staff was exceptional, as usual, from check-in to check-out. JP, Hector and Claritza were so friendly when I arrived. The best feature in the new rooms is the record player, I loved the variety of artist. Some of the records weren’t in the right album sleeve, but I was able to figure it out. Robert & Gabby made sure everything was perfect with my stay and was able to store my luggage until I had to leave for the airport. Highly recommendable!

title: Excellente adresse
text:
Je confirme les autres critiques positives publiées ici, qui m'ont décidé à choisir cet hébergement dont je me réjouis. Grande qualité de toute la prestation (lit un peu trop mou peut-être). La version DeLuxe 2 sdb est parfaite pour 3 : deux adultes dans la grande chambre (qui dispose d'un grand placar, d'un dressing et d'une salle de bain) pendant que l'enfant dort dans le canapé convertible du salon, où il y a une cuisine toute équipée, un coin salle à manger et une autre sdb.
Tout est neuf, classe, accueillant et chaleureux. Œuvres d'art sur les murs, platine disque à dispo, café, thé et capsule lave-vaisselle fournis chaque jour.
Les rares défauts sont confirmés aussi : absence de vue puisque bas étage d'une toute petite rue et bruits de circulation. Mais les mousses sont aussi fournies !
Proximité de Broadway, de Battery Park et de nombreuses stations de métro, une supérette en bas au coin ouverte de 7 h à minuit, une pharmacie/supérette à 3 mn, ouverte 24/7. C'est vraiment parfait.

title: Warmth and comfort in Wall Street
text: The concierge staff is hospitable, attentive, and professional. Checking in and out is efficient and they respond to questions and requests promptly. The room is inviting, spacious, and well-appointed, with excellent storage. The bath has real, high-quality mirrored cabinets and ample hot water. The pour-over coffee setup is a welcome detail, and levels above the typical hotel pod or instant experience. There’s also an excellent coffee shop in the building, with Starbucks and Dunkin mere steps away. Our room has no direct sunlight, but what can one expect on the third floor amidst Wall Street towers. The building is an art deco gem, minutes from multiple transit stations. The neighborhood is not chock-a-block with tourists—the burgeoning residential presence is evident from people walking their dogs and shopping in the small markets. Midtown is an easy subway ride, day and night. Crown Shy's presence in 70 Pine, a few steps from the Lyric concierge, is a plus. It’s food and ambience are first rate (it was awarded a Michelin star days before our visit) and felt like part of the Lyric experience. That’s fortuitous for Lyric guests, but as Branch Rickey said, luck is the residue of hard work and design. Considerable work has gone into these units, and it shows.

title: Best hotel ever
text: Stayed for a week. Best hotel I have ever stayed in.  Why?  Because of the careful thought that went into the design and layout of the room, the lighting, the linens, the Kanto sound system (!), the Chemex-style coffee brewing setup with real coffee, the kitchen amenities (granite countertops), the practical furniture, the photographic art, and the hardwood floors. The Dieter Rams/Braun industrial design book on the chairside table signals that the Lyric design team is thinking like no other hotel design team anywhere.  Housed in a beautiful early deco office building. I never want to stay anywhere else.

title: Most amazing stay in nyc!
text: This place was out of this world beautiful! We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite with full kitchen, dining area, living area, and lounge area AND 2 bathrooms. The service was great and check in was a very easy! We even got complementary champagne! Parking was very cheap if you get your tickets validated at the front desk. Btw the building is absolutely gorgeous! So close to many restaurants and stores. Stay here if you ever get the chance!

title: The hospitality was outstanding.
text: First and foremost I want to personally thank Rob and Katie for all the first class kindness and amazing hospitality that was given to me during my stay. They were super helpful and gave us an jaw dropping upgrade and shared amazing tips about where to wine and dine around the city. I was blown away by the size of the room, it was beautiful, I want to even live in that suite forever. The building amenities and the location was just perfect. I will most definitely recommend staying here to all of my closest and dearest friends, and I will also personally stay here in the future, and Katie exhibits first class hospitality, she is the best.

title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in
text: Kati helped check me and my boyfriend in! We were early, but they were able to hold our luggage and Kati texted me when the room was ready. We were absolutely blown away by the room and how sweet and helpful Kati was. Everything about the suite was incredible. I can't express how much me and my boyfriend enjoyed staying here and this will be the place we stay when we visit New York again. We were able to take a couple umbrellas when we were checking out as it was raining and was just a nice finish to a lovely hotel. Thank you so much for the awesome room and for the warmth Kati showed us!

title: A Treat
text: We were so happy to have found this gem.  What a relief to have room to spread out and get comfortable.  We discovered  many thoughtful and unexpected touches during our stay, such as ear plugs (not needed), multiple coffee and tea options in the kitchen, and a white noise machine.  We felt welcomed, pampered, and cared for.

title: Outstanding Property!
text: Great service! Awesome room! Perfect location! Good deal! I feel like I should not tell the inter-webs about how fantastic this hotel is. I want to keep this little jewel to myself. Thanks guys! Please do not attempt to meet our character minimum by using repeated characters to fill the space. Include helpful details about your experience to complete your review.

title: Amazing experience
text: This place is really worth recommending. Great location, spacious, modern apartments. Loved the vinyls in the room. Much better than regular hotel rooms especially if you travel in a larger group. Will definitely stay again!

title: Wow!
text: We loved, loved, loved our 3 day stay at the Lyric! Our room was spacious, fresh and trendy. Special shout-out to JP and Kevin for their help, suggestions and assistance (especially with our stuffed and very giant giraffe). This will be our go-to place to stay whenever in New York.

title: Very good, but ....
text:
We booked this place earlier in the year under its previous name.  The location is definitely just what we wanted (a subway station is almost directly opposite) and the historic nature of the building was outstanding.  The refurbished room we were checked into, also met all of our expectations regarding style and size.  It was an apartment style large room with a full kitchen (including a dishwasher), excellent storage and a bathroom that had a shower above a bath tub.  The extra high shower head was certainly appreciated by my partner who is very tall.  We stayed for over 6 nights, so the ability to unpack and place items in the storage behind the bathroom mirror was great.  

The bed was nice and large and very comfortable.  The service on check-in was friendly and helpful and we got great support from the front desk when we had to use the laundry next door due to renovations on level 6.  Housekeeping was very good too.  They tidied our room each day and cleared out the dishwasher every time we used it, which was really nice.  Other conveniences in the room included a safe for our valuables and a SMART TV.   

The only two issues that were not great were the awful internet connectivity and the horrendously noisy rubbish trucks that came overnight (usually around 3am and then again around 5am).  Our room was facing Cedar Street and this may not be a problem for those whose rooms face Pine street, but trust me, despite double glazing, the noise in the street overnight to remove all the waste left for collection was awful. It was so loud that on two nights it woke us up and we were not able to get to sleep again as the trucks cleared the almost 15 waste bins and piles of waste bags.    

As we were on holiday, the internet connectivity was not such a big deal, but our devices kept dropping out of the wireless connection - so we were not able to do much.  It was probably the worst internet connection I have had in a long while.

title: Great and Spacious
text: I prefer the midtown area, but hotel rooms are expensive and tiny.  Lyric has spacious, clean, cool rooms which are easy to relax in.  Close to the subway, easy to grab a taxi, and a great area to walk around and explore.  Stayed here 5 nights and would definitely return.

title: Wonderful NYC surprise
text:
Absolutely beautiful stay. The room could easily accommodate a small family with comfort and space. A full kitchen, dining table for 4-6, spacious and quite "cool". 
I wouldnt mind living there! 
2 blocks to subway and a great coffee shop in the beautiful deco bldg. The bldg itself is to die for. Great stay.

title: Excellent experience
text: We stayed for 3 nights in October. The rooms was larger than expected. It was recently remodeled and very well appointed. The hotel staff was very accommodating. The hotel definitely exceeded my expectations.

title: Excellent stay
text: The hotel room was large, beautifully decorated, and clean. The staff super nice. The location was also pretty good, not far from the subway. Not sure if there were any hotel amenities (I honestly didn't even look). Overall an excellent stay.

title: AWESOME BIRTHDAY STAY!!!!!!!
text: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed in Manhattan, it didn’t feel like a hotel more of a aesthetic millennial apartment. It was very stylish and spacious. The full kitchen and furniture gave a comfortable homelike feel. It included everything that was much need such as the modern coffee maker and dishwasher. I would highly recommend and stay there again as my to-go spot whenever I visit the Manhattan area. It’s suitable for any type of crowd! Love it…

title: Charming Modern Studo Hotel in the Heart of FiDi
text: Really loved having a studio apartment to settle into for a week long business trip in New York. The staff was incredibly helpful and welcoming. They ensured all my needs were met and offered their recommendations on where to dine, shop and tour. I could not have asked for a better stay and high recommend Lyric at 70 Pine for your New York travel

title: Great hotel in super location
text: Room was much bigger than we had expected and had all the amenities needed. We originally considered a hotel in central Manhattan however the Lyric is actually in a much better location. Easy walking distance from the many attractions in lower Manhattan. Brilliant grocery store on ground floor of building which includes great pizza outlet. Also plenty good quality food outlets just a couple on minutes. Very helpful and informative staff at front desk as well as super housekeeping service who even filled up and started dishwasher every day.

title: Best place to stay in NYC!
text:
Wow. An all around AMAZING experience staying at Lyric on Wall Street. 
As a frequent traveler who has stayed all over NYC, this experience was unparalleled. 

The check-in process was seamless, and the front desk staff was kind and responsive to any questions I had throughout my stay.

The rooms are 3-4x the size of a normal NYC hotel, at a comparable rate. Not only are they spacious, but also well furnished and beautifully designed. There is a full kitchen, and there is an option to have Lyric help stock the fridge!
The bathrooms are stocked with wonderful Malin + Goetz toiletries, and there are ample towels/linens in the massive closet. 
The room even came with a record player and a few records - what a nice touch!

The building has a wonderful gym, and a few food options ranging from fast casual to formal sit-down. There's also a market that can be accessed from the street level. No need to go anywhere else!

Public transit and Uber/Lyft are both very accessible. The 2,3, 4,5, and R,W are easily walkable, and Ubers have no issue coming up to the curb by the property entrance. 

This is my new go-to place to stay in NY. I'll definitely be back!

title: Gym on Wall Street!!!
text: A gym on Wall Street!! It’s always a pleasure to stay at this hotel. The staff are accommodating. They updated the rooms/apartments(even though it didn’t really need it). Would recommend for trips to NYC if you’re looking for a fully furnished apartment with amenities , away from Times Square crowds.

title: Excellent service
text: Clari and Kate looked after our needs on our arrival. We were upgraded for my birthday celebration, and surprised us with a nice bottle of red wine in our room. Clari made every effort to make sure we were happy with our room, by showing us alternatives to offer us a choice. The apartment was very clean, with full facilities for our weeks stay. Room sizes were big, with washing facilities on floor above. Great location.

title: Beautiful building and great amenities!
text: Room was spacious, very modern and up-to-date! Immediate response to any issues by staff - above and beyond service. Located just two blocks from Wall Street and the Pier. Easy walk to both areas where restaurants and bars were easily accessible! Top choice to stay here again next time we’re in New York!

title: A Great Weekend!
text: We stayed for the weekend to visit family living at 70 Pine and the accommodations were fantastic.  The room was spacious and comfortable and the staff couldn't have been nicer!  (We've since taken a vote and determined that this was the first of many visits to come!)  Great location for sightseeing and convenient to Penn Station.

title: Perfeito!
text: Ficamos nesse hotel em dezembro de 2018 e foi tudo absolutamente perfeito, exatamente como mostrado e descrito nas fotos e avaliações aqui do Tripadvisor. O quarto é enorme e o hotel todo bem novo, duas coisas difíceis de achar em Manhattan. Bem equipado e mt confortável, com um mercadinho maravilhoso logo na esquina, onde compramos itens de café da manhã e algumas sopinhas prontas (deliciosas!) em dias que estávamos mt cansados dos passeios do dia para encarar um restaurante à noite. Adoramos a localização no Financial District! Fica um pouco afastado do burburinho de Mid Manhattan, mas mt perto de mtas atrações - dá para ir à pé à Estátua da Liberdade, à Ponte do Brooklin, e à região do World Trade Center. E para quem gosta de esticar a caminhada, como nós, dá para chegar em vários outros bairros à pé tb. Para se chegar às atrações mais distantes, há uma estação de metrô do outro lado da rua do hotel, é só atravessar. Essa estação pertinho, a Wall Street, fecha cedo e daí, voltando mais tarde, vc tem de descer numa estação mais distante e caminhar. Como nós amamos caminhar, não foi um problema e a região é muito segura, mesmo de madrugada. O quarto é um pouco escuro durante o dia, como dito em algumas avaliações, mas não nos incomodou - faz parte do clima de Manhattan e tb ficamos pouquíssimo tempo nele durante o dia. Cama maravilhosa, chuveiro maravilhoso, mt espaço, bom gosto, conforto e funcionários educados e mt solícitos - super recomendo!

title: Amazing experience!
text: The room is absolutely amazing, the decor, the details were so pretty and up to date, the bed was very comfortable and also was the sofa bed, the amenities in the room were delicious and the record player was so cool we listened to music all day, everything was perfect. Big thanks to Kati for her kindness and always very helpful when we needed anything. The location of the hotel is extremely good, in front of the 2 and 3 station so you can go to dumbo our times square, it is also walking distance to many tourist areas.

title: Lovely hotel!
text: We stayed here for 10 nights. We chose this hotel because it has a kitchen and so we would be able to cook some nights and have breakfast at home to make our stay a little cheaper. The room was huge, clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly. The hotel is in the financial district so you have to catch the subway to get to the times square area but we didn't mind that and the area is well connected for subway lines. The only negative is that the bin lorry comes at 1am for a while but we got used to it and it's New York, I didn't expect it to be quiet outside! All in all fab stay, would stay again!

title: Wonderful home away from home!
text: My husband and I stayed 6 nights at the Lyric this month and we just loved the beautiful property. We were upgraded to a spotless apartment that was comfortable, beautifully appointed, and included a fully operational kitchen. There's a beautiful gym in the basement, a market around the corner, and all manner of restaurants within walking distance. The 2, 3 subway line is across the street, and the Fulton Subway Center, with all the major lines, is a few blocks away. The Art Deco building at 70 Pine is iconic and was even highlighted on the AIA led architectural tour we took while in NYC. The property is located downtown, near Wall Street, where we prefer to stay to be away from the big tourist properties. Shout out to the front desk staff who could not have been more helpful. Looking forward to returning for a few weeks in the Spring.

title: Truly everything you need for NYC visit
text: Hands down one of the BEST places EVER!!! Check in was quick and very pleasant, the room was spacious and modern, the front desk was extremely quick and responsive to any questions or requests, restaurants and stores everywhere nearby AND the 2,3 express subway was across the street and the 4,5 express was up the street!  This place was INCREDIBLE. Worth every cent and we will 100% be back. It deserves more than 5 stars.THANK YOU LYRIC!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: On arriving the check in was very professional and happy smiling faces, the room was fabulous very clean in fact spotless and what’s more very large, a massive bed and a large smart Tv, there was a big kitchen with all the amenities, large fridge/freezer, dishwasher, microwave etc large bathroom even dressing gowns also a good safe, all in all brilliant. Nice location near Brooklyn bridge, Staten Island ferry, bronze bull, south Manhattan is a better part of NY, Times Square is looking a bit tired and tacky, we got the M15 bus up to Central Park and walked down to the Lyric only$2.75 cents better than $45 taxis. The bus terminal is outside Staten Island ferry you need to put money on a metro card no cash on busses. From JFK we got the AirTrain to Jamaica central then onto Wall Street, $7.75cents if there is 4 adults then the$70 + tip is ok but 1 or 2 adults take the train. Hope this review helps.

title: Lyric Hotel, where have you been all my life
text: As an elite member of the Marriott and Starwoods borg collective, it is rate that I venture into uncharted waters. Boy am I glad I did so in my recent trip to New York. The Lyric staff was very friendly, the rooms are like a tastefully modern and efficient studio apartment, there was a nice set of treats, and I appreciated the pour over coffee. I'm sure if I tried hard enough I might be able to think of one or two things that can be better (but honestly I tried to make this a balanced review but couldn't think of anything). Please do consider this in your next personal or business trip. Long live boutique hotels like Lyric.

title: PERFECT
text:
We booked our 12 night stay over a year ago in a studio apartment.  After a 3 hour wait getting through customs at JFK we arrived at Lyric possible not in the best of moods.  We were welcomed by Kati and JP (was lovely to see happy faces and have a friendly welcome I must say) who advised us because we were staying for 12 nights we had been upgraded to a two bedroom apartment.  Wowzer the apartment was amazing and our moods immediately changed "New York here we come!"
This was our first time in New York and I had researched beforehand where to stay and was a little apprehensive to if I had chosen right as a-lot of people tend to book the Times Square area.  I was 100% spot on booking Lyric the apartment had everything we needed was super spacious in fact square footage I'm sure it was the same as our house at home, plus the actually building is beautiful inside and out.  The area where the Lyric is is brilliant, subway across the road, grocery stores (also one in the same building) and places to eat nearby.  A short walk from the Seaport area which is absolutely lovely to just chill out in an evening.  I have already recommended the Lyric to friends and family.  "Who wants to stop in Times Square when you have the Lyric? not me 100% you get that real feeling of living as a New Yorker and not a tourist.  Thank you to guys for a perfect vacation. If I had to mention one downside to staying at the Lyric it would be that we had to come home :( .

title: was upgraded which was a fab surprise
text: great grocery store in the ground floor, gym in the basement, business center on the 3rd floor  and restaurant in the building - everything you need. I arrived at midnight but 5 am local time to me (UK) - reception staff super friendly and helpful

title: Long weekend in NYC
text: We stayed at the Lyric in August 2019, 4 of us stayed in 2 studio appartments which provided everything we needed. The location is great with easy access to the underground system, 9/11, Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park. The only minor negative was the noise from rubbish collection and air con unit but minor issues hence 4 out of 5. Would stay again and recommend to others, amazing break in NYC

title: Modern Luxury
text: Amazing! Very well accommodated modern look. Definitely be back. I live in New York and all I wanted to do that weekend was to do something different - so I did. Very happy with it. I highly recommend Lyric.

title: Perfect solution
text: Next door to Ground Zero and Financial District, 20 min walk to the Village and 20-30 min subway to mid/uptown. This makes this hotel very convenient for enjoying NYC. Room in mint condition, very comfortable being much roomy than most hotels, with a fully equipped kitchen. First class solutions for breakfast and dinner are next door as well. Attentive staff, competitive pricing. Very well!

title: As a loyal and returning guest I was upgraded to the studio plus - I was also granted a late check out due to a canceled
text: I love going to the Lyric, formerly known as Q&A - and return on a regular basis. Service is good and staff is friendly and hospitable. The building recently added a restaurant, flower shop and salad bar. The coffee shop serves the best coffee in NY - I love Lyric as it provides a home away from home, spacious rooms, kitchen, dining and lounge area. Downsides are the noisy AC, dark studios (hey this is NY), and maintenance and tidiness of the accommodation could go up a notch. I also noticed a recent increase in price, as well as no deals or packages on offer. It will be interesting to see how Lyric's standard, pricing and offering will evolve over time.

title: Amazing Stay
text: JP was an awesome host and our stay was top notch. Close proximity to downtown on a very quiet street. Room had all of the necessary amenities and more.Square footage not to be beat for a luxury NYC accommodation.

title: Why stay anywhere else?
text:
I frequently take staycations, so I've stayed at a handful of great hotels in a city of countless options. Lyric is by far the best that I've come across so far. 

Not only is it affordable but the rooms are MASSIVE. If you plan on being in NYC for an extended period, then look no further. These are essentially repurposed residential units, with fully equipped kitchen, a turntable, little "personal" touches like books, white noise machine, etc. 

I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the staff. They're always incredibly welcoming and friendly. 

As for the location, it may appear to be a little removed but it's incredibly convenient if you're going to be spending a lot of time in Lower Manhattan. Brooklyn is just a short subway ride away, and you can grab almost any subway line close by to visit other parts of Manhattan. There's a great coffee shop right next door, a market around the block, a liquor store down the lock, and lots of places of places to eat within walking distance.

title: Assolutamente fantastico
text: Hotel con stanze grandissime. Personale eccellente di una gentilezza imbarazzante. Lo consigliamo vivamente per la pulizia e la cordialità ricevuta. Un ringraziamento particolare a Katiuscia e Clarissa della reception per come ci hanno letteralmente coccolati. Grazie grazie mille ancora e torneremo da voi. Grande Lyric

title: PERFECTA OPCIÓN
text: La experiencia fue muy buena, la zona tranquila y con muchos servicios. Me sentí mas cómoda que cuando estuvimos alojados en pleno Times Square, que tardaba más tiempo sólo en poder cruzar la calle. Cuando empiezas a manejarte bien con el metro resulta muy cómodo.

title: Hidden Gem - Central location
text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. upon arrival, they upgraded me to a 2 bedrooms suite. The apartment is so nice and huge. It is also centrally located and I can walk to different attractions such as 911 museum, Statue of Liberty and Wall Street. On top of that, it is only USD210 per night. I will definitely stay here when I come back to New York.

title: Amazing hotel experience
text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August, the service was outstanding and the rooms were immaculate. Would highly recommend staying here if in New York! Receptionists Katie and JP were extremely helpful and kind to top everything off.

title: Perfeita estadia
text: Ótima estadia! Atendimento, hospitalidade dos funcionários, estrutura do hotel.. impecável! Super recomendo :) sem contar a localização, que também ajudou muito nos dias que eu estava hospedada! Voltarei

title: When you like the name and it turns out great
text:
I book a stay in this hotel because I liked the name . Then I liked the style of the hotel – neutral colors, a lot of white, rather cold, but I have the taste for that. The rooms are spacious. They are furnished like apartments and have kitchens and sitting areas. Kinda remind me of a hotel in Norway. 
It has a gym and a good restaurant, too. I might give them a separate review. 
The location is great if you’re in the finance business. There are a lot of museums around, too. And it’s near a subway, which makes it perfect for a business visit. 
The prices are reasonable, even underpriced, compared to the quality they’re providing.

title: Perfect start to our holiday.
text:
From checking in at the Lyric our stay was wonderful. The room we had was huge and had everything and more to make our stay comfortable. The Lyric staff were all genuinely friendly and helpful. New York is an amazing city and the New Yorkers are proud of their wonderful city and rightly so. I
I would hurry back to the Lyric and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends and family.
Thank you Lyric staff for helping make our stay in NYC so memorable!

title: Sleek, Soothing and Satisfying
text: Absolutely stay at the Lyric.  It is amazing.  The rooms are large, comfortable and well appointed.  Each room (so far - on my third stay), has had a sitting room, real kitchen and dining space and bedroom.  The rooms are modern yet comfortable.  It's located in the heart of the Financial District (and a block from my New York City office, so very very convenient).  The front desk team is personable and recognized me (the Cheers Norm feeling is awesome).  Cannot say enough about hospitality has returned to the hotel industry, and is found at the Lyric.

title: Spectacular
text: My wife and twenty year old son stayed at Lyric for a long summer weekend in the executive studio and were literally stunned by how fabulous, spacious, and beautiful our room/apartment was. For the price we paid to be in this spectacular hotel, in a wonderful NYC location, it was unquestionably the best value hotel stay we've ever had.  As magnificent as the accommodations were, the best part of our stay was actually our check in where we were fortunate enough to meet Gabby who was so incredibly nice, thoughtful, and helpful.  There are a lot of impressive things in NYC - Gabby and the Lyric are two of the best!

title: AMAZING
text:
This place is Airbnb prices, with the quality of an Ace Hotel...but with a kitchenette and laundry. And a killer record player with local rock star LPs.

Great coffee downstair with Black Fox -- and easy access to the Subway.

title: AMAZINGGG!!!
text: Omg this place was amazing! They took such great care of me and my husband for our four year anniversary!!! Even upgraded us to an executive suite ! I mean the accommodations were just nothing short of amazing. My babe was so surprised. Everything was so clean. They even have vinyls in the room!!!

title: Hidden Gem
text: We had a superb stay at Lyric. I normally stay at the Conrad in BPC for my business trips. But this time I was coming for a wedding with my wife and wanted to try somewhere new. The rooms are huge, and the lobby has such character. There are plenty of food options right in the lobby and even have a full grocery store which is super convince. The Wall Street location made it a quick walk to the south street seaport and with the east river ferry’s we were able to get to dumbo in no time. Robert at the Front Desk was amazing! He helped us with directions and never got annoyed with any of our little questions.

title: Found my Manhattan Base
text: Recently, I stayed at a large chain hotel in Manhattan that was poor at best. So, I did some research and found Lyric 70 @ Pine. This apartment unit hotel met all my expectations.  Huge rooms. Well appointed for extended stays with decent kitchens. Access to many nearby markets, restaurants, etc. Good fitness facilities.  Friendly and helpful staff. I can go on, but need not. All I have to say is that I have to be in Manhattan on and off over the next couple of years and Lyric will be me home each time.

title: Last minute booking
text:
We booked this when it was called Q&A for a last minute trip. We chose it due to the larger rooms and apartment feel and got exactly that. The room was quiet for NYC and we loved the financial district area. Short walk to the 9/11 memorial and subway. There is a great pub/restaurant opposite and a supermarket below for any grocery needs. The coffee place below the apartments within 70 Pine was quirky but an extortionate hipster type place and rather budget breaking for a regular caffeine fix...! There are plenty of other coffee shops only a short walk away.
Staff on reception were helpful and lovely. 
The building is a stunning Art Deco sky scraper and I adored the deco feel to the lobby and elevators. The cleaning of the rooms could do with better checking by management but fine for a short trip.
I would stay here again.

title: Exceptional stay
text:
We stayed 5 nights over the Easter weekend - when the hotel was still called Q&A Residential, before its rebirth. It was a wonderful choice for us - spacious, modern, sleek and well-equipped. When visiting NYC we always tend to stay in the Financial District or Soho/Tribeca in order to avoid the tourist madness elsewhere. Lyric is ideal because it's really quiet yet the Wall Street subway is right there and you can be in Times Square in no time at all via an express train. Plus you can walk to so many places of interest from the hotel. The TKTS South Street theatre ticket booth is literally 5 minutes' walk away. There's also a pretty good deli/grocery store underneath the hotel. We had relatively little interaction with the friendly staff but that's a good indicator of a successful stay I'd say. 

I highly recommend Lyric and hope to return.

title: 2 weeks in New York
text:
My husband and I visited New York for 2 weeks. Lyric gave you a good service. Staff were nice and helpful. The hotel was situated in downtown which gave us a quiet timr at night and during weekends. 

We stayed in one bedroom with 2 bathrooms type. The room was big (100m2). Full kitchen and well-equipped, although we rarely used the kitchen. Comfortable sofa at the living room. One office. Very comfortable and big sized bed. However, there was no separation between a bathtub and a shower. We had to stand in a bathtub for showering.

The other thing that could be the inferior part was the front which had no space to park the car, even for temporary parking. You had to hurry getting off the car, or else the car behind you had to wait.

Anyway, we both felt comfortable staying here. Next visit in NYC, Lyric will be one of our choices.

title: Fireworks @ Lyric
text: Celebrated my birthday/4th of July weekend with Lyric and I was very impressed. The lobby captures your eye immediatley with the vinatge art-deco. The rooms are spotless, and very very large. I had trouble finding dinner reservations for the night of the 4th, but Robert was able to pull a few strings for me and was able to get me reservations at Manhatta. Gio and Kati did an amazing job in coordinating a surprise amenity with my daughter for my birthday! To summarize, Lyric is a top notch hotel and is highly recommendable!

title: My new favorite hotel
text: I came in with a bad attitude and low expectations and I was pleasantly shocked- I had an attitude about an "extended stay" hotel and was bummed it was far from my office.  Add on to that, after flying in from California for a work trip, that I was already nervous for, my luggage got lost.  From the moment I walked into the hotel I was impressed - the architecture is lovely and the "room" I was in was actually a 2 bedroom suite with a full kitchen, sizable living room, and a washer dryer! As nice as the accommodations are, every staff member I interacted with was exceptional.  Before even checking in, Rob found a store nearby and made sure I was able to make it there and get clothes for my business meeting before the store closed at 11 pm. When I called for my customary 2 wake up calls, another Robert offered me a knock on the door - a first for me- not to mention the extra laundry soap, water, and umbrella loan. My luggage drama extended over much of my stay and JP was patient with my repeated calls and called as soon as my bag arrived.  He and Gio made sure that I had the latest checkout they could manage, gave me dinner recommendations, tips for the airport, and more.  The staff here is truly exceptional - the best service I have ever had at a hotel - the staff here made me feel welcomed and taken care of - without any phoniness or pretense.  I will be requesting this hotel for all of my NYC visits to come.

title: Amazing stay in the Financial District!
text: Lyric exceeded all expectations upon arrival! Our trip began with exemplary service from the staff upon accommodating us for our early check-in. Robert took our bags although we were a bit early and took them to room for us prior to the room being ready! He advised us of several locations to visit on our wait and stay to help indulge in the NYC Lifestyle. We were seemingly pleased with the local Pier 17 and South Street Seaport areas. The hotels placement was essential as it made our traveling prompt, with local access to the subway around the corner and a brief walk to both the Wall Street Ferry and Staten Island Ferry. We were able to knock out all of our tourist adventures without hassle! The hotel is immaculately clean, and has a pleasant genius theme/mantra that is appealing and relevant. The staff is heads over heels better than any other staff I've come across. For anyone looking for the NYC experience in a clean and quiet area look no further! Thanks again Lyric.

title: WoW
text:
A very nice hotel in New York. very close to subway and ferry.
The room was great. 
And a big thank to Vanica and Katie who decorated our room very nicely to start our honeymoon.
Very good service and friendly staff.
We would like to come back again

THANKS SOOOO MUCH!!!!

Regards Swinten & Corina

title: My NYC Getaway!
text: Everywhere I travel, I compare my accommodations to Lyric formally known as Q&A. Lyric blows every hotel stay out of the water! Booking directly is a must! If they have a better room available for you, they’ll upgrade you! I traveled w/ my mom who is handicap, & they had a wheelchair for us to use & we were given a wonderful 2 bdrm with 2 bathrooms to make things so much easier! We stayed for 9 nights!
