The full kitchen was definitely helpful for meals and dishes with a toddler.  The location was fantastic as well. Very close to subways and walking distance to anything you might need.

title: A great NYC hotel
text: This was my second stay in this fabulous hotel. The most spacious and clean hotel, within the price range, in NYC.  The staff are very helpful and polite, the location is close to transport and a stroll to the river. Highly recommended!

title: Excelente!
text:
Reservei com base unicamente nas avaliações aqui do site e valeu a pena.
A região é ótima (elegante, segura, bonita, de ótimo acesso e longe daquela muvuca infernal de midtown); não trocaria por nenhuma outra região que conheci.
A cama de casal é enorme, porém minha filha de 9 anos dormiu 8 noites no sofá que foi confortável mas não é sofá cama.
Utensílios de cozinha ótimos. Atendentes também muito gentis.
O café da manhã grátis é um café, leite, chás e chocolate em pó. Não servem mais coisas p comer.
Super recomendo.

title: Uncommon find in NYC, spacious room and great staff
text:
We stayed for 3 days while my wife was getting medical treatment. We stayed in a beautiful 1 bedroom 2 bath unit, it had a full kitchen and a foyer. Plenty of room for my wife's wheel chair. Staff was very friendly and helped us with our bags to and from our car. Big thanks to JP, you rock bro!

Lots of nice touches, like a bose bluetooth speaker in the room.

Couple of things to remember. If you sign into your netflix or Amazon prime on the TV's, make sure to sign out before you leave. We had access to a French Family's netfilx account. Also if you're driving in, you need to put two tires up on the curb to unload  your car or you will block traffic on the narrow Pine Street entrance.

title: Rooms are huge and beautifully furnished. Amazing staff!!
text:
My family and I stayed at Q & A hotel over the weekend. The staff welcomed us and made u feel at home. The check in process was seamless.
The rooms are massive and beautifully furnished with comfortable beds. 
We had an amazing hotel experience and we will definitely be back again!
Highly recommended!
 Many thanks to JP, Marshall, Hector, and Alex

title: Best beds and pillows in Poland!
text: When I reflect on my yrip, the first thing that comes to mind are the plush pillows  and very comfortable beds.Rooms are on smaller side nut cozy  and clean. Wow. Cute hotel and nice staff only willing to help. Overall we enjoyed our stay  and the breakfast  was also good with variety. Wroclaw  has the most beautiful  old town which one could  spend days exploring. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: Top !
text:
Appart hôtel près de Wall Street, le métro est en face ! 
L’appart est moderne avec tout le nécessaire : frigo, congélateur, four, micro-ondes, ...
La literie est très bonne également !
Une épicerie juste derrière et tout autour de quoi se restaurer.
J’y retournerai !!!

title: Good location in beautiful Art Deco building
text: Stayed  in a studio on lower (4th)floor.  No view. Room very clean and well appointed but bed was very (too) firm.  Staff was not customer oriented which made it difficult to get information....room was not ready on time.  Did not receive instructions on wi-fi or using tv remote.  Found no instructions in room or other tourist info including not learning until I left that there is a supermarket in the basement.  No recommendations on dining either.  Since most happenings in NYC are in midtown, Times Square or near Central Park, if you are a tourist,  I don’t recommend staying in this area.  Commuting 3-4 miles doesn’t sound like much until you meet NYC traffic and experience 10 min miles in a car.  I commuted north every day (tho subway is convenient ).  I do love the architecture of this building.

title: Roomy, comfortable, fully appointed
text:
This was a great hotel experience.
After a very long flight, Marshall on the front desk was super helpful and managed to co-ordinate an early check in for me. The room was really spacious and clean.  Everything worked, the bed was comfortable, air conditioning not too noisy, there were places to work on a laptop, wireless connection was fine.  I would have liked a bit more bench space in the bathroom if I was being really picky.
The room has a full kitchen and there is a decent small supermarket in the same building to stock up on food. 
Short walk to subway stations.
All in all it was a pleasure to come home to my room each day.
An effortless checkout completed a great experience.

title: Surprising Parking Trouble
text: I would like to start off by saying I love QA Hotel, my girlfriend discovered this gem almost as soon as it opened a few years ago.  Since, we have been to this hotel at least 8-10 times. I have had zero complaints , up until now.  Last week Thursday, we made a reservation for one night ( Thursday - Friday).  The smaller concern, the remote did not exactly work , going through regular TV channels was perfect but when attempting to switch to the smart TV features the remote simply would not work.  Now over to my bigger concern, as we were getting ready to check out I got my parking ticket validated by concierge and noticed that it was no longer a stamp but a sticker, I thought nothing of it.  We get to IconParking on S William St., The manager explains to us 1: they have never been affiliated with the hotel (not true) 2 :they could not give us a discount because the sticker was different.  We were puzzled and called QA while at IconParking, QA also confirmed they "NEVER" were affiliated with IconParking which is simply not valid, we have evidence of payment.  At this point i am beyond late for work and livid, the manager at IconParking then explains to us the new stamp says IParking* a very minute difference. QA then calls the manager at IconParking and relayed to him they did INDEED have an IconParking stamp, the manager then suggested we go back to QA to further sort this out and he could see what he could do for us.  Again, at this point we were fuming because of the lack of care and communication.  We get to QA the manager is already available to speak to us( which I appreciate), she then tells us that QA ended their affiliation with IconParking over a year ago.  1: that was the complete opposite of what we were told over the phone.  I would not have any problem with this (because I understand things change) except for the fact that i stayed at QA THIS February and received a stamp for IconParking, and received a discount at the same parking lot with zero problems.  I then asked, if the partnership ended over a year prior, why did we get a stamp for them this past February ?.  The manager simply said that they were still using the stamps for IconParking at that point and ( EVEN THOUGH THE PARTNERSHIP HAD ENDED) had just recently gotten rid of all the stamps..... Granted she did take the time to look for any stamps but I think the response was negligent and lacked tact .  She then apologized with no further assistance.  I at this point I was hoping there would be a further explanation rather than " We still used the stamp after we ended the partnership". This is confusing to customers and completely deterred my plans for work Friday morning.  Luckily, the manager at IconParking gave us a break and we received the discount anyway for our troubles ( so the 2 plus hour wait was not all for naught).  Again, this is not about the discount it is about the principle of the issue, I just think in this particular instance QA responded poorly with a sub-par explanation.  The parking situation should have been made more clear.  I love QA but this experience left a bitter taste in my mouth.  I have been coming here for years and I was just very very disappointed in how we were handled. I hope that this is the first and last time this incident occurs.

title: Great Service, well-appointed rooms, convenient location
text: Excellent service (though check-in took a bit longer than expected--but staff quickly accommodated the line).  Very friendly.  Front desk Staff "apologized" for giving me the only available room--a beautiful and spacious twp bedroom apartment.  The location was perfect for my meetings near battery park and across the street from a subway line which goes directly to times square. Good fitness center.  The hotel itself is within a larger building composed of apartments and condos--a bit confusing to enter at first, but not really an issue.  Highly recommended.

title: Excellent stay at a downtown location
text:
We had a great 5 night stay. The staff was exceptional, they were very nice and helpful.
The room was spacious and clean, looked just like the pictures. After a long day it was nice to come home to a spacious room and kitchen. The location was great, right across the street from the Wall Street subway station. Also much quieter at night then a midtown hotel. I also agree with the other reviewer that the owl in the bathroom is creepy, we checked to see if it was a hidden camera, or  maybe it’s to keep rodents away?! Also agree that the mood lighting is nice, but not practical for cosmetic application, etc. A full length mirror would also be helpful and a bath mat in the tub, it was slippery. We would definitely stay there again.

title: Propreté et service +++
so much room and so much storage
text: 3 adults stayed in a one bedroom with office, 2 bathroom for 10 nights during May. Put roll away bed in the office. Very roomy and beautiful apartment. Would definitely recommend staying here. 2 suggestions, the owl's in the bathroom's are a little creepy and the mood lighting although lovely, is not that practical when trying to read or send emails. Staff very friendly and helpful. Location great. Close to subway, deli's restaurants and liquor store.

title: What a gem! I'll stay here every time I'm in for business!
text: I found this hotel as a last minute booking during fleet week and I couldn't be more pleased with the accommodations. The room was stunning and much larger than most hotels I book in the wall street area. The room was really clean, the bed was comfortable, and I cannot say enough about how spacious the rooms are! I told all of my colleagues about this and we will all definitely be back in the future. The staff was very friendly and helpful, felt right at home. Thanks!

title: Great Place With Top Notch Service
text: We thought we were in trouble due to an overbooking issue when we arrived. But the management was incredibly classy and put us up in a nearby high class hotel, covered our costs there, and then welcomed us back for our last day. Great hospitable service. The room we got was what we expected a large, modern suite with a kitchen, firm large bed and a sitting area with a very large TV with every channel service you can imagine. The building is an historic art deco structure and the lobbt has been restored to display the best touches. Next to the Wall Street station this hotel is located next to everything via the subway. We will be back as there is an incredible amount to do and places to eat in this undiscovered area of NYC ( that is for tourist!).

title: Fabulous Fi Di
text:
After several visits to NYC we decided to stay down in the Financial District for a change of pace and what a pleasant surprise it was.
Running parallel to Wall Street and close to both Fulton and Wall Street subways this place is a gem. Spacious apartment with laundry facilities located in the building. Brand new and modern - galley kitchen very workable. 
After a hectic day uptown completing with the tourists this place was a pleasure to come home to.

Supermarket located underneath the building  - a little pricey. I would make the trip to Wholefoods and stock up - about a fifteen walk. Eatly; Century 21 are also close by.

The building is full of locals who are all friendly and happy to recommend local restaurants and bars of which there are a number to choose from. Head down to the shore-front which is only a ten minute walk and well worth visiting - we ate down there many times. 
Pier 15 is also close which is handy for the ferry as is the Brooklyn Bridge.

Q & A staff were extremely friendly and helpful - thank you for minding our large bags for few days whilst we visited DC. L'Occitane products and big fluffy towels in the bathroom were fabulous.

The only two negatives were the very soft pillows and the fact that in our room the AC unit whilst very effective was located behind our bed head and was a little noisy. Not sure if all rooms are designed like this but you may wish to ask. Earplugs solved the problem though and the many positives about this apartment far outweighed this small issue.The location itself was very quiet (we were on the 6th floor)

Thank you Q & A you made our week fabulous and we would happily stay with you next visit.

title: Great Experience
text:
I was pleasantly surprised how wonderful this hotel was!  I was there 4 nights earlier this month.  I felt like I was in my own studio apartment.  It was nice to have a full kitchen with all the tools I needed!  Great location, close to grocery store(s), restaurants, tours, businesses, etc.
The staff was awesome and took great care of me!  They even arranged transportation for me from the hotel to the Newark airport!

title: Wonderful Experience
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, we arrived few hours before check-in time so the staff took our luggage and bags so we could sightsee. This hotel is in great location, we walked to Century 21, Charging Bull, Fearless Girl , World Trade Center and Times Square. The hotel rooms are very modern, spacious and clean. It also has a walk-in closet, full kitchen and to top it all off... super friendly staff! This is definitely the hotel we are staying when we go back to NYC.

title: Mother's Day Weekend
text:
Hello

My name is Richard Terrell, me and my fiance' Pamela Mcclary stayed @the Q&A Residential Hotel this past weekend May 11th-13th 2018. 1st let me say this in Not a complaint nor disappointment email! The BEST Hotel Stay Ever!!!! Hands Down!!! The Staff!!! from Front Desk to Housekeeping were Amazing! Their professionalism, courtesy and friendliness was Outstanding!. My fiance' and I have been to many different hotels but Q&A is By far 5 🌟!! 

The safe in our room had some malfunctioning difficulties, which we deemed minute! The Staff was so professional and went the extra mile. Offering us another room because of the safe(which we declined)...they sent up a bottle of wine for the inconvience! 

My fiance' and I were headed out, for the night Saturday evening, unknown to us it was raining!. Front desk approached us, gave us a compliment, informed us of the rain, then brought us 2 umbrellas to use for the night's outing!
  
The room was Perfect! Housekeeping was Very pleasant, neat and courteous!

Your Staff should ALL be commended for an OUTSTANDING job! The hotel was just what We needed and was looking 4! All our needs and wants were met! ....We will be back!! Bringing our family and ENCOURAGING and RECOMMENDING our friends!!!!

title: Almost Perfect
text:
The Q&A Residential Hotel was my home away from home for two weeks recently while in NYC on business. The location was great - very easy walk to many attractions, shops, restaurants. I loved the high ceilings and spaciousness of the rooms. Having a fully outfitted kitchen was very nice and I used it often rather than eating out all the time. The City Acres Market just around the corner was very convenient to pick up grocery items (*tip - exit the market through the back door and you are in the basement of the building, just ride the elevator up to the main lobby and then walk to the hotel bank of elevators). The safe in the closet was spacious and held my laptop and other items with room to spare. I very much enjoyed having the Bose Bluetooth speaker in the room so I could stream music from my phone. I never heard any noise from my neighbors, just "city noise" from the street. 

Honestly the only thing that kept me from giving this property an excellent rating are a few items... first, and most important, were the staff.  It was really hit 'n miss with the staff.  Some were super helpful, pleasant and responsive, and others seemed like you had just really imposed on them for the simplest request and were very abrasive.  I found I had to call or email two or three times just to get the item I had requested, or issue addressed. (there is a feature in the Q&A app to submit requests, but I don't think it works, or the requests do not get passed along). Second, a few things that could have made the room better: a soap dish in the shower or someplace other than the corner of the tub to put things like soap, shampoo, razors, etc.  A full length mirror some place in the room. A better sofa, I found myself sitting on the ottoman if I wanted to watch TV as the sofa was very uncomfortable, and the TV wouldn't really turn so you could watch it from the bed. Finally, the laundry room - while the room itself was clean, the washers and dryers needed some attention, they were caked with "gunk" and needed a good cleaning.  Also $2.75 to wash and $2.75 to dry?!?!  Maybe I just haven't visited a public laundromat in awhile, but that seemed a little expensive to me.

All in all and great stay and I would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend to others, especially for long term stays.

title: Quoi de mieux?
text:
Séjour de 4 nuits dans un studio de 45-50m2. 5 eme etage. Le Quartier de wall street est un bon choix car c'est plus calme la nuit et il y a tout de même une bonne part des visites qui se passe dans le sud (brooklyn, liberty, heliport, WTC....). Dès l'arrivée on se sent bien dans le beau hall de cet immeuble, une des plus haute tour du sud de manhattan. L'accueil de l'hôtel est très moderne et agreable. Efficace! Arrivés dans l'appartement, on a été charmés par la décoration très moderne, l'espace, bref on se sent bien immediatement. Petit résumé des points forts :
- decoration et espace
- matériel à disposition (lave vaisselle avec doses à disposition, four, cafetiere, tous les couverts et ustensiles de cuisine, grand réfrigérateur / congelateur, ensemble hi-fi avec enceintes bose, cable et grand ecran)
- qualité de la literie et lit king size
- ambiance high-tech / moderne
- Rangements
- prises usb au mur pour recharger son téléphone et avec l'équipement disponible pas besoin d'adaptateur
- climatisation géniale à utiliser (mais bruyante au declenchement) 
- silence dans l'hôtel (car même au 5eme on entend bien le bruit de NY!), nous n'avons pas entendu de tout le séjour un bruit des chambres voisines! Quel confort!
- salle café
- station de metro en face et proximité des commerces

Pour s'améliorer quelques points tout de même :
- traces de frottement au mur c'est dommage (les gens sont tout de même peu soigneux!)
- traces le long du mur collé au lave vaisselle (à corriger) 
- ma lampe de chevet ne fonctionnait pas, j'ai laissé un mot le 1 er jour à l'housekeeping, cela n'a pas été corrigé.

Mais en bref si nous revenons à Manhattan la réservation de l'hôtel sera très très simple! De plus ce concept d'appart / hôtel est génial car c'est plaisant par exemple de rentrer déjeuner et se ressourcer le midi tout en ayant une prestation de ménage et réassort tous les jours ! Bref pour nous ce Q&A est juste parfait pour un sejour à NY!!!!!!

title: HUGE room, great kitchen at a reasonable price
text:
The Q and A is a block from the Wall Street Subway stop.  It can actually be reach taking a minimal number of stairs.  The building is very classy.  The reception was polite, courteous and welcoming.  But the surprise was the room size.  Though an executive studio, the alcove was almost 12x15 with 2 large walk-in closets.  A full (complete) kitchen which even had a dishwasher.

Master space had a king size bed of excellent quality.  Linens were first class for both the bed and bath.  It was a delightful stay and lovely hotel.

The neighborhood is big time Wall Street.  Enough places to eat and drink with a block or so.  We found a nice grocery a block away, and even the drug stores had a large variety of snack and beverages.

It is a little quiet on weekend nights, but we never felt uncomfortable walking there.

Would stay there again "in a New York minute."

title: Perfeito
text:
Ótimo hotel, na verdade um studio, cozinha completa, sofá, cama king com lençóis super macios, banheiro grande, toalhas de banho de ótima qualidade, enfim, tudo muito limpo e de bonito. Tem academia e lavanderia, que eu não usei. No terceiro andar é oferecido chá, café e leite todos os dias. Os atendentes são educadíssimos, o check-in e checkout são rápidos, guardam suas malas se você precisar, recebem encomendas sem custos adicionais. Chegamos às 8:00 da manhã e como o quarto estava disponível, já deixamos tudo lá, tomamos banho, e isso é ótimo porque te dá um outro ânimo. 
Na entrada ho hotel tem um café, ótimo para comer alguma coisa já de manhã, sem precisar procurar. A localização é ótima, no centro financeiro, há farmácias, Century 21, Eataly, o Touro de Wall Street, vários pubs, metrô em frente, é ótimo!

title: Great Place. Huge Rooms!
text: My son and I stayed here for the 5 Boro Bike Tour.  Upgrade to an Executive Studio and it was 800 sq ft.  For NYC, that is huge.  We were able to bring our bikes in the room as well.  Kitchen and everything you need.  No Room Service, but places all around to get food.  The price was right as well.  Great Value.

title: Huge rooms
text: Extremely large rooms, especially by NYC standards.  Very modern and clean, with full kitchen, including dishwasher.   The only reason not to stay here is you prefer a full service hotel, and this is more like serviced apartments.   Also, no real views from the room.

title: * * * * * * e poi nell' Album dei Ricordi
text:
il Q&A Residential è ormai nel mio album dei ricordi e di questo voglio ringraziare sia il Direttore sia il Personale tutto dell'Hotel. COMPLIMENTI,  BRAVI.
Poi, sapendo che questa recensione sara lettà prevalentemente da italiani, voglio spendere qualche parola e consigliarli.
Essendo al mio primo viaggio a New York ero molto preoccupato in quanto, avevo letto tante recensioni negative sulle strutture alberghiere di Manatthan, con stanze piccolissime, carissime e con servizi di scarsa qualità;  ebbene il Q&A ha confermato la saggezza del proverbio  "chi cerca,trova".
La zona, Financial District, non è turistica (nelle vicinanze "solo" il Brooklyn Bridge, il World Trade Center, Memorial 11 settembre, Museo degli Indiani, Wall Street, Battery Park -imbarco per Ellis island e Lady Liberty-), mi è piaciuta tanto e la consiglio vivamente.
L'albergo (se amate l'Art Decò  è quanto di meglio potreste desiderare) è  ospitato nello splendido American International Building, perfettamente restaurato e  con tanto di sbuff dalle griglie di aereazone (resi famosi da Marylin Monroe) vicino all'ingresso.
Fermate della metro a breve distanza,per andare ovunque (quella di Wall Street è ad appena 30 metri -non attiva nel fine settimana) ma passeggiare per Lower Manatthan è assai piacevole, ve lo assicuro.
Ill miniappartamento, moderno e pulto, ha poi armadi e deposito per  i bagagli; completo di cucina attrezzata,modernissima e funzionale, con tutte le stoviglie necessarie. Riassetto della camera e cambio degli asciugamani giornaliero; kit bagno Occitane En Provence.
La zona notte ha un letto enorme King size, comodissimo.
L'appartamento è servito da una rete WIFI, indispensabile per le comunicazioni con l'Italia,ottima e gratuita
Al 3^ piano sono a disposizione della clientela 2 pc, già predisposti per  il ceck in.
Nelle vicinanze al 101 di Liberty Street c'è Eataly Dowtown dove, con soli 5 dollari e 44 cent di tasse, avrete due ottimi espressi; a meno di 100 metre invece il City Acres Market, dove si trova tutto e,se non volete mettervi ai fornelli,  anche buonissimi piatti pronti.
Dimenticavo il prezzo: ottimo per quello che offre.
Vivamente consigliato.

title: Parfait
text: D’abord il faut dire que c’est chic et confortable. Très bien placé au cœur de Financial District avec 4 lignes de métro principales qui desservent uptown et Brooklyn. Nous avons été logés dans une suite avec deux chambres et un immense salon salle à manger cuisine. Très beau quartier à proximité de tout, et surtout au calme après des journées trépidantes de visite de cette ville autant démesurée que variée.

title: We will be repeat customers!
text: Q&A is a great find in the Wall Street area.  It has attractive art deco decor in the common areas.  The check in staff was helpful and friendly.  We had three family members sharing a room with a roll away bed.  The beds were comfortable and the bedding was crisp and comfortable.  It was great to have a kitchen, large closet, and wood floors.  The towels were plush and there were enough of them (unusual, especially in NYC).  The floorplan provided an easy way for three people to have privacy, wake up at different times, shower, and stay quite comfortably.                                                         I appreciated the encouragement to reuse towels, but if the hotel is serious about this it would helpful to install hooks.   Because the towels were large and plush and if a place were provided to hang them they would be easy to reuse.  However, I would suggest installing some hooks in the bath, hall or closet for guests to hang towels between use.  The Grohe hook on the bathroom door is attractive, but not very functional except for a hanger.  Towels slide right off.     Overall a great stay.

title: huge room with full kitchen
text: This was my second trip to NYC. This time we stayed at Q & A! Its a landmark that was built in 1932 and you can see all the old art deco in many places like the elevator or door arches. The place is so clean, quiet and staff professional. We loved it! There was so much room and we requested a blow up mattress that we put in the "office" section. Late check out available if you are a "member". The rooms have a full kitchen, an ice maker, hair dryer, coffee maker, a comfy king size bed, a small couch, a comfy chair with foot stool & 2 small tables with chairs. The best part though was we were within walking distance of Wall street, New York Stock Exchange, Statue of liberty, Sea Glass Carousel, One world Observatory, and 9/11 memorial & museum. (probably many other things too but we only had 4 days!) Outside the entrance to hotel is a subway station and many more on each corner. There is a Starbucks across the street, dunkin Donuts 2 doors up and a 24 hour Duane Reade a few doors up. Everything you need is just a short walk out the front door! By the end of this year they will have a 360 degree rooftop restaurant overlooking the harbor!

title: Brilliant stay and upgraded!
text:
My partner and I stayed at Q&A in December 2017 and we had a wonderful time. We got the subway from JFK to wall street and had no trouble finding the right building - even though we arrived late at night. 

When we checked in we got upgraded to a bigger straight away which was amazing! Our room was basically a huge apartment with a good sized bathroom (with a tub), kitchenette, walk in wardrobe, and biggest bed in the world. It had everything we could possibly have asked for and we enjoyed making breakfasts and meals for ourselves in our kitchenette!

There is a subway station really close to the Q&A building which will take you anywhere in NYC. We actually walked from midtown back to Q&A one evening which was a great way of seeing the city on foot - it took us about an hour to walk.

The only downside of staying in Q&A was the breakfast. There were some stale croissants, oranges, and bad coffee but that was about it. But I'm really not bothered about the breakfast - you don't go to New York just for the hotel breakfast!

I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

title: Huge room - very friendly staff
text: I was upgraded to a large one bedroom two bathroom suite. It was HUGE, and very clean. The staff, Alex, went out of his way to provide great customer service and to ensure I was pleased with the accommodation. It is located in a great spot and very convenient. Would recommend staying there.

title: Large rooms, good location, need soundproof windows
text:
I stayed here for 6 days for a work conference. I like the FIDI district and felt safe here as a woman alone. I liked the room size, cleanliness, bed comfort, amenities and kitchen. I would easily stay here again so the following 2 comments are my only negative experiences.
I was offered an upgrade but did not realize that with the larger size suite would also come being on the side of the room over the parking area for the garbage truck that would come and go all nite, compressing garbage. At 2 Am I requested another room and moved in the middle of the nite. Management wrote me a note and gave me candy for my trouble. I would suggest that a better option might be asking if you are heavy or light sleeper before the room upgrade offered and asking if the size of the room was more important than the noise factor. Since when I was checking in I reminded the clerk that I asked for a quiet room and he assured me that this was indeed a very quiet room, I was unhappy.
My second issure came the day I checked out. I was n the lobby with my suitcases and the clerk refused to call me a taxi. She stated that she could not order  a taxi ahead of time...but I was there at the time I needed one. She told me to go to Water St and hail one. I did so but thought it was ridiculous that a 70 year old woman was told to haul her own suitcases to Water st to hail a cab. Never stayed anywhere, even a restaurant that would not call me a cab. Please train your desk staff not to lie about the quiet of the room and to call a cab on the spot when a guest is waiting. Other than that I can live with it.

title: HUGE and trendy room downtown
text: I booked this room on HotelTonight for a one night business trip- my typical hotels in the area were full due to Tribeca film fest.  I received a great rate and was upgraded to a two bedroom suite.  I think this may be the biggest NYC hotel room I have ever stayed in! The room was trendy with nice details like fun lamps.  Two very small drawbacks were that while there was a coffee maker in the room there were no to-go cups and the bathroom had a creepy plastic owl decoration that looked like its purpose was to scare away mice (though I'm sure this isn't the case, it was just a tiny bit unnerving).

title: GREAT place and room but too noisy.
text: We selected this hotel based on the reviews. Eight  night stay! Great rooms, clean, modern and spacious.So the kitchen and bathroom. Unfortunately OUR ROOM was too noisy at night. We go to New York to enjoy the city: walk, go to Times Square at night, to the theater, restaurants , bars, tours, etc, etc and return to the hotel for a nice restful night. OUR ROOM was noisy well after midnight and from 4-5 am due to the trash being moved on the adjacent street. NO good insulation. Likely other rooms do not have this problem but be sure to check with the hotel. OTHER THAN THIS PROBLEM,  great location, very close subway, excellent bars and restaurants nearby.

title: Parfait !
text:
Une première visite à New York et forcément le choix d’un hôtel est difficile. 
Nous n’avons clairement pas été déçu de ce choix. 
- tres bien situé il permet de faire de nombreuses choses à pied et notamment les départ pour la statue de la liberté, One World Trade Center, seaport, le pont de Brooklyn, ....
- il est situé à quelques 10aines de mètres de la station de métro 2-3 mais aussi non loin de Fulton qui desservira bon nombre de vos escapades. 
- un petit supermarché (city Acres) est disponible aussi assez proche (mais pas d’accès direct contrairement à ce qui est indiqué)
- salle de sport 
- le matin, disponible au 3ème étage café, thé, lait et chocolat. Mais rien d’autre et notamment pas de viennoiseries. 
Il faudra déjeuner dans votre appartement ou au café situé dans l’immeuble (mais payant). 

Nous avions un studio de type « exécutive », pour 2 adultes et 3 enfants. 70 m2 avec cuisine équipée yc lave vaisselle et frigo et une énorme cuisinière, grillé pain et cafetière. 

Pour le café du matin des réassorts sont faits par les femmes de chambre mais pas systématiquement, on ne sait pas forcément pourquoi. Peut être des oublis, ce serait un des points à améliorer. (Tout comme la pastille de lave-vaisselle, parfois remplacée parfois non)

Idem pour le service de chambre, serviettes, peignoirs sont à disposition et changés relativement souvent, par contre les produits de type gel douche / gel cheveux ne le sont pas systématiquement (bizarre, alors qu’ils sont vides).  
Ce sont cependant des produits « l’occitane » ce qui est fort appréciable. 

Nous avions demandé un roll-away bed et cette demande a été respectée sans surcoût. 

Quand au bruit, il est effectivement présent (nous étions au 6e étage), mais c’est une particularité de la ville. Même en journée vous verrez que cette ville est extrême t bruyante: à croire que les New yorkais ne savent pas conduire sans klaxonner, parler sans crier, et les ambulances circuler sans leur klaxons. C’est comme ça c’est aussi ça New York. 

En tous cas aucun bruit des chambres voisines. 

Très bon equipment télé et hifi (enceinte Bose).

Bref à refaire on reviendrait ici dans les mêmes conditions. 
Cet appartement avait une vrai capacité à nous ressourcer le soir après une journée de balade. Et cet immeuble en lui même vous met clairement dans le bain par son architecture si typique (vous aurez même le loisir de le reconnaître au loin lors de vos visites... on le voit bien!)

title: Buenísimo!!!
text:
Al fin encontramos un lugar para sentirnos como en casa en NY. Las habitaciones son como apart hotel, tienen cocina completa con isla, microondas, heladera, lavavajillas, todo lo que te puedas imaginar para desayunar , comer y estar a gusto si lo prefieres en el hotel.
Está en un edificio antiguo precioso muy imponente de la zona de Wall Street, a donde 3 pisos son hotel y en el resto vive gente.
Las habitaciones espaciosas, modernas, super limpias, llenas de detalles para que no te falte nada. Desde bata hasta amenities de L´occitane.
Abajo hay una cafetería restó con mucha onda para desayunar o comer algo todo el día, y la zona está llena de restaurantes, markets, cafés, lo que busques. A una cuadra está la parada de metro.
Nos costó mucho decidir a donde parar porque todos van a la zona de times square pero los hoteles allá son o demasiado caros o demasiado viejos o demasiado pequeñas las habitaciones. 
Otro detalle es que llegamos a las 9 AM e hicieron lo imposible por darnos una habitación. Buen servicio del personal. 
Suerte que elegimos venir a Q&A!

title: A gem of a surprise and excellent stay!
text:
My husband and I have traveled to NYC many times, and because we know it's an expensive city with tiny rooms, we're always trying to find a best value hotel.  We discovered Q&A Residential Hotel through Travel Zoo, but we just signed up for their "Friends with Benefits" program and look forward to staying here again hopefully with rates just as good.  It's been a great place to stay as the rooms are new, VERY spacious (especially for NYC), clean.  

We had a very good check in process with Alex at the front desk, and because it's located in the Financial District, it's been quieter at night time.  We wanted to be close to Brooklyn as we were here to see our daughter's band, Khruangbin, play at the Music Hall in Williamsburg.  This hotel is conveniently located, and we took UberX or UberPool when we went to Brooklyn as well as uptown by Central Park.  

There's a great little coffee shop next door as well as several places to grab a bite to eat.  It's great having a full-size refrigerator and nice little kitchen.  Thus, even though we didn't cook, we had a great place to keep our fruit and water cold.

title: Me encanta
text:
Hemos estado 6 días allí y ha sido una elección perfecta. Desde el primer momento encantadores sobretodo Alex hablaba español y nos trato genial (10 para el) el hotel tiene de todo. Esta cerca de restaurantes,zona tranquila, hay un supermercado a la vuelta del hotel. Lavandería en la 6 planta.  Una estacion de metro frente al hotel. Y otras en nenos de 5 mn andando (importante con lo lioso del metro en new york).
Y un personal amable y eficiente. 
Lo recomiendo

title: Q & A Hotel at 70 Pine Street: A Lobby to Die For
text:
Great downtown location in a storied building, one of the kings of New York. Hotel blocks are from the sixth floor and below, which means natural light is at a premium; at that level, other buildings such as 80 Pine jut into the sky. You do get the opportunity to watch people in other office buildings, though. :) 

I've stayed here more than a few times, occupying two bedroom units all the way down to the entry level studios. Décor is consistent, though larger rooms offer greater amenities, such as a washer/dryer combo. Bathrooms are uniform: tub, toilet, sink, surrounded by subway tile. Some variation in the kitchen layouts, but essentially the same representation across all the lines I've inhabited. Beds are comfortable, sheets are tight. HVAC can be a little challenging; a two bedroom unit was hard to keep warm in the middle of February. Artwork is interesting, promoting a sense of invention and innovation. Plenty of towels, a great counterpoint to Q&A's closest competitor, StayAKA Wall Street--they keep their towels under armed guard, apparently.

Finding your room can be a bit of challenge. 70 Pine was built in the early 1930s, and has all the art deco charm of that period. But it also means narrow, twisting hallways with lots of turns; getting lost is easy, but you'll find your way eventually.

One demerit: if you stay in your room even a few minutes past 11, the front desk calls relentlessly to see when you're leaving. This happens even if you arrange for late check out. It's a nuisance and not a problem, but it can be annoying.

This is a tight area of Manhattan, and the streets are narrow and most are one lane. Traffic is a problem, and because of this, noise is constant. This part of NYC still shuts down after 11pm though, so sleep shouldn't be a problem. 

Overall, Q&A offers a great experience, and depending on the day you book (weekends are cheapest), you can get substantial value for your money.

title: Really spacious studio apartment
text: We stayed in the Q&A for 5 nights over Easter and the first thing that struck us was how big the room was considering it is a studio apartment.  On checking in we were pleased to be told we had been upgraded to a deluxe studio and my husband happened to mention that we were over for my birthday, so when we got to our room they had left a lovely bottle of red wine for us with a birthday message - what a lovely touch. The kitchen is very well equipped - the only thing we noticed that was missing was a cheese grater but I'm pretty sure had we bothered to ask reception for one, they would have provided it! The hotel is located right opposite Wall Street station so is really handy for catching the subway and it is walkable to quite a few attractions including catching the boat to the Statute of Liberty and also the 911 memorial.  There is a lovely food hall/grocery store just down the road and a nice café on the ground floor next door.  Our room was cleaned very well each day and was always ready for us when we got back from our days out exploring.  I would thoroughly recommend this as a place to stay when visiting the city.

title: Enormous apartment
text: This apartment was extremely large by New York standards. My husband and son stayed with me and their was plenty of room for us all. The kitchen was large and had all the necessities. The walk in closet was also very large and was a great area to dress in.

title: Straordinario
text:
Eccellente soluzione in zona Wall Street
Che vi occorra per lavoro o per vacanza, il Q&A vi sorprenderà. 
Appartamenti ampi e modernissimi, con arredamento di gusto e particolari piacevoli come la cassa wifi Bose o la macchina del caffè in camere (caffè incluso)

Palestra superaccessoriata con attrezzatura modernissima, bar interno e Supermercato a 20 metri fornitissimo di piatti pronti e non. 

Proprio di fronte c’e la fermata della metro Wall Street e in 10 minuti a piedi sarete al One World Observatory e al museo del 9/11.

Doorman h24 

Prezzo concorrenziale, credo sia difficile trovare di meglio a NYC

title: Muy recomendable
text:
Me alojé en el hotel durante 10 noches con mi esposo e hijo.  Las habitaciones son enormes, tal cual se ven en la web.  La cocina está muy bien equipada e impecable.  Lo recomiendo para familias con niños ya que es muy cómodo y la cocina completa es un plus súper importante.  
En el mismo edificio hay un café y un supermercado que también ofrece comidas preparadas para llevar. 
Sin dudas volvería

title: Execelent apart en wal strett
text: Estuvimos 10 Dias con nuestros Hijos. Excelente todo. MUY RECOMENDABLE. ALEX nos bindi todo lo necesario para estar muy comodos. La ubicacion es muy buena muy rapidamente llegas a time square. puedes cocinar en tu habitation. Hay un super Mercado para comparison a una cuadra

title: Great potential, but issues for business travelers
text:
Traveled here with a colleague for business and we stayed in one of the two bedroom units.  Room was well laid out and the staff were very polite.  If I were here on vacation, the room would have been near perfect, but when you are staying for work, reliable Wi-Fi is a requirement.  Unfortunately, the Wi-Fi is less than reliable and when it does work it is achingly slow.  They are far behind other hotels in this area.  We spoke with some other guests, and they had the same opinion.  The hotel staff acknowledged it, but could not solve the issue.  This is something that management must address.   Housekeeping also could improve a bit.  They just need to pay more attention to the details.  But overall, it was ok.

If they fix those issues, this hotel will be darn near perfect, but until they do, it will leave a gap for those of us that have to work constantly.  We have another extended stay scheduled for the end of the summer and will also back in the fall.  We will be checking to see if they improve the Wi-Fi.  If they do, this place will be phenomenal and we will stay here as our NY base.  If they don't, business travelers should look elsewhere.

title: Ideal pour première visite
text:
Un magnifique Hotel au design épuré et classe. Premier voyage à New-York pour ma compagne et moi même. Nous étions dans un studio Exécutif en surclassement. Top confort 75 m2 qui permet de se sentir comme à la maison. L'objectif était de cuisiner pour réduire les frais de restaurant. Mission accomplie car la cuisine est magnifique, grande, appareil dernier cris.
Au niveau du ménage c'est top, un réassort est effectué tout les jours. 

Nous étions au 3e étage , sur la rue qui donne sur Pine Street. C'était assez bruyant car travaux à proximité et sirène de pompier assez fréquente. Pour ce dernier point de toute façon je crois que ca fait parti de New-York, exactement comme on le voit dans les films, toujours avec des sirènes de Police ou de pompier partout :-)
Egalement le store qui laisse passé la lumière c'était moyen. Surtout pour nous qui aimons le noir complet pour dormir. Mais ca allait quand même.
Le lit king Size , hauteur sous plafond de 3,5m ,top confort plus le dressing ajoute à cette chambre un cachet en plus.

Localisation Super à 2 pas du métro Wall street ( ligne 2 et 3 qui dessert time square).
Un Duane Reade dans la rue pour faire ses courses et également un supermarché en sous bassement de l'immeuble.
Idéal mais attention quand même car la nourriture aux état unis est quand même assez chere et pas très bonne. 
Pas tres loin de Battery Park pour la statue de la liberté et à 2 pas également de Ground Zéro.

Je recommande sans hésiter pour un couple independant qui cherche un endroit top confort pour se reposer apres des longues ballades toute la journée.

Gregory G

title: Incredible value for money.
text:
I arrived at this hotel with high expectations due to the positive reviews and it certainly delivered. The hotel was easy to find within close proximity to many subway stations. The hotel itself looks outstanding - the decoration is simply unique and highly creative.
Upon arrival I was complimentary upgraded to a bigger room which I was thrilled about. The rooms are massive. I doubt you will find a hotel room with as much space anywhere else in New York. The room was also in pristine condition and had everything you could hope for (TV with Netflix, iPod dock, full kitchen, cutlery, plates etc). I was seriously impressed. The room was kept clean by service staff and the hotel desk were very helpful in my queries on the local area.

Now the only downsides were that a large deposit was asked for upon arrival, which I was not aware of (so beware). Also, I didn't get this deposit totally back in full despite cleaning my own room to an immaculate standard everyday. (I lost about $2 with no explanation) - One thing that irks me is that the kettle was broken when I arrived in my room and they replaced it, so it's annoying I didn't get all my money back.

Despite that there isn't much to complain about. I doubt you will get better value for money anywhere else in New York and if I ever come back I will certainly be staying at this hotel again.

title: As Advertised, absolutely beautiful & modern!
text: Stayed at this hotel over St Patrick’s Day wknd. As advertised, it was absolutely beautiful, very modern, & an overall wonderful experience. From the Times Square area we took the 3 train to South Ferry. If you can jump off at Wall St it will get you even closer (about a block away) however, due to the time we had to take it all the way to South Ferry. From there it was about a 10 minute easy walk. ~ Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and accommodating. One staff mbr even walked us to the elevator. ~ Hotel was everything we could have wanted and more. Very beautiful and everything looked brand new. Regardless of what you are doing in the city, this hotel is well worth the ride. One thing to keep in mind is that parking is not included. Parking in a nearby garage will run you about $40 a night. We opted to leave our car with a friend in a cheaper location and take the subway in. Next time I think we’ll leave it in NJ and take the ferry over.  One last thing to note is that the walls seemed kind of thin. We could hear people and staff talking outside our room the next morning and they weren’t yelling by no means...just normal conversation. It didn’t bother us because we were already awake but if you are noise sensitive this may be a concern. I didn’t notice any kids around either which was nice because although we have kids, it was just us on this trip. We will definitely stay here again! In my opinion, the best place to stay in the city AND it’s at an affordable price point!

title: Excellent Wall Street Residential Hotel
text: I found this apartment hotel by chance. My family and I spent a weekend here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms are spacious, modern and comfortable with fully fitted kitchen. Cool vibe. Great for a short or long stay. The location is ideal  for Wall Street. The staff are genuinely friendly and extremely helpful. I can't recommend highly enough and would definitely return.

title: Très bel hotel
text:
Très bel hôtel dans un des building mythique des années 30 à l'architecture art déco. Le hall à lui seul vaut le détour. Très belles chambres ou plutôt appartements tout confort. 
Un peu bruyant même la nuit, mais super bien placé, en face du métro ligne 2 et 3 qui desservent Time Square. Proche de Battery Park pour la statue de la Liberté et à 100 m de Wall Street et du temple mondial de la finance.
Pour les courses, un Duane tout proche dans la même rue.

title: Newest Favorite NYC Hotel
text: I love the Q&A Residential hotel.  It is now my new favorite NYC hotel.  With the full kitchen, spacious bathroom, and nicely appointed features, this hotel provided everything I need for an extended business trip into the financial district. Issues were resolved quickly and with a smile.   Thank you Q & A for providing an alternative to the classic, small and not very inviting hotel atmosphere that can exist with large chains.!!!  See ya'll next week!

title: Annoying little problems.
text:
1) We were not informed that the hotel fee would be charged up front
2) There was a system error that required an additional charge to my credit card after we left the Q&A
3) Nobody informed us about the the additional charge before the charge, despite the up-front payment had the exact value of the reservation
4) Despite my reservation for a luxury room, I was allocated to a room that had the noise of a work outside the building that used to start early in the night and take the whole night
5) When I complained with your front desk the first solution was: "I can give you some ear plugs"
6) Then I complained a lot more and the next answer I received was: "This is New York"
7) I kept complaining and I felt tired and told the people of the front desk to find a solution. I went out to attend a commitment and when I came back I was allocated to another room.
8) This room (433) had not the noise from the outside works, but before dawn there was a continuously growing sound that suddenly disappeared. I suspect this was a service elevator. But I remained in the room and stopped complaining, because the noise could not be heard in the bedroom.
9) Your cleaning team seems not be properly trained. In room 433 one day, the cleaning person forgot to clean the bedroom bathroom. Probably because its door is hidden by the bedroom's door when the last is totally open. I complained and from then on, the bedroom was properly cleaned.

title: Lovely!
text:
Conveniently located in the financial district. The room was always clean, staff were pleasant.  My only complaint would be the fridge had a bit of an odour.  Check in process was quick and easy, everything was ready.  When I requested more toiletries they were sent up immediately.  The coffee shop located at this hotel is great too.
Rooms are a nice size, good TV channel selection.  Wifi wasn't the best.

title: NYC Get Away Trip
text: This hotel is located perfectly in NYC. Upon arrival I was treated with the upmost friendly staff. Then I opened the door to my room to a jaw dropping room. This was hands down the best hotel I’ve ever stayed at. The bed was super comfortable, the entire place is very clean including modern appliances. You will walk in the door and feel right at home. Also, if your at the front desk be sure to ask for Marshall. His friendly service is backed with knowledge of the best local bars in the area. With Marshall’s knowledge, and the amazing overall stay, you have to book Q&A.

title: Great find in NYC
text:
Stayed for 5 nights in a one bed/two bath apartment with our daughter who had rollaway bed.  This apartment was just what it said on the tin! Ticked all the boxes, fully functioning kitchen, plenty of space, great firm bed, clean, close to subway, super close to 4 grocery stores and two good coffee shops.

We stayed on 3rd floor and happily didn’t notice any street noise.  The apartment had loads a comfortable chill out space, dining area and work area. 

The apartments are located within a huge Art Deco skyscraper which is fantastic.

In a city that doesn’t allow Airbnb this is the obvious choice for people wanting an apartment type stay that is legal.  It gives so much more than a regular suite in a hotel.

I happen to like this area, it’s not touristy but the lacks the restaurants other areas have, however a quick trip on the subway to those areas is easy. 

This model is what travellers want - please open more such apart-hotels in NY.

I will definitely stay here again if they keep their rates competitive.

title: Hidden Gem near South Street Seaport
text: We stayed at the hotel after the Women's March on Saturday. It was a great deal through Booking.com and we were really just looking for a place to rest after a full day's activities. What we got was a whole lot more. Great location. Beautifully decorated and well-appointed. Everything you could ask for and much more. Comfortable king-sized bed. Full kitchen. Staff were extremely accommodating, pleasant and professional at check in and responded quickly to our request for late check out....thank you, Alex! We have already begun to look at dates for our next visit......this place is great for folks like us from NJ or the surrounding area who want to spend a weekend....or if you are visiting from anywhere and want to feel more of a Airbnb home-like experience.....this is it! The hotel has only been open for two years so it is still relatively unknown but that will not last.

title: Appartement/hotel ideal
text:
Nous avons eu la chance d'être surclassé lors de notre séjour. 
Un chambre avec 2 salles de bain avec baignoire. Cuisine complête.
Je le recommande chaleureusement.
Seul le petit déjeuner est ridicule mais la rue est pleine de snack où déjeuner.

title: Second visit
text:
Spent another Christmas holiday at the Q& A.  Great accommodations.  Love, love, love the new market.  They have a grand selection of prepared food then downstairs there is a full on high end supermarket.  A great addition to this perfect hotel.  It is located in lower Manhattan which has lots of historical sites.  We spent an xtra day this year so we could see a few more attractions.  We went to the Oculus.  What a fantastic piece of architecture.  I felt like I was in a building in the 25th Century.  Q&A is within walking distance of many historical sites.  Hoe to go back a third time soon.  The room is spacious and the Kitchen is a great convenience.  My dog was a welcome guest and he was able to make friends at the local dog park 2 blocks away.  
Thanks Q&A for making our holiday a great one, again.

title: Great stay!!!
text: Me and my partner stay in a executive studio, really nice room with all the commodities you need to feel like u are home. Great service when it comes to any requests we had, plus good housekeeping service.  We had a chance to go to black fox cafe... nice service...It’s near to the oculus building, 911 memorial, a lot of shopping stores. Nice place, close to a lot of turístico places and nice sightseeing. We really enjoy our stay, love front desk people and management. Great service overall, we like it so much that we are planning to go back next month.

title: Tutto perfetto. O quasi...
text:
Soggiorno di 10 giorni in famiglia. 
Ho prenotato 2 appartamenti deluxe, entrambi molto confortevoli, spaziosi(55 mq) e dotati di microonde, frigorifero, lavastoviglie ecc. 
Buona la qualità di lenzuola, asciugamani, accappatoi, piatti, bicchieri e accessori vari.
Ottima la location, storico grattacielo appena ristrutturato, diverse fermate della metropolitana nei dintorni( quella di Wall Street proprio di fronte, ma attiva solo nei giorni feriali).
Downtown è una zona sottovalutata, ma in pochi minuti a piedi si possono visitare il World Trade Center, il ponte di Brooklyn, Statua della Libertà ecc.
A pochi passi dalla struttura ristoranti, supermercati e negozi di tutti i generi. 
In venti minuti di metropolitana si arriva in Midtown, in poco più di un'ora all'aeroporto di JFK(in taxi si spende 52$).
Un consiglio :NON prenotate direttamente, io l'ho fatto e non ho avuto neanche un dollaro di sconto rispetto alla tariffa trovata sui noti motori di ricerca. 
Secondo disponibilità avrei avuto diritto all'upgrade gratuito delle stanze( non disponibile, e ci può stare) e al late check out. Avendo il volo di ritorno in tarda serata ho chiesto di tenere, anche a pagamento, almeno un appartamento. Mio fratello aveva la febbre alta e la temperatura esterna era sottozero, ma nonostante ciò non mi è stato accordato NEANCHE il late check out, e alle 11 ho dovuto lasciare l'hotel. Sono riuscito a trovare un altro hotel vicino alla modica cifra di 200$.
Attenzione al cliente pari a zero, peccato perché tutto il resto è stato perfetto.

title: Always rockin!
text:
Much love to the whole staff as usual. The new cat Jehu! And Alex, JP.. and everyone there that I can’t remember at the moment. We are native NY’ers but we stay at the Q&A whenever we want an awesome giant luxurious hotel room and we always get shown VIP treatment above and beyond the call of duty.. its our go to for quite some time and will continue to be for years to come! 

Another amazing stay for my lady’s Birthday! The night audit guys, Luis in maintenance and Michelle and Chanelle.. great room, great time!

title: 5 adultes 4 couchages
text:
Hélas, triple hélas. Je suis dans l'obligation de mettre la note de 1/5.
Séjour du 22/12 au 28/12/ 2017
À notre arrivée il manquait un lit.
Le réceptionniste nous a expliqué que le " lit d'appoint " et installé que si il y en a de disponible et la il n'y en a plus. Le cinquième couchera parterre!!!!
1) Très étonné que pour un adulte se soit un lit d'appoint et que pour cette nuit il n'y en a pas. Qui gère les réservations dans cet hôtel?  Réservation faite un mois avant notre arrivée.
2) le réceptionniste nous précise que cela ne serait pas arrivé si nous avions réservé en direct et non pas avec un partenaire. Merci pour le partenaire.
Qui a mal fait son travail? L'hôtel où le partenaire?
3) Après une longue discussion devenant "agitée" le lit c'est transformé en matelas conflable. L'heure étant tardive ( minuit) nous avons accepté par dépit cette solution pour cette première nuit.
4) Miraculeusement  le matelas gonflable c'est transformé en lit d'appoint sur roulettes.
Lit plutôt adapté à un enfant qu'un adulte de corpulence normale.
Nous nous en sommes contentés pour tout le séjour.
5) Le lendemain, pas un mot d'excuse, pas un geste commercial, RIEN.
Je ne recommande pas cet hôtel pour cette attitude inexcusable.
Dommage car les deux appartements étaient confortables et conformes à nos attentes.
Personnellement de chambre efficace.

title: Ótimo hotel.
text:
Ótimo Hotel. Equipe altamente qualificada para atendimento. Tudo que precisamos resolver, mesmo sem inglês fluente, fomos prontamente atendidos. Localização muito boa no distrito financeiro, perto de estação de metro nos dias de semana (menos de 50 metros) e de muitas outras 24 (horas) por dia, a menos de 10 minutos andando.
O quarto é excelente, com ótimo tamanho e cozinha totalmente equipada. Perto de grandes pontos turísticos na região e de diversos restaurantes e cafeterias.

title: Auch kinderfreundlich
text: Super zentral gelegenes Hotel. Wir waren mit einem Kleinkind dort und es fehlte uns an nichts. Für das Baby gab es ein separates Babybett und einen Hochstuhl. Die Ausstattung des Apartments war sehr gut.

title: Fantástico!
text:
Check in ultra rápido.
Em frente à estação Wall Street, linha 2 e 3.
Quarto enorme comparado aos padrões de NY.
Cozinha completa, com geladeira grande, forno, cooktop, lava louças, utensílios diversos. Tudo novo, muito limpo.
Cama king, super confortável.
Lençóis e toalhas de primeira linha.
Café, chá e leite gratuito diariamente até às 10h00.
Recepção adorável, super disposta a ajudar e dar diversas dicas.
Wi-fi grátis de alta velocidade.
Smartv grande com canais a cabo e diversos aplicativos instalados.
Tomadas em diversos pontos do quarto para recarregar dispositivos móveis.
Diversos elevadores atendem o andar de forma rápida.
Aquecimento interno agradável.
Ar condicionado do quarto super silencioso.
Banheiro grande, com banheira. Kits de banho da marca L'Occitane.
Através do app do celular você pode pedir serviço de despertador, reposição de toalhas e funciona, super rápido.
Três observações:
1. Falta cortina blackout - quem tem dificuldade para dormir na claridade, sofre um pouquinho.
2. Na véspera e no dia de Natal, a arrumadeira bateu na nossa porta às 09h00 para arrumar o quarto.
3. A estação de metrô em frente ao hotel não funciona aos sábados, domingos e feriados.

title: Great place to stay in a quieter part of NYC
text:
The Q & A is a great place to stay. Having the full kitchen enables you to have a few cheaper meals while in NYC.  The rooms also had good entertainment with smart tv's and a wireless speaker.

There's also plenty of food options around the area, we sampled Mexican and Greek but there were also many others such as an irish pub and a nice looking sushi restaurant. The Q&A also has an attached coffee shop 'Black Fox' which had really nice coffees, cakes and snacks.

The staff were friendly and helpful with all our queries. We also found it nice to stay in a quieter neighborhood over the holiday period. The subway stations are all close enough for easy transport links.

title: Hotel stay QandA
text: This place if amazing.  I stayed for 12 days.  Rooms impeccable. Staff friendly and extremely helpful.  Would not hesitate to stay here again also a workout room, sauna, and great coffee shop in lobby.  A GEM.

title: affordable & excellent
text: I am truly amazed with this hotel. It is ultra modern and clean. The location is excellent. It is in a stylish old style building. the wifi is fast. the front desk service was smiling and efficient. It is very difficult to find such a hotel in new york at affordable prices

title: Very convenient
text:
We stayed for a little over a week in an executive studio, so it was great to have a full kitchen and dining room; we could cook and eat takeout in comfort.  Since there were three of us, we had an extra bed in the little "office" area.  The extra bed was an air mattress, but it was pretty comfortable. The only issue was that at first, it was not covered with a fitted cotton bed sheet, but there were blankets, so I thought at first it was really supposed to be that way. A few nights later, a fitted sheet was placed on it, so I guess housekeeping forgot.  Our apartment was clean, and it was very spacious.  There was a self-service laundry on the same floor. 

The location is great - I think most tourists go to Midtown, but the Financial District is pretty interesting.  The WTC Memorial is walking distance, and so is Battery Park.  There are several shops and restaurants around the hotel, though many of them are closed during the weekends.  We mostly relied on a supermarket around the corner that sells prepared food and is not only open during the weekends, it also opens early and closes late.  

There's a metro station just across the street, and other stations are a few blocks away, so it's easy to get to other parts of the city.  

We were happy that we chose Q&A.

title: Incredible rooms!
text: This is a great lower Manhattan hotel. The rooms were so phenomenal that our four teenage girls took 20 minutes taking photos of them! The rooms were clean, spacious, and quiet by NYC standards. The lightning is a little dark, and some of the subway stations are closed on the weekends, but these inconveniences were minor compared to the space and value of the rooms. We've stayed in several other Manhattan properties, and the Q&A is now our favorite!

title: Amazing stay at Q&A
text: Amazing stay. Special shout out to Channelle, Alex and Tracy for their hospitality. Tracy willingly helped me with all of my gigantic suitcases. Would not make it without his kindness. Keep up the good work!!!

title: Girls Christmas trip
text:
On a girls trip to see NYC at Christmas. We were able to secure this wonderful hotel in the Financial district, after leaving our first hotel reserved two months in advance. (Terrible).  
This is a residential building on Pine street. The Q&A owns six floors. They are apartment homes with fully equip kitchens, modern appliances. We had a one bedroom suite with two large bathrooms and a separate small working area with a cool desk and lamps. And two large TV's. The apartments are furnish with comfortable modern furniture. I slept in a very comfortable twin size rollaway bed in the living area and had a bathroom all to myself. The hotel is very quiet. We occasionally heard a car pick or dropping someone off. There's a great cafe in the first floor with breakfast and coffee called the black box. This a no frills hotel. No concierge or special services. My only complaint was housekeeping. Clean towels were left, beds were semi made. 
The hotel is across the street from a decent bar. And within walking distance of subways and One World Trade Center. Don't miss the Oculus for great shopping and restaurant.

title: By far best hotel downtown NYC
text:
Diane Lee front desk manager was accommodating when I asked for a late check out. I signed up for the friends with benefits rewards at the hotel I was a little disappointed about not getting the free upgrade based on availability but it's understandable the hotel seems to come across a lot of guests which is obvious. I have read recent reviews about people being forced out of the hotel at 11am. I have to say my experience was not this. I simply
emailed the front desk in which Diane lee honored my request to check out at 1pm. 

Axel Fischer, general manager is a very kind gentlemen answering my email about a concern with my bill statement he was extremely professional and timely he handled my situation with kindness and respect. It is very hard to find a manager these days who is able to take the time to listen to a concern and to accommodate that person without any negativity. I believe this manager is running an extremely organized and professional environment and I can tell that the management at this hotel prides themselves on trying to accommodate every guest in the most fair way possible. I also feel they keep this establishment in great conditions and makes sure the staff is also on board. 

The rooms are EXACTLY how they appear in the photo I purchased the executive suite and it was the exact replica of the websites photo. The rooms are extremely spacious and I mean it is more than enough room it's exactly like an apartment and the rooms are very neatly organized with massive closet space and plenty of plush towels. 

Also would like to mention the bathroom a past review said there wasn't enough space for toiletries to be placed in the bathroom however my boyfriend and I noticed towards the last day of our stay that the huge mirrors open up into spacious cabinets for you to load any toiletries so if you're in the bathroom please check out the mirrors and you'll find a wonderful surprise. 

The only
Downside to bathroom is the shower drain I believe because this is an older building the drains are slow or clogged. It could have been our room but I'm praying next stay we get a great shower that drains. 

Hotel to me was very quiet I keep reading comments about loud noises there is however the occasional garbage trucks but it's a very quick drive by and I live in upstate ny where it's very quiet and I still hear garbage trucks on garbage day don't think this is something we can ever really get away from. 

The beds were very comfortable with huge soft pillows and enough blankets to keep warm. I also am in love with the smart tv's I think this is by far the best idea to have a smart tv in a hotel room and that many other hotels should adopt this idea. Basic cable just Isnt enough these days so kudos Q and A for this. 

All in all
Stay was very pleasant and relaxing and we are planning to stay again next month the friends with benefits rewards is the best way to go they give you discounts on your bday month and also a free gift. I am hoping for the upgrade next time to the two bedroom suite as I hear it's the best! 

If you're in this area please stay here the prices are amazing and you get more than what you pay for.

title: Lots of space, slightly difficult location
text:
The rooms have a ton of space compared to the traditional NYC hotel room without the crazy expense that tends to come with square footage in NYC. The staff was extremely welcoming & responsive to any request. Our Wifi went down & they had someone in our room to check on it within 10 minutes. The kitchen came stocked with the necessities needed & cribs or pack & plays are available if you bring a little one. The financial district becomes significantly quieter on the weekends leading to less stores & restaurants that are open or more limited hours.

Tip: There is a lot of construction on the subway lines to this area, especially on the weekends. The 2 & 3 were not running at night to the financial district leaving you with the 4 & 5. Something to be aware of when you want to make it back to the hotel late at night!

title: Love Love Love
text: We were traveling with our almost 2 year old and this place was perfect. We had lots of room plus a full kitchen which was nice to make her breakfast in the morning and to have a fridge for her leftovers and snacks. Plus we had a place to store water and milk. The staff was friendly and helpful. They accommodated us to an early check in. The room was very clean and nice. Close to battery park, Wall Street and soho area. There was a subway station close by so we could get anywhere easily. Will definitely stay again

title: Amazing accommodation, excellent rooms and great staff
text:
We had a Studio Apartment and we were absolutely amazed by the standards of the room. The furniture was modern, funky and contemporary. The kitchens are more than adequately equipped if you did want to cater for yourselves with all the utensils required plus all the mod cons including Kettle, Toaster, Coffee Maker, Microwave, Oven, Hob, Dishwasher, Fridge Freezer etc. 
Flat Wide Screen TV has Spectrum including on demand etc - UK Equiv to Sky I think !
Plug sockets included direct USB connections so no need for adapters. As soon as we had settled in our room we had a knock at the door to welcome us and wish us all the best with a bottle of wine as we were celebrating an anniversary too. Very nice touch !
Q&A has the Wall Street 2&3 Metro stop almost opposite the entrance so ideal for connections to Times Square.
All of the team we met with were lovely and friendly and a special mention goes to Marshall who by far outshone on his service, Thanks again for all your help and such a great stay. We will definately stay here again

title: Crazy good deal for a TON of space!
text: I stayed with three friends last weekend, and I was honestly wary of the great price for the large space. Nothing to worry about, it was lovely! Two full bathrooms, large living space, full kitchen, bedroom, it was perfect for us!

title: Amazing apartment
text: Space in NYC is rare.  Affordable space is even rarer. Q&A gave us both. We LOVED the apartment. Layout was sleek, clean and modern. Building is historic. Chanelle was lovely. Location is downtown near Wall Street with plenty of transportation options, restaurants, bars and groceries nearby.  Plus walking distance to Observatory Tower, Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge, Tribeca, etc.  Loved it. Will be back!

title: Excellent appartement à Wall St
text:
Excellent appartement en plein coeur de Wall St et à quelques minutes à pieds de plusieurs stations de métro.

Nous avons séjourné 12 nuits entre décembre 2016 et janvier 2017 et nous n'avons eu aucuns soucis. Les appartements sont grands, luxueux et très bien équipés. Le personnel de ménage fait bien sont travail et l'appartement est resté propre durant tout le séjour.

L'accès à l'étage dédié au petit déjeuner est un plus mais nous avons eu très peu de choix : café, lait, quelques fruits et gateaux : dommage de ne pas proposer l'indispensable jus de fruit !

La station de métro en face à 20m ferme assez tôt en semaine et n'ouvre pas le WE malgré tout il y en a une autre à quelques minutes donc au final cela n'est pas génant.

Je recommande !

title: Great Stay
text: This hotel is wonderful. We have an 8 month old baby and this was perfect. We had a full kitchen and a one bedroom apartment. There was tons of storage and it was very spacious. It is very close to subway stops and various attractions. The hotel staff was very friendly. The only time we had a problem was when housekeeping did not show up and we had to request for them to come. The housekeepers were rude and acted as if we were inconveniencing them. Other than that, our stay was quite pleasant. Only suggestion is to have more light fixtures as it was a little dark. VERY QUIET and clean and modern!

title: Great Room for a Family - More Apt than Hotel
text: We were able to exchange our timeshare for a stay at the Q&A for Thanksgiving week and it was a great choice.  Room was spacious and we pre-arranged for a rollaway for my teenage daughter.  Location was great - directly across from Wall Street subway and close walk to other stops in the financial district.  Staff was very nice.  Compared to other postage sized hotel rooms in the city, we thought it was a great option.  Hope to be able to come back again.

title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY
text:
The general manager of this hotel, Axel, is awful and shouldn’t work in the hospitality industry. 

Two days here was hell on earth. The showers didn’t work. When I notified Axel, he told me there was a Duane Reade nearby for Draino. Their $2000 fridge isn’t frost free and died five minutes into my stay. Garbage trucks go by at 1am for over an hour. The TV was broken and took 3 hours to fix. Then the WiFi went out. And another 3 hours of my time wasted. 

I thought once Management was notified of all these problems, they’d be as horrified as me. On the contrary, instead of issuing me the refund the night manager said would be issued, the general manager began trying to negotiate how much would be refunded. At over $400 a night, you’d expect CLASS - not The Price is Right. 

Don’t waster your time and money. There are much nicer hotels in NYC.

title: Outstanding Value, Spacious Accommodations in Lower Manhattan
text: The Q&A hotel is an outstanding value. We booked a double deluxe room (least expensive standard room) and were given a huge studio with a king-sized bed, walk-in closet, large bathroom, full kitchen (including dishwasher) and foyer. The spaciousness of the room was remarkable. The location, next to the Wall Street subway station and a block and a half from the New York Stock Exchange, is convenient for quickly getting to other parts of the city but also a little odd. If you are looking to walk out of your hotel into a lively New York street scene, this is not the place. The combination of narrow streets and tall buildings in and around Wall Street creates a dark, closed-in effect that is not appealing. On the other hand, the Freedom Tower, 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park and the Staten Island Ferry are all within easy walking distance. The hotel itself appears to occupy the bottom floors of an Art Deco office building that has been converted to residences. The entrance and lobby areas look like an office building, not a hotel. Overall, the Q&A wins on value and spaciousness but the location is not ideal.

title: Tracy Matthews made my stay extremely better!
text: You walk in the room, everything you pretty much need is there to make you feel right at home. The elevators are secure with key access only. Full kitchen, I cooked a full spread of baked chicken, etc. Just to give you an idea. One thing, my heat went out. There was a language barrier with the other staff I notified, so I spent the evening in layers, cold. Tracy came to the room, full of energy, professionalism and SUPERB customer service. Even though the Dir of Operations promised to follow up with me and didn't, Tracy made sure I had the things I needed to sleep well tonight. Kudos to you Tracy!! If you come here say hi to him!

title: What a great place!
text: I stayed here twice recently and have no complaints the rooms are modern, spacious and clean. Staff is friendly and the location is great! We have recommended this hotel to a friend who will be staying there next month and will continue to recommend. My only negative is both rooms i stayed im had this creepy owl in the bathrooms.

title: Lots of space for a great price
text: Best value for a hotel room that I’ve ever gotten in New York City. I only needed a hotel room for two nights, and I had a large one bedroom apartment with a kitchen.  I would definitely stay there again if I needed to be downtown.

title: Great amenities, close to subway
text: A great hotel a block from Wall St. From the moment we checked in, all staff were very helpful and friendly. Right across the road from the Wall St subway station that takes you to all key uptown locations however note this is closed after 10pm everyday and on weekends. At these times there are other close by stations  that are not more than a 10 minute walk way. Close to loads of eating places and a number of shops. Great hotel amenities  (gym, business services, laundry) and room itself very spacious and clean with an extensive cable tv channel selection. For NY, we found this to be very affordable and highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Unbelievable Room
text: I’m still in shock at how nice our room is.   It’s huge!!  Full kitchen, tasteful decorations, nice couch and lots of pillow on the comfy bed.   All parts of this hotel smell good and it’s very very clean.  Third time in NYC in a year and this is by far the most exquisite place we’ve stayed.  The check in process was seamless and Martin went above and beyond for us.   Subways very close and a little market below was great. You will not be sorry you booked here!

title: Enormous studios with top notch design, detail and cleanliness.
text: Enormous studios with full kitchens and secondary lounge/office rooms with top notch design, detail and cleanliness. Excellent central financial district location 1 block from wall street. Tastefully done science themed design elements and a contemporary consistent grey/black white clean color palate room decor

title: Fabulous hotel, features and staff!
text: My daughter and I stayed here a few weeks ago; we had a wonderful stay.  Loved the location, room and staff.  The Financial District is much more residential now and there are lots of restaurant and shopping options (including a grocery store around the corner that had a good selection of essentials plus a Whole Foods not too much of a hike away).  Subway is right across from the building and will take you to all the major areas. It was great to be tossed around by the crowds in the tourist areas of NYC all day and then come back to our cozy apartment to relax and rewind. We felt like locals living in our trendy Art Deco building and fabulous apartment.  Thank you Q&A; we can't wait to come back!

title: Fantastic!
text: My husband and I stayed here with two of our three sons (one had to stay at Uni, so sadly missed out!) and had a fantastic four day break, staying in two separate rooms.  Could not recommend this place enough.  Fantastic, spacious rooms with lovely, big beds and fresh white bed linen.  The beautifully equipped kitchen area meant that we could have our coffee in the morning and share a delicious healthy takeaway from the nearby food market/shops in the evening, which we preferred to eating out all the time.  A short subway journey and you were where you wanted to be, so don't be put off that it's in the Financial District.
